translation.line: Cloths belonging to the *Sogdian Krrapūśira from a certain *Surade. In this account, thirteen chās are (still) owed of them/to me(?).
23 cloths belonging to Si Vidatta son of Sargīsa.
16 cloths belonging to Nuṃdārrjuṃ of Pajūma(?). The biśta’s(?) cloths became [...].
Among the ...-s of Pajūma, Nuṃdārrjuṃ the biśta’s(?) men (are) 7. So if (it was) 53 mūrās per man, his mūrās became 371 [= 53x7].
... (has) 3 army men. His cloths became *53. The working men (were) 13. For each man 2. His cloths became [26].
... *Ḍī Kvāṃ (Ling Gong?) (had) 12 men. So if (it was) 52 mūrās per man, his mūrās became 636 [= 13x52!].
... *army men (were) 4. The cloths were — chās. The working men, their cloths were [...].

comments.comment: Not the same doc. as IOL Khot 2/2.
Cf. Hedin 42, a list of army persons owing (missing) in various towns.

And 18th day of Mūñaṃja, Nuṃdārrjuṃ of Pajūma(?) delivered 1[x] hemp cloths. ...

comments.comment: Not the same doc. as IOL Khot 2/1.

translation.line: Lattärhaṃ’s wife accepts her into (her) jurisdiction. If the wife ... the husband ...
... afterward in her jurisdiction. But as for her daughter, Yaśāśärī Khattunä by name,
the spāta raises (her). When she grows up, then Lattärhaṃ ... her ...
... and he himself provides her with a husband. And whatever in future *time
... she has ...-ed. Whoever may change this polished and settled case, [to] the court
he will pay ... mūrās and receive 30 strokes. And then
[this writ takes effect when] Lattärhaṃ puts his finger on it. These

comments.comment: Rest of scroll. Tracing of left-hand thumb and index finger on verso. AKh., pl. CX; Stein, 1933, pl. 33A.

translation.line: ... 17 days. This writ is for the reason
[that] ... Puñārrjāṃ ... a thousand [mūrās] to make money for him(?) ...
... and if the land ... belonging to the spāta ...

comments.comment: With IOL Khot 3/6 to the right. Combined text:
Cf. Bunade D.(T.) 018 (IOL Khot 2/3); Puñade, Sude Or 11344/2; Sude, Śude Or 11252/2, etc.

recto.line: sā re • u ṣṭā tä ysā re ka lpa va ṣṭa ttä u ysno ra cu ha lci pyū vāʾ re ba lysā nu hva nau bi śvī drai śśu vā jā re • u sa tä· ysā re ka lpa va ṣṭa ttä ysno ra prā ṇā vā t· na pa thī sī ndä • du ṣka ra ha ḍ· sa rvva śū ra ttä

tä ye dā ti pyū ṣāʾ ma ta || ttī tä vā sa rvva śū rä mä stä ba lysū ña vū ysei ā ysa nna pa na tä sya ndai su ti vä tä pra ho ṇu pra ho ṣṭe hva ra ndau ysā nū śa ndo vä stā te kā mu hā lau gya stä ba lysä ā stä hā lsto na ma sä

te u haṃ ju da sta nā te gya stā nu gya stu ba lysu tta bra ṣṭe • tta ce rä vā gya sta ba lysa ttye u ysno ri kä ḍä gā nī nei haṃ bī sä hä mä te kye ttū saṃ ghā ṭu sū tru a pra mā nu ya nde • gya stā nu gya stä ba lysä tta hva

te pha rā ka sa rvva śū ra ttä u ysno ra kä ḍä gā nī nau haṃ bī su pa gyā ysā re • gya stā nu gya stä ba lysī tta hva te ma ne sa rvva śū ra mu ho dī ri kä ḍä gā ni haṃ bī su pu lsa kye va ju ā ya sa rvva śū ra u ysno rä

ce tte rä nu ba lysā nu kho dvā śu voʾ gaṃ gu voʾ nä tā tu ṣoʾ grū kyau sya ta u ttā nu ye ysu rgyä ṣṭā nä tta ra nda ru gu hei ku hū nä na rā mä tä cu ttye kä ḍä gā nä tta ttī kä ḍä tā nä mä sta rä hä mä te u ba śdai nei haṃ bī sä •

ttī tä sa rvva śū rä bo dhi sa tvä tta hva te se pha rā kä gya sta ba lysa pha rā kä mä ṣḍā na gya sta ba lysa • gya stä ba lysī tta hva te se ttye sa rvva śū ra bu ḍa ru kä ḍä gā nä hä mä te u ba śdai nei haṃ bī sä kye ma hā yā nu •

verso.line: dā tu vä tä o śu a ysmū pa ne mä te • pa dī ta ttä sa rvva śū ra u ysno ra hu va dī ta dyā ña || ttī tä vā sa rvva śū rä bo dhi sa tvä tta hva te tta kho vā gya sta ba lysa ttä u ysno ra pa rrä ta hä mā re ba lysī vā tta hva te se tta sa rvva śū ra

kho hva tai ttrā mu mā ña ndu sa rvva śū ra kho ye hvaʾ ndi ye ka ma lu pa täʾ ttä u ttī ye a ru veʾ saṃ kha lī o mā kṣī o śa ka ru o gu lu o gvī hu rrū ṇu o ku jsa tī nau ka ma lu vä tä • tta u spū stä rro sa rvva śū ra ṣä u ysno rä

hä mä te • sa rva śśu rä bo dhi sa tvä tta hva te se ne gya sta ba lysa gya stä ba lysī tta hva te se pā tcu sa rvva śū ra ttrā mu mā ña ndu ko ye śi tu hvaṃʾ du rrä jsei na kā ḍa rna pi hei u nai ye ha ḍe śä na pi hyū·

n[ä] na jī vä tu nā [tu] ya nä tta cu mā nau sa rvva śū ra ttye hvaʾ ndi vä ra ṇä hä mä te ṣai rro ha ḍe a ru vaʾ tce ra ttī tī ṣä vra ṇä haṃ bruī ttä • u cī tī ṣä vra ṇä haṃ bruī ttä ttī tä bu tte se a ysu

khä na pa rrä tä mä vaṃ ña mä jī vä tä nä ga tä hä mä tä ku bu ro jvī ñi ne ne gā vu a ysu a sä du dī ru hä ru ya nī mä hä ru ya nī mä ttrā mī ttu nä jsa ḍu sa rvva śū ra u ysno rä ttu tu ttau sau byā ta ya nde bi śyau dī ryau hä ryau

pa ·[ī] śtä • ttī tä bi śä hä ra byā ta ya nde u cī tä bi śśä hä ra byā ta yu ḍu ya nde ttī tī bi śśi śä ra hä ra hä mā re || ttrā mu mā ña ndu sa rvva śū ra bo dhi sa tva kho mu ḍye hvaʾ ndi mā rā pä ta ra

transcription.prose:
/// (nā)
sāre • u ṣṭātä ysāre kalpa vaṣṭa ttä uysnora cu halci pyūvāʾre balysānu hvanau biśvī draiśśu vājāre • u satä-ysāre kalpa vaṣṭa ttä ysnora prāṇāvāt(ä)na pathīsīndä • duṣkara haḍ(e) sarvvaśūra ttä-
täye dāti pyūṣāʾmata || ttītä vā sarvvaśūrä mästä balysūñavūysei āysanna panatä syandai suti vätä prahoṇu prahoṣṭe hvarandau ysānū śando västāte kāmu hālau gyastä balysä āstä hālsto namasä-
te u haṃju dasta nāte gyastānu gyastu balysu tta braṣṭe • tta cerä vā gyasta balysa ttye uysnori käḍägānīnei haṃbīsä hämäte kye ttū saṃghāṭu sūtru apramānu yande • gyastānu gyastä balysä tta hva-
te pharāka sarvvaśūra ttä uysnora käḍägānīnau haṃbīsu pagyāysāre • gyastānu gyastä balysī tta hvate ma ne sarvvaśūra muho dīri käḍägāni haṃbīsu pulsa kye va ju āya sarvvaśūra uysnorä
ce tteränu balysānu kho dvāśuvoʾ gaṃguvoʾ nätātuṣoʾ grūkyau syata u ttānu ye ysurgyä ṣṭānä ttarandaru guhei ku hūnä narāmätä cu ttye käḍägānä ttattī käḍätānä mästarä hämäte u baśdainei haṃbīsä •
ttītä sarvvaśūrä bodhisatvä tta hvate se pharākä gyasta balysa pharākä mäṣḍāna gyasta balysa • gyastä balysī tta hvate se ttye sarvvaśūra buḍaru käḍägānä hämäte u baśdainei haṃbīsä kye mahāyānu •
dātu vätä ośu aysmū panemäte • padīta ttä sarvvaśūra uysnora huvadīta dyāña || ttītä vā sarvvaśūrä bodhisatvä tta hvate tta kho vā gyasta balysa ttä uysnora parräta hämāre balysī vā tta hvate se tta sarvvaśūra
kho hvatai ttrāmu māñandu sarvvaśūra kho ye hvaʾndiye kamalu patäʾttä u ttīye aruveʾ saṃkhalī o mākṣī o śakaru o gulu o gvīhu rrūṇu o kujsatīnau kamalu vätä • tta uspūstä rro sarvvaśūra ṣä uysnorä
hämäte • sarvaśśurä bodhisatvä tta hvate se ne gyasta balysa gyastä balysī tta hvate se pātcu sarvvaśūra ttrāmu māñandu ko ye śitu hvaṃʾdu rräjseina kāḍarna pihei u nai ye haḍe śäna pihyū-
näna jīvätu nātu yanä tta cu mānau sarvvaśūra ttye hvaʾndi väraṇä hämäte ṣai rro haḍe aruvaʾ tcera ttītī ṣä vraṇä haṃbruīttä • u cītī ṣä vraṇä haṃbruīttä ttītä butte se aysu (du)-
khäna parrätämä vaṃña mä jīvätä nägatä hämätä ku buro jvīñi ne ne gāvu aysu asädu dīru häru yanīmä häru yanīmä ttrāmī ttu näjsaḍu sarvvaśūra uysnorä ttutu ttausau byāta yande biśyau dīryau häryau
pa(th)īśtä • ttītä biśä hära byāta yande u cītä biśśä hära byāta yuḍu yande ttītī biśśi śära hära hämāre || ttrāmu māñandu sarvvaśūra bodhisatva kho muḍye hvaʾndi mārā-pätara

comments.comment: The site no. D. v.2 written on the fragment appears to be a later addition. Suv C 19.15-19a.

transcription.prose:
/// (uysnau)-
rāṇu dukha bera hämāre kye ttu dātu apramānu yąnāre || ttätäye hvatye hvanai sarvaśśūrä mästä balysūña-
vūysai gyastānu gyastä balysi tta hvate dukha mä nä gyasta balysa ne kṣamīndä • dukha mä nä mäṣḍāna gyasta ba-
lysa nä kṣamīndä pyūṣṭä • || ttī ttu bāḍu gyastä balysä ttä gāha hvate • cu mānau ne usahyäta pyūṣṭä
ttäte pvaʾṇavīya salāva • haṃggūjsu naryo dukhyau jsa cu ttä vaśīvīndä uysnora 1 kye haḍä śśäru yī-
ndä śśäruī bīḍä (ky)e vā dīru yanīṃdä dukha vaśīvīdä naryo ṣṭāna crrāma karma yäḍāṃdä 2 ysyāmatu maraṇu
dukha kā(ṣk)ye (t)camäna basta uysnaura : jaḍa rro vā oṣku dukhautta suhi ju nyānartha ne (ī)ndä 3 hajva vā oṣku
suhautta balysä väte haurä nä byāta ṣada nä rro aśtä mahāyāña ttä ne avāyä ne tsīdi 4 tvī padī
karma sarvaśśūra paḍāṃjsya yanu byāta : batäna kiḍägānäna satva mästä vīvāgä barīndä 5
bata ku jve ttīma pärendä pharu ye vīvāgu pajāysde • ku ye ttu mäṣa byehäte balysāna ku karä ttīma
ne jīye 6 hajvānu ṣä suhä cu hayärīṃdi oṣku balysi parauya : cu ro parehāre häryau dīryau oṣkä ///

comments.comment: Actual: E. i.roll. Sgh [22] 42.11-43[7]. Neb., p. 13 (S2 19). Akh., pl. CXI.

secondary.siglum: Stein E. i.7: KT V, p. 79 (166)

dvo lo va dā voʾ dha rma dhā ttī nau ā kā śśa ma ṇḍa lä vī rä ʾī ndä • «†dha» «†rma» «†dhā» «†ttī» «†nau» «†ā» «†kā» «†ś[ś]a» «†ṇḍa» «†lä» «†vī» «†rä» ///

gya ba lysā nu [bu] ///

|| siddham namasīmä ggyasta balysa biśśä cu buro anantāprayaṃtt(-)o daśvo diśvo ttṛ-a(dhvu)o buddha-kṣe(tr)v(o) ///
dvo lovadāvoʾ dharmadhāttīnau ākāśśamaṇḍalä vīrä ʾīndä • ///
rmadhāttu pa(ra)ma ākāśa-dhāttu paryavasāna aparāṃ ṭī ttiṣṭhaṃda dharmakāyaprabhā(v-) ///

-ānu ·aṃ ·ī maṃ ·i pa gya(stānu) balysānu bu ///

transcription.prose:
trāmī u ttuśau ye uysānau vajsiṣḍe ku ye ttuśāttetu dye yīndi nai nä saṃtsera āspāta häme • pyūʾ thu bhai-
ṣajyasena mā salāvu muho hā haḍu hāʾmä bodhisatvānu käḍena u balysūñavūysā karīha ne khijāma-
to kaiʾndi styūda-vrata ṣkaugyānu gaṃjse byāta yanāre uysnorāṇu hāvu yanīdi tso thu hā kāmo diśo
gyastä balysä mājeina salāvänai brāska hvāña se śiru biysāndī grata-hvāñā ma jsau ju khiji gyasta balysa
u purdai māru haṃtsa hīñe jsa haṃtsa paʾñyau u śäre dātä bärūñaṃdei sarvvasatvānu uysnaurāṇu vaska hā-
vaṃgārä u kāmi dātä pyūvāʾñe ku ye thato balysä paname thatau tsu mäḍāna sthīra māvu śirate käḍä-
na ttāmu muhu ne panamāmane kāmu balysu na-ro dätu yanāma kye dvāvaredärśyätau lakṣaṇyau haṃphu-
te kvī pajsamu yanāmä • ttītä nä bheiṣajyasenä bodhisatvä tta hve se āysda yanīru uskyāstu se
cu daiya vaṃña ttītä ttä nūvarā satva uskālstuo uysdätānde paṃjsa se ysāre kulāra dätāndete hau-
dyau ratanyau kye ratanīnyau dāmyau pajusta u myāño nä haṣprīyä viysäte buśānätai ///

secondary.siglum: Stein E. i.7: KT V, p. 78 (165)

transcription.prose:
dasamo bhūmu väte vistāta hämāre u īmu ttu dhātīnau kūsu pajsabaʾjīndi • u ʾīmä nä mästä haṃphau
häme dai thu bhaiṣajyasena tte kulāra bhaiṣajyasenä bodhisatvä tta hve se daimä gyasta balysa daimä mäḍāna gya-
sta balysa īmu tte nūvarā satva dātīnau bāḍäna thānu byehīndä : u īmu tte biśānu śirā-
ṇu härāṇu bāgo haṃberīndä u īmu dātīnau kūsu kaljīndä u anaṃkhiṣṭa gyasta kye īmu dātu pa-
ysānīndä u pharāka īmu narīya uysnaura dīrvoʾ gavoʾ ṣṭāre kye gyastānu gyastä hajvattetīgyo dātä
hvāñāmato pyūvāʾre biśä saṃtsārīya dukha purrīndä paraṃjsa ni hamänīndä • ttītä ttu bāḍu nauvarenau-
tä ysāre kūla paḍāṃjsya hvąndä paḍā phārrä busta u biśe ttä uysnaura śäryo häryau haṃphuta hämāre
u bäśä ttä bheiṣajyasena uysnaura bäśyau dukhyau parsīnde u bäśä ttä bheiṣajyasena uysnaura gya-
sti balysä dyāmatu väte näta hämāre u bäśä ttä bheiṣajyasena uysnaura dhātīnaina bajāṣṇa haṃphva hä-
māri • ʾā́ysda yanu bheiṣajyasena tcahaurä hālā • ttī bheiṣajyasenä mästä balysūñavūysei dye biśä tcahauri hālā sarbaṃdäna ///

comments.comment: Actual: E. i.roll. Sgh [22] 256.10-258.2. Neb., p. 39 (S2 149). Akh., pl. CXI (“E. i 7”).

recto.line: hū saṃ kya saṃ ña gya ḍī na • kye ttu hū ña dai yä cu ni śtä pra ttyā tma ggau ca rä aṃ ggä pa ba

ra ta nī nai mā ñä tä vū ḍä di śa ra tna ke ttu a ggaṃ jsu • sa rva ñä ba ysä bri yū nä ṣī tta hva
pra ttyā tma ggau ca rä dvā su • ttä tä aṃ gga pra cai ʾī ñä pa ba sai ndä ja ḍī na a nā sta nä mu ///
kho ju cāʾ ya nä rmä ndä ha nda ru rū vu hū sa ndä śśā nye pā tco hų̄ ña dä te ha nda ///
ttrā mu ttä tä ja ḍī dvā su • pa ba stau jsī rgye ha nā sä a bhā vä na ttā rä ne byau re ku ///

verso.line: gga ndha rva na gga rä ṣa kaṃ tha nä hi rṣṭai ni śtä ttrā mu hi ra bi śśä a va da nda sa mu hi vi ///
ggrrī va ktrrä ggrrī ysä u ggrrī da sta uīʾ lo vi ye da śte ha ma tä saṃ ka lpä vi ka lpi saṃ bā ///
dyū lä bi ḍa ttaṃ da u bau rä haṃ du rna lo vī jñā nä dyū lä saṃ ka lpa vi ka lpa • saṃ bā ///
saṃ ka lpa mā trā • ā tma pa ri ka lpa mā ttrā ggeʾ ha vi ka lpa mā ttrā haṃ jsā rra saṃ ///
trā mu sa mu ja ḍī cu ṣkau ṅje sa mu kho ha jsā rra u pī sä vi jñā nä rū vä u yā va kā ///
ja ḍī ju hi rṣṭai ni śtä vi na a ysmuī ka rju ni byau de vi na ja ḍī a ysmū śśū kä ā gā śä ///

transcription.prose:
hūsaṃkya saṃña gyaḍīna • kye ttu hūña daiyä cu niśtä prattyātmaggaucarä aṃggä paba(st-)
bäysāndye saṃña ni huśtä viñānä harbiśśä ʾīste • ttathāggatadharmä haraysde • nika ///
ratanīnai māñätä vūḍä diśa ratnakettu aggaṃjsu • sarvañä baysä briyūnä ṣī tta hva(te)
prattyātmaggaucarä dvāsu • ttätä aṃgga pracai ʾīñä paba«sta» saindä jaḍīna anāstanä mu ///
kho ju cāʾya närmändä handa ru rūvu hūsandä śśānye pātco hų̄ña däte handa ///
ttrāmu ttätä jaḍī dvāsu • pabastau jsīrgye hanāsä abhāväna ttārä ne byaure ku ///
ggandharvanaggarä ṣa kaṃtha (padanda) nä hirṣṭai niśtä ttrāmu hira biśśä avadanda samu hivi ///
ggrrī-vaktrrä ggrrī-«pā»ysä u ggrrī-dasta uīʾ loviye daśte hamatä saṃkalpä vikalpi saṃbā ///
dyūlä biḍa ttaṃda u baurä haṃdurna lovī jñānä dyūlä saṃkalpa vikalpa • saṃbā ///
saṃkalpa-mātrā • ātma parikalpa-māttrā ggeʾha vikalpa-māttrā haṃjsārra saṃ ///
trāmu samu jaḍī cu ṣkauṅje samu kho hajsārra u pīsä vijñānä rūvä u yāva kā ///
jaḍī ju hirṣṭai niśtä vina aysmuī kar-ju ni byaude vina jaḍī aysmū śśūkä āgāśä ///

translation.line: Conceptualizing (saṃjñā) is sleeping through folly. He who sees in sleep what is not, an organ that is the domain of individual souls, connected ...
the conceptualizing of someone awakened does not sleep. Every discursive knowledge returns. The dharma of the tathāgata stretches out. *Tarnished ...
resembles ... covered with jewels. ... unblemished Ratnaketu, the omniscient, lovely Buddha. He it is who spoke thus: ...
The twelve domains of individual souls, these organs on account of a cause seem connected. Through folly without beginning ...
When in magic he conjures up another shape for him who lies sleeping. Thereafter he saw in sleep other ...
Like that (are) these twelve of folly, continually deceptions, distraction. On account of (their) non-being those are not found. Where ...
The gandharva-nagara city is not at all constructed. Thus all things are unconstructed, only ... own ...
... mouth ... *face ... hands (are) the senses worldly, able, themselves a saṃkalpa, vikalpa, sambhāraṇa ...
... only deception, *deceit, and a .?. of snow (is) the world’s knowledge, deception (are) the saṃkalpas, vikalpas, sambhāraṇas ...
The selfs are only saṃkalpas. Logs are only parikalpas. *Art works are only vikalpas. ...
Folly is just like the skandhas, just like *art works and a *painting, vijñāna and form, up to ...
For folly does not exist. Without the mind nothing is found at all. Without folly the mind (is?) alone, ... space ...

translation.line: ... he circumambulated Lokeśvararāja seven times, [placed] the right knee on the ground ...
... Lokeśvararāja, the right-goer (tathāgata), worthy of homages (arhat), [knowing well ?] the non-adverse Law (samyaksambuddha) ...
... [Then] the [Lord] Buddha praised Lokeśvararāja with the following verses: Immeasurable ...
... of the other ... a ray would be such, another ... of the entire triple *world ...
... suns ... Nor do they shine. Thus moreover either splendor ...
... O gracious one. In this manner the buddha-sound ... innumerable ...
... with respect to energy (is) the Buddha and thus similar with respect to wisdom. ...
... through the elements holds in (his) mind the buddha knowledge. ...
... there is any ... at all of the Buddha. The assembly ... the *counteragent of sin ...
... the omniscient Buddha, the good among the good, of ... splendor, in the directions ...

comments.comment:
Sanskrit text after Müller, 1881, pp. 7-8:
a0 atha khalv Ānaṃda Dharmākaro bhikṣur utthāyāsanād ekāṃsa uttarāsaṃgaṃ kṛtvā a1 dakṣiṇa-jānu-maṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratisṭhāpya yenāsau bhagavāṃl loke- a2 śvararājas tathāgatas tenāṃjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantaṃ namaskṛtya tasminn eva samaye a3 saṃmukham ābhir gāthābir abhyaṣṭāvīt • amitaprabha ananta-tulya-buddhe | a4-a5 na ca iha anya-prabhā vibhāti kācit || sūrya-maṇi-girīśa-candra-ābhā | na tapati bhosiṣu ebhi sarva-loke || rūpam api anantu b1 sattva-sāre | tatha api buddha-svaro ananta-ghoṣaḥ || śīlam api samādhi- b2 prajña-vīryaiḥ | sadṛśu na te sti ha loki kaścid anyaḥ || gabhiru vipulu sukṣma-prāptu b3 dharmo | cintitu buddha-varo yathā samudraḥ || b4 tenonnamanā na cāsti śāstuḥ | khila-doṣāñjāhyā ato ʾdhikālaṃ || atha b5 buddha-varā ananta-tejā | pratapati sarva-diśā narendra-rājā ||

translation.line: Molasses is to be boiled with milk. It should be eaten warm. It opens the urine.
4 bhāgas of nalada. 4 bhāgas of costus.

translation.line: 6 khas of wheat. Viśaʾkāntā paid the price ...
2 kūsas of wheat. She brought them(?) to the Inner Fort. The monks ... [the month] of Rrāhaja ...]
... should give ... constructed by the mind, from the prison of saṃsāra, *parikalpas ... for them ... (?)
... bound by a chain (is) the self. And other beings ... six ...
... may deign to separate (us) from woes and all sins. And all ...
... And according to the order of the buddhas he may deign to look (after us?). And not well-obtained ...

comments.comment: All cursive. a-side only in KT II, p. 70 (39).

recto.line: ma sū mä a ysu dą̄ na va ///

/// [nä] ma hā yā nä u vā rä ///

translation.line: “... I do homage, I the dānapati ...”
“... the Buddha, how much more would he have seen ...”
“... he heard, therefore now to you ...”

translation.line: ... being in hell whatever ... they did in many kalpas ...
... asked Samantabhadra thus for the benefit of beings ...
... the support of such a thing. 7. Thus he should say. Then the bodhisattva who ...
... root of goodness, benefit of the bodhisattva, variegated [homages] toward the Buddha, the Law, and the Assembly. ...
... he showed ... 9. Thus in those kṣetras are unimpeded (those) beings who *agree with one another ...
... they saw the power [of ...], they see (their) self singly in those buddhakṣetras, in a single moment ...
... [whoever] ...-s [it ?] ..., whoever (does so) for a hundred kalpas, whoever for a thousand, whoever more than one moment. 2. [From] whom ...
... a thousand kalpas those entered into a moment. 3. It seemed to them exceedingly marvelous ...

translation.line: “... string of ... should be bound, a hundred ...”

translation.line: ... obtains (re)birth [in ...]. Then Maitreya asked him thus:
... which] those four causes are. Thus the Buddha Maitreya spoke to him:
... the exalted bodhisattva or the being endowed with a noble body.
... female wiles seem good, through them he deceives beings.
... then he obtains (re)birth [in ...] and endures sufferings for a long time in an evil state.
... then he makes other ... no longer will he obtain (re)birth as a woman.
... he makes ... another being up to the animal state.
... is called. He says sins. It is called his bad moral.
... in ... it should be known as of another *state.
... he becomes ..., complete (and) all (his) senses good up to bodhi.
... is called ... its four causes (are) the karmas.
... just like a woman, or he places (it) in the middle [together with?] the women.

translation.line: ... are ... Then he should think thus: (Just) now blue rays came out of my uṣṇīṣa supported on the forhead of all beings,
and all beings were taken by me for consecration toward the bodhi of the Buddha, and all beings have become buddhas. Just so should he consider all beings through the form of the buddhas.
And just as he has thought his own self, just so he should always sit concentrating with that memory with collected mind.
Thus is that memory: Best of all upāya-kauśalya, buddhānusmṛti, yoga-mukha, the new bodhisatva by whom
I construct all the bodhisatva-caryās without remainder. Because after all all things are the size of the mind (citta-mātra). As many beings suffer turmoil through the turmoil of the mind,
they also are purified by the purity of their own mind. And it has been said: The bodhi of the buddhas—there is none it is far from and none it is

close to. He whose mind is in turmoil it is far from, he whose mind is purified it is close to. And, moreover, as it has been said in the Dharmagīti-sūtra: The bodhi of the buddhas can not be given by anybody, nor can anybody seize it. Only from the purity of the nature (prakṛti) of one’s own mind
(comes) the bodhi of the buddhas. And that is what is called “buddha.” For the same reason that all things (come) from one’s own mind, for the same reason this memory

should be performed. For that reason that memory should be performed thus. For that reason now (is) this memory. So many exalted, meritorious, propitious tathāgatas *shall purify the molasses oil (?).

comments.comment: Archaizing MKhot. The same ms. as Kha. ii.29.1-3 (IOL Khot 35/6-8).

internalComments.comment: transcribse vira at the end of , which is clearly a typo for vīra as can be ascertained from the photograph.

translation.line: “... ghee and sesame honey and sugar and rice and the juice of salt (brine?) and [the ...] of wild animals [...]
become heretical. So many benefits arise in the world. And now in that manner [one refrains] from heresy. ...
... who themselves have refrained from heresy and who have held others back from heresy. ..
have produced great benefits for them. But hear now this! And there then [the Buddha], Lord of Lords, called [Śāriputra]
and spoke to him thus: Śāriputra, the beings who are heretical become ungrateful toward me [and toward the Law and]
toward the saṅgha and toward (their) parents and toward all well-doing beings, because the three ...
they polish off evil deeds and thus perform great, heavy sins, he polishes off the saddharma-prakṣepa-karman (= the sin arising from the rejection of the true Law) and so on
(thinking): Did not the Lord Buddha say: The differences (between) either the śrāvakayāna or the pratyekabuddhayāna ... the *Mahayana ...
[However many] sinful acts there may be, there is no sinful deed greater than just this saddharma-prakṣepa-karman. [On account?] of this ...
... there may be, and woes do not please him. *Therefore I shall be grateful toward the three jewels and [toward] (my) parents ...
... he should seek good kalyāṇamitras, who expound to him the right Law of the Buddha, how false views do not ...
O Śāriputra, great bodhi-seeker, many beings have performed right views. ...

comments.comment: Archaizing MKhot. The same ms. as Kha. ii.18.2 (IOL Khot 35/5); see also IOL Khot 147/2.

nä anābhaugga ttryämä ttu hauvu || tti naṣphāñāme kiḍna • biśśāṃ bodhisatvabhūmicakkrāṃ āysirūṇä kiḍna biśvo buddhakṣetruo biśśān(u)

translation.line: I congratulate those merits and roots of goodness. May they reach out into the bhavanas on account of the power of the guardians.
May I obtain the great strength of the adornments of the bhavanas. May the actions (and) roots of goodness all reach out into the saṃsāracakras. All kinds of beings
[...] secure in the Mahayana *of the gotras, (realizing) how the four great elements—earth, water, fire, wind—arise for beings.
May they reach out toward the ... of all distressed, piteous fears ... of all beings.
The pure, profound ... of Mañjuśrī the bodhisattva ... how ... they ... of all dharmas
Āryā-Samantabhadra the bodhisattva [...] release ... maṇḍalas stand pure, supreme in the Buddha sphere.
Thus, on account of homage to *such lord buddhas standing in a cave ... on account of (my?) homage, definitely those merits and roots of goodness
*initially all the lord buddhas ... on account of the purity of the bodies of the Law “having sown all the mines(?)”
they tied vows for it for the sake of bringing out [...] samādhimukha of all the sarvākārāvaropitas
... anābhoga ... that power. They, for the sake of bringing out the ... for the sake of the adornment of all the bodhisatvabhūmicakras in all the buddha fields, of all ...

comments.comment: Kha. ii.29(1-3), the same ms. as Kha. i.306a (IOL Khot 34/1).

recto.line: hu jsa tte pu ña ku śśa la mū la ysī nī ka rma cu pu ña ku śśa la a rmū vyā mä ttyau pu ñyau ku śśa la mū lyau
a yi ṣṭhī rä kuṃ bi śvo bu ddha kṣe truā ha ṣka mā te cu gya sta ba lysa ā jī ṣyā mä ttyau pu ñyau ku śśa la mū
la bi śśä bu ddha bhū mi ca krruo ha ra ysā n· kṣe truo [bi] [śśū] nä gya stā nu ba lysā nu ha sta mye [h]a sā ya
sa rvā kā ra va rau pe ttāṃ dā tī nāṃ tta ra r· ryā va lo ki tte śva rä na mau ā ryā maṃ ju śrī na mau ā
va sva tte ki ḍna sa rvā kā ra va rau pe ttāṃ dhā ra ṇī myā ndä ī ndi pra ṇi hā na ba stā ndä ī ndi tta tta

verso.line: bu ddha śśā sa na pa rvā lāṃ dī vāṃ nā gāṃ mā ndi ha sta mu ba lysū śtu va rā • cu bo dhi
ḍna sa ddha rmä pa de re me ki ḍna a va śśä maṃ tte [dru] śśī la gga ndha sa ma nvā ga tta hi māṃ di • cu drai ṇu
lo kyau lo kau tta ryau su hā vā nyau [ku] [śśa] la mū lyau bi śśä bu ddha kṣe tra su pa ri śu ddha vi ṣṭā ndä hau ·au
ra ja tta maṃ tti pu ña ku śśa la mū la bye hāṃ du sa mā hā nyau dhā ra ñyau kṣāṃ tyau bhū myau va śa hyau pra ta
ra na vi ṣṭā ndä || tti ru vā pu ña ku dī ra ka rma ki ḍyā ni dī śyāṃ ttyau pu ñyau ku śśa la mū lyau bi śśä sa rvā [kā]

transcription.prose:
hujsa tte puña kuśśala-mūla ysīnī karma cu puña kuśśala armūvyāmä ttyau puñyau kuśśalamūlyau
ayiṣṭhīrä ku-ṃ biśvo buddhakṣetruā haṣkamāte cu gyasta balysa ājīṣyāmä ttyau puñyau kuśśalamū-
la biśśä buddhabhūmicakrruo haraysān(du) kṣetruo biśśūnä gyastānu balysānu hastamye hasāya
sarvākāravaraupettāṃ dātīnāṃ ttara(nda)r(āṃ) (ā)ryāvalokitteśvarä namau āryā-maṃjuśrī namau ā
vasvatte kiḍna sarvākāravaraupettāṃ dhāraṇī myāndä īndi praṇihāna bastāndä īndi tta tta
buddhaśśāsana-parvālāṃ dīvāṃ nāgāṃ (hi)māndi hastamu balysūśtu varā(ṣṭa) • cu bodhi
«ki»ḍna saddharmä padereme kiḍna avaśśä maṃ tte druśśīlaggandhasamanvāgatta himāṃdi • cu draiṇu
lokyau lokauttaryau suhāvānyau kuśśalamūlyau biśśä buddhakṣetra supariśuddha viṣṭāndä hau ·au-
rajattamaṃ tti puña kuśśala-mūla byehāṃdu samāhānyau dhārañyau kṣāṃtyau bhūmyau vaśahyau prata-
rana viṣṭāndä || tti ru vā puña ku(śśalamūla) dīra karma kiḍyāni dīśyāṃ ttyau puñyau kuśśalamūlyau biśśä sarvākā

translation.line: ... those merits, roots of goodness—*deposited—actions. The merits I have rejoiced at, with those merits, roots of goodness
establish (adhiṣṭhā-), where he *constructs for me/them in all the buddha fields. The lord buddhas whom I have implored, with those merits, roots of goodness
may all reach out to the bodhisatvabhūmicakras in (all the buddha) fields, ... in the sphere of the lord buddhas
of the bodies of the Law that are sarvākārāvaropita. Āryāvalokiteśvara, hail! Āryā-Mañjuśrī, hail! or
on account of purity. The dhāraṇī of the sarvākārāvaropitas they ...-ed ... . They tied vows. Thus,
of the protectors of the buddha-śāsana—gods, nāgas ...—they will become [the ...] toward best bodhi. Because,
for the sake of bodhi, for the sake of the upholding of the saddharma, certainly for me the ... shall be ...-śīla-gandha-samanvāgata. Because,
through utilities for goodness and roots of goodness that are trailokya-lokottara, all the buddha fields will stand supariśuddha.
... They shall obtain those merits, roots of goodness. By samādhis, dhāraṇīs, kṣāntis, bhūmis, vaśitās(?), the prakaraṇas(?)
shall stand. And those merits, roots of goodness, bad acts, sins we confess. By those merits, roots of goodness all *sarvākārāvaropita ...

/// śśā /// ttāṃ dī ra gga rkha ki ḍyā ni jye ya nī ñi ha mi ña

translation.line: ... may I become. Like that of prince Sudhana the samantabhadra-caryā shall become. Of all the tri- ...
... may I become *confident altogether, like hail to Śākyamuni, the Lord Buddha!
... they have congratulated merits, roots of goodness. In one and the same ... of the Lord
[Buddha ...] they ...-ed ... The dharmakāya, rūpakāya, nirvikalpa, jñā-
... firmly established (adhiṣṭhita), asthāna at the feet of the lord buddhas, they took me into (their) protection.
... may I be able to destroy evil, heavy sins. In one and the same
... hail! May Āryāvalokiteśvara bodhisattva [extend?] to me his mercy
... may I become the *conveyor across distress, the destroyer of sufferings. Hail! Āryā-
... may I realize ... I shall break up the mountains of heresies of all beings.

translation.line: ... of many kinds. To start with, by the four samgrahavastus, by the the gift of appropriating beings. ..
by ... 2; by the career of a benefactor. 3; and by being/using(?) one and the same manner. 4. By the gift that is *retained, by the six pāramitās ...
by ...-ing and by the gift he should himself daily in five ways, do memorization of the teaching. By the gift of the Law ...
by the gift of ..., by the gift that has no vastu(?), by the gift of ...(?), by the gift of roots of goodness. 5 ...
the bodhi-seeker should himself do memorization of the teaching (and) it should be taught to another. Next ...
the restraints should be made known ..., one should inform. To start with, ... sarvākāra-śīla, vighātārthaka-śīla, ...
-sukha-śīla, viśuddha-śīla. 9. If (he is?) svabhāva-śīla, what has been called ...
enters ... (To be) sarva-śīla means that he enters all (things). 2. (To be) duṣkara-śīla means that [he enters ... 3.]
(To be) sarvato-mukha-śīla means that he enters through all kinds of entrances. (4.) (To be) satpuruṣa-śīla means that [he enters ...5.]
(To be) sarvākāra-śīla means that he enters through all kinds of entrances. 6. (To be) vighātārthaka-śīla [means that he enters ... 6.]

translation.line: ... [if] you should not be awake, O Lord, or sleep
... (8)1. [Skt.:] “In the world being asleep is like being dead. Someone asleep (is) by the might of Māra.”
... (8)2. [Skt.:] The moment of being released from the eight misfortunes (is) long obtained. ...
... For in the world (he is) equal to (being) dead. He is in the power of Māra. ...
... he speaks ... 84. As for those eight hard misfortunes, in which
... he should not take an opportunity with fruition. 5. For him
... And he sleeps thus (as he) who (is) awake.

comments.comment: B.: sāra-rāśa; B. suggests vaśā[d ahaṃ].

translation.line: [He whose] right side of the head twitches, (the signs) should be known (to be) good. When the left
[side of the head twitches ...] [Those whose right ear] twitches shall know: I shall obtain a good dwelling. And those whose left ear twitches
[shall know: ...] [Those whose right cheek twitches] shall come to where one receives honor. He whose left cheek twitches shall know
[...] [He whose nose twitches ...] [Those whose] nostrils twitch should know: [We shall have] a nice talk with relatives and friends.
[He whose right] eyebrow twitches shall know: I shall be victorious in the assembly. He whose left
[eyebrow twitches shall know: ...] [He whose right side of the eye twitches] shall know: I shall be victorious (in fight) with enemies. He whose left side of the eye twitches .... women ...
He whose ... twitches (there is) profit for him. He whose lower lip twitches (there is) a profit for him. He whose upper
[lip twitches (there is) ... [...] He whose tongue twitches should count on his death (to be) by poison. He whose ...(?) twitches
... He whose ...] twitches should count on illness. He whose palate twitches should know that
... [He whose] ... twitches should know: quarrels will arise for me/them. He whose right shoulder twitches
[...] [He whose right shoulder twitches ...] He whose heart twitches shall soon (have) business. Those whose right arm
[twitches ...] Those whose left arm [twitches ...] shall [soon] have a meeting. He whose right ...(?) twitches ... they obtain for him female ...

comments.comment: Interpretation of bodily signs. M. Leumann, 1963. From the progression of the body parts it would seem that Bailey’s b-side is the recto. Uncommon ductus. PLATE 6e.

recto.line: [ṭṭā] sa || na a ysmya ysu rrä
n· sa tvāṃ va ska ttyau pu ñau ha rbi śi sa tva dye na śi r·a āṃ du
da śäʾ vī ka rni u pe vi tvā kū ra dṛ ṣṭä va n· [tt]yau pu ñau
ha mrra ṣṭä bi śä rra ṣṭya dri ṣṭya āṃ du || nä tti drai jū na
ḍä na ka rma pa ha va rttū śi kä tti na hvīʾ yä ysaṃ thä na sā rä
ttū ni jsa ḍä ha sta mä [n]ā si || cu bu ru vā pu ña yu ḍä ī mä
mū ysaṃ thä u ttā ña ysī ntha • cu bu ru pyaṃ tsā ṣṭa ya ną̄ ni

jsa sa rva sa tvyau jsa ha mī ḍa tti maṃ pu ña va sva hi māṃ di a
jyą̄ nā saṃ khu ji ā śäʾ || da sau pra ṇi hā na mą dā ru a va
śau a ysä nvā stä ya nī mä da sau se ysā ryau haṃ tsa da śyau

translation.line: for the ... beings. On account of those merits let all beings be beautiful to behold.
I shall produce *compassion ... this false view, on account of those merits
let all always have correct views. Not (only?) three times [but
constantly?] I shall practice those (ten) paths of action (karmapatha). Thereby they will obtain a nice human birth.
In this way I shall obtain the best. However many merits I have performed
in this birth and in that birth, however many I shall (still) perform in the future
in all births until bodhi, those merits I share with all
beings altogether. May those merits be purified for me here
(and become) imperishable just like space. The ten vows—before long definitely
I shall have *laid (them) down, the ten *laid down together with a hundred thousand and ten
*securities. I shall obtain omniscient knowledge, the ten powers, the four
intrepidities, the eighteen *āveṇika dharmas. May I realize best bodhi.
Long pepper, ginger, black pepper, groundsel root, caltrop
2 kūsas x khas. Khaiyadā places (her) finger. Those [placed] (their) fingers.
Puñakāntī requested wheat 1 kūsa by a ṣaṃga of sixteen(?). [Puñakāṃttī places (her)] finger.
... -lāñā requested wheat 1 kūsa by one of sixteen(?).
Ysamadatta requested wheat 9 kūsas. — Puñakāṃtti’s finger. ...
... delivers paśī with interest. And it takes effect when (he/she) places (his/her) finger on it.
Aśnauka requested wheat from the khaysmaṃjā 2 kūsas. The khaysmaṃjā (representative?)’s finger. ...
Ñāṃ Tcīya *dependent of Chau requested wheat (from) the khaysmaṃjā 2 kūsas.
For Naupuña the teacher 4 kūsas from khaysmaṃjā with interest.
... a second time a *dependent of Chau together with her daughters requested wheat 2 kūsas one of seventeen(?)
from the khaysmaṃjā. And it takes effect when Chau places (his) finger on it. ... -’s finger.
Puñaśīlī requested wheat 2 kūsas from the khaysmaṃjā
with interest. And it takes effect when (she places her) finger on it. ñāṃ’s finger. Chau.
Suysadamai Naṃdaka requested wheat 2 kūsas by one of sixteen(?). Naṃdaka’s finger.

comments.comment: Actual: Kha. vi.14d. Bailey has “Kha. vi 14 b 1” in KT V and SD, TV, but “KHADALIQ VI 14a” and “KHADALIQ VI 14b” on the plates. Religious text written in MKhot. cursive on a-side, with letter on b-side.
The meaning of the expressions “one of sixteen,” etc., is not known.

hauḍi yaṃda u mastą̄ñä kāṣṭi yaṃda pasāṃ āstaṃna stūra kaiʾtta khvaṃ tta na panāśari ci tta
aśnesalą̄ña paʾsīña drą̄ma ṣṭāri yāṃ kūṃ 10 hauryari khu na hvāʾre vaña ttā kaṃdvaji ī-
raki tsve ganamī jsa ttā nāsīrau kṣa kū(sa) ganaṃ vā biśa bisai ārryari khu hą̄mai vasve hame
u dvāsä kūsa vā hą̄mai hajsęmyari khu vā hīya stūra tsvata hamāṃde ttī-t-ī vā hīyau stū-
rāṃ bida baḍa u śau jsāṃ vā hveʾ stūra haśdiʾ na vā tsvata hamāṃde ttī-t-ī vā gvāraḍą̄na stū-
ra barīdä u khvau tta saṃ nvaśtyeri hamāte tta ttai yaṃda kuṃjsatīnai vā rrūṃ hajsęm«y»ari drai śiṃga huṣka
kūra drai ṣaṃga hālā pāraka gulä u dva thyeba khalavya u hā sāṃśka jsāṃ vā hauryari u cila-
ja namata baṃ ṣṭa dīśta ttā duna hauḍeṃ tta rai va tta śira ja girau u ṇāyarī hā ka nai hā ṣāʾka
jana same ci vā buḍāmdä īrasaṃgi jsāṃ vā ma tsa paṃdä vā buʾysi ṣṭe u vara śū«ka» saṃ tta biśa
ādari yaṃ hamārrīji māśti 10 6 mye haḍai ttā pī(ḍak)ä hauḍeṃ
ha ma rri ja ma śta
spāta īramañä rāñä hau-

translation.line: (I?), the spāta Īramaña embracing the earth (before my) wife, say: I ask you after Īrasaṃga and the other children, Jsijsīya and
Vilāya, and (our) other kinsmen, with small and big. I am fine here (and) in good health. How could it be otherwise (?) if you are fine
(and) in good health, (then) I here consider it an honor to me. About the harvest, take care that you have watered the grain in due time
and that you have looked after the mastauña . Look after the sheep and the other cattle so that you do not lose them.
The paʾsīña pomegranates from Aśnesala(?), give them to ... so that they do not dry out. Now Īraka from Kaṃdva has gone to you.
Take the wheat from him that is for you: six kūsas. And grind the wheat in the house, when the flour has been cleaned.
Gather twelve kūsas of flour for me. And if your own pack-animals can go hither, then carry it hither on your own pack-animals,
and let just one man drive the animals to me. If they can not go, then let *rented animals carry it here.
But only if it is easier for you do it that way. Gather for me three śiṃgas of sesame oil,
three ṣaṃgas of dry kūras, a half pārakā of crude sugar, and two thyeba khalavīs . And do give him a sāṃśka for me and
felt for cloth. I have given *Baṃṣṭa *bows to deliver to you personally. And thus ... for him a good janā, and place it on him/it(?) if that janā does not fit him
(or) those who brought (it?). *Let Īrasaṃga come here to me, (though) it is a long way. And there, you just take care of everything on your own!
The 16th day of the month Hamārrīja I gave the letter (to be brought) to you.
The spāta Īramaña. To be delivered.

Śi Pattaha has a brother here called Śi Hvartcyanä. And this brother Śi Hvartcyanä and the other ...
brothers (are) all in the jurisdiction of Śi Pattaha. ... Śi Pattaha ... a report

translation.line: I make an info-report (vijñapti) circumambulating his feet to the dvaipiṭika prior, the reverend Prajñendra¬bhadra. ...
... the reverend Indraprasthita. The reverend is well, (but?) not healthy as long as thus ...
... the āmāca... We, the hīyaude āmāca, thus make a report to the ṣṣau Caṣṭeṃ.
... with ... altogether messenger ...? Now to you at present
... with reverence ... as to you ... refuge ... when to your eye he orders to be given cakṣa

|| ganaṃ dvī ·e ·i si ·ṃ ·i -vye ///

translation.line: I, Sidavaṃda, much embracing the earth (at my) mother’s (feet), say (to her) and [to] (my) *brothers ...
If] she is calm for them (?) healthy, (then) I, being here far away, consider (it) an honor. Here for me...
with ... till now is well. Here for me now for many days ...
I have had no quarrel [with ...]. I am concerned for all of you (thinking) “how will you not go hungry?” ...
have sat down ... and I *request from you one cup with cold water ...
... Now, he for three months has not even gone for my sake ...
... came ... I ask you, only take great care so [that ...]!
I shall come ... On the 26th [day] of the month of Kaja I gave the letter (to be taken) to you.

comments.comment: See Emmerick in Studies II, p. 111.

secondary.siglum: M.T. a.iv.00157: KT V, p. 213 (441); SD III/LXVII; SD, TV, p. 94

if you do not want a major quarrel, come here at once. On the 10th day of Ttuṃjārā we gave the order (to be taken) to you.

translation.line: I, the teacher Seṃdū ask after the teacher Vasädatta. If things are well with you (and) healthy, I
consider it an honor for me. As for me here, then, things are well (and) healthy. For me the (only) sorrow ... that
I have not seen you (all) here. For my mother here, then, things are well. I have heard that you have become so ill. Thus
it was proper for you(?) that you were able to gather your medicines. I here have had no *opportunity. And then
you did not receive my men (who were going) to you. I here ...
To be given to the teacher.

comments.comment: Verso not on SD III, pl. LX.

secondary.siglum: M.T. b.ii.0057: KT V, p. 219 (465); SD III/LXVI; SD, TV, p. 92

ñāṃ prra bhā vi na 1 su bhi kṣi ma ri paṃ ñe hi rna rruṃ di hī yau «†jsi» pū ñau jsa ttā gu ttyau hvā ṣṭyau pā tci ci ṣṭāṃ ttū hvaṃ
kṣī ri kaiʾ di 2 kṣa si mī ṣṭāṃ tsve kṣu ṇi pa na tai gau ri vi mi sta pa rvā lāṃ pa jsaṃ prra cai na hā dha rmä ā hā ri keṃ ṇa 3

prra cai na ha spi sya ri va ri ā vą̄ ña śā sa lī śi ri a pva ṣṭi khu vya chīṃ di ha rbai śi pī le 5 ū pa ka rą ṇi ci bū
rāṃ śtā ka ra ṇi ha rbä śūṃ vā ṣṭi ha jsau

transcription.prose:
|| || || || || cī ṣiʾ śiri bāḍä ye ttą̄ma khu ṣiʾ bhadrrakalpī mistä miṣḍi ḡyastä marä ysaṃthä nāte viśaʾ kīrttä pū-
ñāṃ prrabhāvina 1 subhikṣi mari paṃñe hirna rruṃdi hīyau pūñau jsa ttāguttyau hvāṣṭyau pātci ci ṣṭāṃ ttū hvaṃ
kṣīri kaiʾdi 2 kṣasimī ṣṭāṃ tsve kṣuṇi panatai gaurivi mista parvālāṃ pajsaṃ prracaina hā dharmä āhāri keṃṇa 3
ṣiʾ mī vā ṣada jsi brīya namaṃdrrye gari vīrāṣṭa āśaʾrya dva ṣiʾ ttū kālä rrāhaji āstaṃ māśte 4 kṣīri āysdarrji
prracaina haspisyari vari ā vą̄ña śā salī śiri apvaṣṭi khu vyachīṃdi harbaiśi pīle 5 ūpakarąṇi ci bū-
rāṃ śtāka ra ṇi harbäśūṃ vāṣṭi hajsau(de)

translation.line: (1) When that good time was—at the time when that bhadrakalpika great (2) gracious Lord took birth here, Viśaʾ Kīrtta, by the power of (his) merits. 1.
(There is) abundance here in every thing because of the merits of the king, as well as because of the Master Tibetans, who are guarding this land of Khotan. 2.
(3) His sixteenth regnal year has passed. Great respect has arisen for him.Because of the honor of the watchers for the sake of promoting the Law 3
(4) he with faith (and) in love has invited thither, to Gara, two reverend ones. He at this time, at the beginning of the month of Rrāhaja 4
for the sake of the protection of the land (...) (5) (So) strive therein the temple for one year well (and) *uninterrupted, so that all sufferings disapppear! 5.
Utilities as many (6) as they need, all of them *he has gathered for them here.

comments.comment: Metrical text dated in the 16th regnal year of Viśaʾ Kīrtta (see Skjærvø, 1991a, p. 266). Praise of Viśaʾ Kīrtta and the Tibetan overlords. Ser., pl. CLI. Cf. Konow, 1939c.

secondary.siglum: M.T. i.0028 (Mazar Toghrak): KT III, p. 149 (91); SD III/LXVIII; SD, TV, p. 96

translation.line: ... wishes to recognize (prajānitu-kāma) ..., to perform the career according to the Vajracchedikā-prajñāpāramitā, to come to yonder shore,
(to learn) the method of ... the entrance to the Law (dharmamukha). What the reverend Prajñāttīra
with great ... the profound ... the profound ... has asked. In the town of Humädāṃ born, unattached to his profits and praises
all golden the bodhi of the buddhas pleases him. He has dwelt in the mountains for more than 20 years.
While there one after the other two mārgopadeśakas the *arhats of the assembly, who were in the entire Chinese
land the kalyāṇamitras. Their own tongue from them this profound ... in due order ...

māṃ bveysa jsīnä hamāvä tta ṣṭāṃ pūñä pyara hīye paysāye brrą̄vära cā ttaiha tcainä kharūṣa jsa habrrīhū u pūrā dvarā jsa ttu ṣṭāṃ pūñä naira kīma hva jsa habrrīhū u dvīra

ysūśtāṣṭä vyārṇa byehīdä aysa ttā pā cā kīmä śanä byehīme thyau madrrāṃ sījāṣṭä baiysūśtä vyichīme kymšʾn paysāvye hvārakyä sūraimaitrra jsa

translation.line: This Jātakastava, the limb of the difficult/marvelous deeds of the buddas,

Cā Kīmä Śąnä ordered it to be written in love of bodhi. Through support upon the merits and roots of goodness (resulting) from it, may the cakravartin Śai Tcūnä have eternal rule. May my gati be a special gati,

a special rebirth (upapatti), a special place (sthāna)! At present, may the vajra-rāja king have the enjoyment of a long life! May he have a great, endless, long life! May the karmas (and) sins that I have accumulated for kalpas

disappear from me! May *He deign to devote Himself to the very foremost bodhi! (?) These merits I now share with my father, Padä Śānä (and) the pū-hyä (puye) Cā Pina. May (their) gatis be purified! May my mother
Humāṃ have a long life! I now share these merits with my father’s brother german Cā Taiba Tcainä Kharūṣa, and with (his?) sons (and) daughters. That merit with (my) wife, Kīma Hva and (my) daughter

Rūpājīvā (and my) daughter Jvālakyā, (my) brother, the traipiṭika Sīdyakavarrda, the traipiṭika Dharmajña, with all the monks, householders, (and) Vajrayāṇa-followers. May all beings obtain a prophecy toward bodhi!
May I, too, Kīmä Śanä obtain one! May I devote myself to the quick success of the mantras (and) to bodhi! Kim-πan together with his sister german Sūraimaitrrā.

comments.comment: Published by Bailey in KT I, pp. 197-219; photos in Cod. Khot., pp. 145-83; ed. Dresden, The Jātakastava. The manuscript was written by Cā Kīmä Śanä (see also IOL KHOT S.47) during the reign of King Viśaʾ Śūra (r. 957-78?). Site no Ch. 00274 on fol. 1. Fols. 1v and 39r in Ser., pl. CL.
Jātakastava fol. 39. Site no. Ch.00274. Fol. 39r in Ser., pl. CL.

translation.line: Thus, this Kalpa-rāja-sūtra the monk Sarvajinākara of the Vīśattīrai (monastery?) ordered to be written in red(?).
He ordered merits to be written.
I do three-fold reverence to the buddhas.
(On) the 15th day of the month of Hamārīja of the 30th regnal year, Year of the Ox, in the tenth month,

to the court to you. In the month of Muñaṃja, Kabula requested one thick blanket, 12 ounces. The dispute was thus closed to everybody’s satisfaction(?). To the court. It (will) then (become) authoritative, when Jsaska puts (his) finger (on it).
Welfare! I do homage in three ways to the buddhas of the three times with exceeding faith.
I do homage to the three yānas, to the Law, and then in three ways to
the bhikṣu-saṅgha. [1] In this way I do homage to the Prajñāpāramitā sūtra,
the mother of buddhas, the best/master of all pāramitās, profound, (2r1) an excellent *remedy—

comments.comment: Fol. 1r contains, apparently, the colophon of a preceding text and an introduction to the Vajracchedikā. It has a Chinese stamp. There are three different hands. The original(?) colophon is written in bold script in three lines: the single word āśiʾrī at the top edge to the right (line 0) and two lines (1-2), followed by the intro¬duction to the Vajracchedikā (line 3). The lower left corner has writing apparently in the same hand (line 4). At the top of the folio are two lines (0a-b) continued between lines 1 and 2 (1a) and below (the akṣara ska) and to the right of line 2 (2a-b) containing a note regarding a legal dispute. At the bottom edge of the folio (2c) is a triśaraṇa. Hoernle, MR., pls. v-xi; fols. 1r/v and 33r in Ser., pl. CXLIX. The Vajracchedikā begins on fol. 1v, decorated with a yellow buddha and flowery decorations. PLATE 7a.

translation.line: [3] the first (and) foremost indicator of the career of the buddhas, of the Law in its entirety,
of the paramārtha, of the yoga. [4] Where there is no (false) view (or) appropriation,
nor any kleśas. Supported on (ālambya) reality (tathatā), always *empty, just like the dharma-kāya
[5] This Prajñāpāramitā, the omniscient Buddha succinclty
expounded this triśatikā to us that is called Vajracchedikā. [6] It shatters all the karmas, kleśas, and āvaraṇas,
(all) heavy sins like a vajra. Therefore it is called Vajracchedikā.
[7] The entire Law of the Buddhas is in that sutra, in that Vajracchedikā.
Therefore it is such and excellent *remedy. [8] He who learns it, holds it, and

translation.line: speaks it, orders it to be written, the entire Law is said to be learnt by him. He increases entirely
in goodness. [9] However many merits will be his, they will be spoken * in this sutra.
Therefore, a wise man should always keep this sutra in his mind. [10] Therefore,
I intend to translate it now in love of the Law with faith. May the buddhas
protect me until I have said everything that is needed!
Welfare! May there be reverence toward all the lord buddhas and bodhisattvas!
Thus I have heard. At one time the Buddha lord of lords,

translation.line: Ṣīlāṃ requested 2 kūsas 5 ṣaṃgas of millet.
Puñade son of Mvīka(?) requested 4 kūsas of barley and x ṣaṃgas. Vismida requested 2 kūsas of millet.
x sahavari requested 1 kūsa of barley. Sahadatta requested 2 kūsas of millet.
Next Sahadaraṃ requested {2} 1 kūsa of barley. The *house’s *dues(?) of barley was 15 kūsas 8
Namauḍa Sāthara requested 1 kūsa of barley. ṣaṃgas without their interest ...

(ā)śiʾrka vā parya hauḍe cu ikṣuṃdā ṣṭe • si khu ma anvaśtä nä hame • u tta
kįṇä jsāṃ vā phara tta tta īḍi si khu va ṣāʾka śtāka ya ya ttī vā cigau
pakiʾ jsa parau hīsīya ā vā hā sahäʾ : hvainä jsā vīrą̄ṣṭä u ārūku vī-
rāṣṭä salā jsa parau hąmīya • parau-v-āṃ hau ni niśāve •
bīsa du u tta tta vā paste si pa ///
-i ·e ·ä ///
/// maysdy-
ye jsa kīthāṣṭä ttraṃdadu • u khu pa kuṣḍi āvadū pyatsa tsvāṃ(dū) u nva
rrvī parau hā biśä parau pastāṃdū u cu ma pā ḍikau va u rrįspurä va u
u ttugavāṃ jsi jsā tvai haṃgvāṃdu • bvestā bārāṃ āṃ pā
(hv)ū śiʾna va hva hva ñāṃ tcāṃ va u ttugavā va u ttūttūvā va tsanä-śīyāṃ
cīkä kaṃga ṣṭa tvai ñī
(ḍī)kuṃ hā : sīnä ye ttū hā bīśä nva parau-v-āṃ u nva eyāṃ paphvādū
/// hādimye haḍai pyatsä tsvāṃduṃ u ysinauśtä kiṇä hā parau pastāṃdūṃ u pha-
(ra) (sal)ā tta tta īḍä si
mahe ttā janave vīrāṣṭä haṣḍi vā nä hajsādāṃdu si būjsaji
(ña)śä bīsä śāṃʾ kvāṃ pa lyehsakä u maśänä pauka u rca paḍä tsā pācä u yinä pyatsä tsvāṃ
/// tta tta parauta ciṃgāṃ hvanāṃ cvāṃ maśū cāṣṭä ya tti hā hā pyatsä buḍāṃdū
/// ·ā phara tta tta īḍe si mahe ma bijeṣāṃ u pharāṃ ttā īnāṃ • u ttī hagr(au-)
(ttā)dä u haṃgrįma vā salā ttūkä thīyāṃdä si ṣāʾka ma āstaṃ satsārä
jsāvi u ttikyāṃ paṃjyāṃ ha u ṭya jsāṃ ma ttikye jsa hastara niśtä • u viña ttā
k(ä) ttā bāḍä vī ḍikuṃ hīvī aurrāsä hīśtä u
ñaśāṃ bīsāṃ hīvī • vā khvāṃ vā rraysgä vī haḍāṃ hī-
ya muʾśdäʾ harraysde khu kī svąña ·ū pa ṣṭi khu ttā paskyāṣṭä ttā-
ṣṭä geʾsā hamāṃ u mūñajä māśta ttā ājīmāṃ u khvāṃ
(ttā) paskyāṣṭä ttye krraśīsä hīya u ritsuyarūṣä hīya u bvą̄mi
dārrjī hīya kvāṃʾ pįnakä hīya u maṃdūysāṃ saṃgai hīya muʾśdiʾ
harraysde u maha mūttä hīya khvāṃ jsāṃ vā pā katha jsa yseʾ-
rrī ysą̄ ñaśau drāṃ śirka parau hīśtä
āṃ vā tta tta yįnā ḍikuṃ
mahe pā rrvīye bīsa ṣṭāṃ u hervī /// ///
nä harraysde ·ṃ ttī jsāṃ ///

translation.line: ... that: They have abducted here the married women. And the Linggong made a report to us thus
[that]: At the court, is the būjsaṃja for (Our) consort the great queen (the) better (one?) or Our life? And
They deigned ... to us that: They can not abduct the married women (and bring them?) *here (for wives). Then
we brought before Them a report regarding Āśiʾrkā that: If those are married women and they can not be abducted (and brought?) *here, then there is a problem there. Then
order Āśiʾrkā to be given to me because she is unmarried, as long as there will be no problem here. And
regarding ... they sent word here that: If this one were needed, then there would come an order from the Chinese
populace, or else he would deign(?) (to go) thither, Hvainä to the court and ārūku (8) to the court there would be an order
with words(?). He did not send a word of an order to us(?). {And then thither the humble}
servants {daily, all the time, we went ...} and thus he ordered us that: ...
... from/with ... we entered the city. And when we came before the palace, we went before them, and according to
the order of the court we stated the entire order to them. And we met ... with the ttuṃgas and then ... and whatever about(?) the Ling-gong, the prince, and
the royal consort, respectively, for Ñāṃ-tcāṃ, the ttuṃgas, the tsanä-śīs the Ling-gong was *happy with, all that we put together for them according to the order and the ... .
On the seventh day, we went before (him) and presented to him the order about *kinship, and he spoke
as follows: ‘So We say: We (sent) a message to you, (but) you have not sent any to us.’ And then Svanaka,
the humble servant Kvāṃ-pa Lyehsaka, Maśänä Pauka, and Rca Paḍä-tsā Pācä and Yinä(?). We went before him.
Thus, the orders for the Chinese Khotanese, to wherever their ... was, thither we brought them before them.
... spoke as follows: “Here We say.” And then they *accepted,
and in the assembly they produced the following speech: ‘This one
at first goes in saṃsāra, and for these five and for that one here it is not better than this. And now
there will come messengers to you and your land. The information from the Ling-gong will come and
that of your humble servants. And if the compassion of the messengers
quickly reaches out to us(?), when Kī-svąña sets out ..., if we can turn back to you,
then, in the month of Muñaṃja, we shall bring the ... to you. And
if the compassion of the *blessing [Tib. bkra-śis?], of the ritsuyarūṣa, of *Hbum
Rdo-rje, of Kvāṃ Pinaka, and of Saṃgai son of Maṃdūysa(?)
reaches out to us, and the ... of Mahamūtta ... And if then later there comes from the city for us humble ...-born such a beautiful order, then we shall make it ...
Then we shall be the Ling-gong’s royal sevants and at all ...

comments.comment: Bailey suggested Chin. hâo xing j á “of good family,” but perhaps rather j ≥ haô xìng “good-natured.”

recto.line: hau da bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä v /// ra : ką̄ mä ā va śaʾ pai ṣka la na rru ją̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya b /// ā ka hī rą̄ ñä v /// ra : ką̄ ma ā va śäʾ pa /// ṣka
a pa na mą̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā kä hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ mä a ysmu pai ṣka la /// jai ga hā lai sā j /// nai ha rbai śa pa dya bvā ka
rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma a ysmu pai ṣka la a va jsa ñą̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka /// ī rą̄ ñä vī ra /// : ką̄ ma a ysmva pai ṣka la na rū
jā me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma a ysmu pai ṣka la a pa na mā /// me hā lai /// sā jä nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī
rą̄ ña vī ra : ką̄ ma a bau ste jai gya hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma /// a bau ste /// a va jsa ñą̄ me hā lai sā ja nai
ha rbai śa pa dya bvā kä hī rą̄ ñä vī ra ką̄ ma a bau ste a va jsa ñą̄ me hā lai na ru ją̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄
ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma a bau ste a pa na mą̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śa pa dya bvā kä hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma ṣkāṃ jāṃ jiṃ gya hā lai sā ja
nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā kä hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : kā ma ṣkāṃ jāṃ a va jsa ñą̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma ṣkāṃ jāṃ
na rru ją̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā kä hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma ṣkāṃ jāṃ a pa na mą̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā kä hī rą̄
ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma a ysmu jai gya hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ mä a ysmu a va jsa ñą̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai •
śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma a ysmu na rru ją̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śa pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma a ysmu a pa na
mą̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śa pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī va : ką̄ ma ną̄ ma rru jai gyä hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma

verso.line: «†ką̄» «†ma» ną̄ ma rru a va jsa ñą̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śa pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma ną̄ ma rū na rū ją̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha
rbai śa bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma ną̄ ma rru a pa na mą̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ mä kṣyāṃ
tvā rāṃ jai gya hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma kṣyāṃ tvā rāṃ a va jsa ñą̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā
ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma kṣyāṃ tvā rāṃ na rru ją̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śa pa dya bvā kä hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma kṣyāṃ tvā rāṃ a pa na mą̄ me
hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : kā mä skvā me jai gyä hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : kā mä skvą̄ me
a va jsa ñą̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : kā ma skvą̄ me na rru ją̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka
hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma skvą̄ me a pa na mą̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma va rą̄ śą̄ʾ me jai gyä hā
sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā kä hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ mä va rā śą̄ʾ me a vā jsa ñą̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śa pa dya bvā kä hī rą̄ ñä vī
ra : ką̄ ma va rā śą̄ʾ me na rru ją̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śa pa dya bvą̄ ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma va rā śāʾ me a pa na mą̄ me hā lai sā ja nai
ha rbai śa pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma eʾ sāṃ jai gya hā lai sā jä nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma eʾ sāṃ a va jsa ñā me hā lai sā
ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma eʾ sāṃ na rru ją̄ me hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma aiʾ sā a pa na mā me
hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvą̄ kä hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄ ma pa su jsa nāṃ jai gyä hā lai sā ja nai ha rbai śä pa dya bvā ka hī rą̄ ñä vī ra : ką̄

transcription.prose:
(1) hauda bvāka hīrą̄ñä v /// a : (2) ką̄mä āvaśaʾ paiṣkala narrują̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya b /// ka hīrą̄ñä v /// a : (3) ką̄ma āvaśäʾ pa /// ka(la)
apanamą̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvākä hīrą̄ñä vīra : (4) ką̄mä aysmu paiṣkala /// jaiga hālai sāj /// ai harbaiśa padya bvāka (hī)-
rą̄ñä vīra : (5) ką̄ma aysmu paiṣkala avajsañą̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka /// rą̄ñä vīra /// : (6) ką̄ma aysmva paiṣkala narū-
jāme hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (7) ką̄ma aysmu paiṣkala apanamā /// e hālai /// sājänai harbaiśä padya bvāka hī
rą̄ña vīra : (8) ką̄ma abauste jaigya hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (9) ką̄ma /// abauste /// avajsañą̄me hālai sājanai
harbaiśa padya bvākä hīrą̄ñä vīra (10) ką̄ma abauste avajsañą̄me hālai narują̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄-
ñä vīra : (11) ką̄ma abauste apanamą̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśa padya bvākä hīrą̄ñä vīra : (12) ką̄ma ṣkāṃjāṃ jiṃgya hālai sāja-
nai harbaiśä padya bvākä hīrą̄ñä vīra : (13) kāma ṣkāṃjāṃ avajsañą̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (14) ką̄ma ṣkāṃjāṃ
narrują̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvākä hīrą̄ñä vīra : (15) ką̄ma ṣkāṃjāṃ apanamą̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvākä hīrą̄-
ñä vīra : (16) ką̄ma aysmu jaigya hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (17) ką̄mä aysmu avajsañą̄me hālai sājanai harbai •
śä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (18) ką̄ma aysmu narrują̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśa padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (19) ką̄ma aysmu apana-
mą̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśa padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīva : (20) ką̄ma ną̄ma-rru jaigyä hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (21) ką̄ma
ną̄ma-rru avajsañą̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśa padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (22) ką̄ma ną̄ma-rū narūją̄me hālai sājanai ha-
rbaiśa (padya) bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (23) ką̄ma ną̄ma-rru apanamą̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (24) ką̄mä kṣyāṃ
tvārāṃ jaigya hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (25) ką̄ma kṣyāṃ tvārāṃ avajsañą̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvā-
ka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (26) ką̄ma kṣyāṃ tvārāṃ narrują̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśa padya bvākä hīrą̄ñä vīra : (27) ką̄ma kṣyāṃ tvārāṃ apanamą̄me
hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (28) kāmä skvāme jaigyä hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (29) kāmä skvą̄me
avajsañą̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (30) kāma skvą̄me narrują̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka
hīrą̄ñä vīra : (31) ką̄ma skvą̄me apanamą̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (32) ką̄ma varą̄śą̄ʾme jaigyä hā-
(lai) sājanai harbaiśä padya bvākä hīrą̄ñä vīra : (33) ką̄mä varāśą̄ʾme avājsañą̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśa padya bvākä hīrą̄ñä vī
ra : (34) ką̄ma varāśą̄ʾme narrują̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśa padya bvą̄ka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (35) ką̄ma varāśāʾme apanamą̄me hālai sājanai
harbaiśa padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (36) ką̄ma eʾsāṃ jaigya hālai sājänai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (37) ką̄ma eʾsāṃ avajsañāme hālai sā-
janai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (38) ką̄ma eʾsāṃ narrują̄me hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (39) ką̄ma aiʾsā apanamāme
hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvą̄kä hīrą̄ñä vīra : (40) ką̄ma pasujsanāṃ jaigyä hālai sājanai harbaiśä padya bvāka hīrą̄ñä vīra : (41) ką̄(ma) (•)

recto.line: || ma ka la sa lya cvā va ja mā śtä bi stä mye ha ḍai ṣaʾ kha la vī cu ra ta na va rai kṣä ā śīʾ u
prra kai ttu bū rä ṣa cu vā ṣṭä bau ḍä va he rä nau da • ga ḍā hva sta thau ra cai hä be ra śā
u śa ca prrai ysge bi ra śā u ka ba lī ja ba ysgyi hvā hyä ką̄ ma dä śe u hū ḍai gä
ysī ḍai a tta ra vā ysä śau u hū ḍai ga ysī ḍai la hä pī śau u ką̄ ra ka gä khau
ṣa thą̄ ra cai hä pa ba nā śa u khau cī ja khau śka śā u ī jī nai hī
rā sä hva tta ra kī nai ū ra ba da śau u ga ḍā hva stä śī yi ha ysä nā
lī kä thau ra cai hä dva u mī jī jū na ba ysgyi ka ba la dvī u hai ja mai
stä ka ba la u pe u śī yi mai stä ka ba la śā u a ysū ra gū na da
jū na bai mya ka mai śkä śā u nä mā ya śau ba ra ka u ya • ma • hai nai ga ḍā hva stä
ba ysgi thau ra cai hä śau u ha ysnā lī ka ga ḍā hva stä thau ra cai hä
dva u pa ha drau vī ha ysnā lī kä śa cī śau u hai ja ba ysgyi ka ba la
dvī u hai nai thau na śa cī u ha ysnā lī kä thau na śa ca drä ya u śī ya
ba ysgyi ka ba la tcau re u pai ma vī stā ka ba lī nai drai jsai śau u ga hai śau u
e ysnaṃ śā mai sta u dai rśvā khau cvā drau hye bi tcä dai rsa u tcau rrvā sta rrvā ñū
ṣṭye lī ka u śau ba rä khau cä pa jsā sä se ra u pai ma vī stā va thau na śa cä ha
da rā śa u ga ḍā hva stä thau ra cai hä jsa dā gū ba ysgye pai ma jsa bi ra śā
u ka gī ja ṣkau ma ka vī la ka śā ha tca ttrra ba jsa u dą̄ rmī nai ṣką̄ ma da le śau u
ha ba stā ga hā śa : ga hai va mai stä śau u va la ka ga hai śau u ha tca ha są̄ ña jsa
ai ysna śā u nau ṣṭa ra śau u ka ba lī jä bį rga ka gyä ka ra stä śe u ka ba lī
nai rū śka gä thū ḍa pa śau u kai me ja ysī ḍā me ja nya ka mai śka śā u hai
ja ba ysgyä ka ba la pa jse u hai nā thau na : ną̄ u ysī ra gū śa cī śau u pai
mī nā thau na tcau ra u phrra mai na ka ba la śā u ką̄ ra ka gä khau ṣa śa ha tca
ā va sa kāṃ jsa u mī jī jū na śa dā kai me jä ī śī ma śa u «†ysīs» «†cä» «†spī»
«†yi» «†drai» «†gū» «†na» «†mna» «†npa» «†ka» «†mai» «†śka» «†śā» u pai na jä śī na ma śau u thau na śa cī nū va rä «†e»
pa re kṣi śau u cha va nū kāṃ hä pa ra kṣa śau u hai nā śa dā da ma rā śīʾ nai mai sta kai
me jä śau u śeʾ ā ṣa na śa dā da ma rā śīʾ nai mai stä kai me jä śau u dai
dä ā ṣa na śa dā śa gī nai mai stä kai me jä śau u pa ha drau vī sya
dai hva ra dai thau ra cai hä śau u ha ysnā lī ka hū ḍai gä śau ba ysgi u ha dā
na ṣkū mā ya na ma vī ña tha va la ka ñä khau ca hau dū sä se ra pya ṣṭa lī ka
u hū ḍai ga yą̄ ma ba kä śau u thau ra cai hä śū kyai nä dva u hų̄ nau gyä
jsai ṇyāṃ hī rāṃ jsa ha ba ḍa pya ṣṭa lī kya kha dī ra kya śe u pū styą̄ na tcai rma

verso.line: tha va la ka śā u mī jī ju nä thau ra cai hä bi rä śā u mai stä pū
stye śau u e jsī nai va sī yi kä śau u nū va rä ba rä u va tsā vī śīʾ
nai ha mau ka śau pa jū ka śau u bū śau nāṃ ba ra kä śau ha ba ḍa u ū la ka
gä ba ra ka śau u nva dā vau nä au ra mū ṣa pa jsa u ga hā śa mai stä ga hai
śau u va la kä śau u thū ra ma śau u pū styą̄ nä : na ma vī ja tha va la kä śā
pū styāṃ jsa ha ba ḍa u ba da na drä ya u ṣką̄ mye he rä nā sā kä ra na va rai
kṣä ā śīʾ a kṣä rä ¤ u prra kai a kṣäʾ rä byau nä kvāṃ ṣī
thau ā śīʾ a kṣä rä ¤ byau na bū yu nä śau śū śvau ña kä a kṣä rä ¤

transcription.prose:
|| makala salya cvāvaja māśtä bistämye haḍai ṣaʾ khalavī cu ratanavaraikṣä āśīʾ u
prrakaittu būrä ṣacu vāṣṭä bauḍä va herä nauda • gaḍā-hvasta thauracaihä bera śā
u śaca prraiysge bira śā u kabalīja baysgyi hvāhyä ką̄madä śe u hūḍaigä
ysīḍai attaravāysä śau u hūḍaiga ysīḍai lahäpī śau u ką̄ra kagä khau-
ṣa thą̄racaihä pabanā śa u khaucīja khauśka śā u ījīnai hī-
rāsä hvattarakīnai ūra-bada śau u gaḍā-hvastä śīyi haysänā-
līkä thauracaihä dva u mījī jūna baysgyi kabala dvī u haija mai-
stä kabala u pe u śīyi maistä kabala śā u aysūra-gūna da-
jūna baimya kamaiśkä śā u nämāya śau baraka u ya • ma • hainai gaḍā hvastä
baysgi thauracaihä śau u haysnālīka gaḍā hvastä thauracaihä
dva u paha drau vī haysnālīkä śacī śau u haija baysgyi kabala
dvī u hainai thauna śacī u haysnālīkä thauna śaca dräya u śīya
baysgyi kabala tcaure u paima-vīstā kabalīnai draijsai śau u gahai śau u
eysnaṃ śā maista u dairśvā khaucvā drauhye bitcä dairsa u tcaurrvā starrvā ñū-
ṣṭyelīka u śau barä khaucä pajsāsä sera u paima-vīstāva thauna śacä ha-
darā śa u gaḍā hvastä thauracaihä jsa dā-gū baysgye paima jsa bira śā
u kagīja ṣkaumaka vīlaka śā hatca ttrraba jsa u dą̄rmīnai ṣką̄ma dale śau u
habastā gahā śa : gahai va maistä śau u valaka gahai śau u hatca hasą̄ña jsa
aiysna śā u nauṣṭara śau u kabalījä bįrga kagyä karastä śe u kabalī-
nai rūśkagä thūḍa-pa śau u kaimeja ysīḍā-mejanya kamaiśka śā u hai-
ja baysgyä kabala pajse u hainā thauna : ną̄ u ysīra gū śacī śau u pai-
mīnā thauna tcaura u phrramaina kabala śā u ką̄ra-kagä khauṣa śa hatca
āvasakāṃ jsa u mījī jūna śadā kaimejä īśīma śa u
u painajä śī nama śau u thauna śacī nūvarä
parekṣi śau u chava nū kāṃhä parakṣa śau u hainā śadā damarāśīʾnai maista kai-
mejä śau u śeʾ āṣana śadā damarāśīʾnai maistä kaimejä śau u dai-
dä āṣana śadā śagīnai maistä kaimejä śau u paha drauvī sya-
dai hvaradai thauracaihä śau u haysnālīka hūḍaigä śau baysgi u hadā
naṣkūmāya namavīña thavalakañä khauca haudūsä sera pyaṣṭalīka
u hūḍaiga yą̄ma-bakä śau u thauracaihä śūkyainä dva u hų̄naugyä
jsaiṇyāṃ hīrāṃ jsa habaḍa pyaṣṭalīkya khadīrakya śe u pūstyą̄na tcairma
tha valaka śā u mījījunä thauracaihä birä śā u maistä pū-
stye śau u ejsīnai vasīyikä śau u nūvarä barä u vatsāvīśīʾ-
nai hamauka śau pajūka śau u būśaunāṃ barakä śau habaḍa u ūla-ka-
gä baraka śau u nvadāvaunä auramūṣa pajsa u gahā śa maistä gahai
śau u valakä śau u thūra-ma śau u pūstyą̄nä : namavīja thavalakä śā
pūstyāṃ jsa habaḍa u badana dräya u ṣką̄mye herä nāsākä ranavarai-
kṣä āśīʾ akṣärä ¤ u prrakai akṣäʾrä byaunä kvāṃ ṣī-
thau āśīʾ akṣärä ¤ byauna būyunä śau-śū śvauñakä akṣärä ¤

translation.line: In the Year of the Monkey, the month of Cvātaja, the 20th day. This (is) a record because the reverend Ratnavṛkṣa and
Praketu rode to Shazhou and obtained things: one ... coat;
one ... coat of ... silk; one pair of trousers of thick and wide blanket cloth;
one undergarment of yellow ... ; one ... of yellow cloth [Tib. lag-phyis];
one pair of shoes of ... leather with laces of ...(?); and one ...;
one lether belt of black ...; two white ...; two blankets ...; a red large
blanket; one ... and white large blanket; and one asura-colored flaming
one thick ... of beaten red ...; two ... of beaten ... for *washing;
one silk cloth for *washing with ...; two thick red blankets;
three silk red cloths and wash cloths(?);
one large ...; one wool-.. ... for blankets; thirty ... in thirty ...; ... in four ...;
one ... of 15 ounces; one wool-... silk ...;
one smoke-colored coat of thick wool with ... of beaten ...; one small ... of leather; ... ...
one large ... and one small ...; ... ... one skin of wolf hide for blankets;
one sheep-skin fur [Tib. thul-pa] for blankets; ... ...
five thick red blankets; nine red cloths; one gold-colored silk (cloth);
four woolen cloths; one *silver-gilt [Tib. phra-men] blanket; one shoe of ...-leather;
one yellow-white three-color ...; one white ... felt (cloth); one new ... of cloth-silk;
one large *cover for a dharmarājika (stupa) of red earth;
a second large *cover for a dharmarājika (stupa) of dark earth; (28) a third large *cover for a ... of dark earth;
a third large *cover for a ... of dark earth;
one left and right ... of ... hair(?); one thick ... for *washing; a ... of 17 ounces ...;
one goblet mde of vasaka wood; one ...; one full perfume *purse; one purse of camel-skin;
five ...; one ...; one large ... and one small; one spoon [Tib. thur-ma]; one ... of felt, filled with ...;
three *ropes; and a container for ... things.
The reverend Ratnavṛkṣa’s akṣara. Praketu’s akṣara. The witness Kvāṃ Ṣīthau’s akṣara. The witness Būyunä Śauśū Śvaunaka’s akṣara.

comments.comment: Sheet of paper from scroll(?). Two Tib. texts (poems) at the end of b-side (twenty-six lines). Cf. Hoernle, 1911, pp. 474-75. Ser., pl. CXLVIII. The translation is based on Bailey’s notes in SD, TV, pp. 15-17 (see also Emmerick, 1985b).

comments.comment: Sgh [17] 13/14.2-16.8. Neb., p. 2 (S4 8). With H. 144 NSB 11 to the right. Combined text:

/// ja ḍī na uai ṣṣa ttä tä sai ndä bi śśä 50 7
/// sai ndä cu ttä tä hä ra sai ·d· ḍi 50 8
ysmū na ṣkau gye kṣiṃ jī ndä ja ḍa 50 9
/// sä cu ṣeiʾ saṃ tsā rä

verso.line: /// ṣṭä ttä tä ha rbi śśä d· ·d·
/// re kho ye hū ñä dai yä hä ra
/// byo re sa mu kho ā tā śä śśä 60 3
/// u ysno ra ṣkau gye hī vyā re bi śśe 60 4
