translation.line: ... things appear, thus (are) these skandhas all. 55
... many, of all kinds things appear. 56
... through folly, all these appear awake. 57
... seem, because these things appear to the fool. 58
... in (one’s) mind, the fools long for the skandhas. 59
... as one sees things in a dream. [62]
... beings, they appropriate all the skandhas. 64
... for me now only with you (is) refuge. 66

recto.line: lysā nu pa jsa mu ya nä kho drai śvo ggaṃ gvo nä tā vo sä ya ta • kye bi śśä klai śa tvī ṣṣe yä ḍā ndä u ha sta ma rra ṣṭa ba
lysū śtu bu sta ce rä ttye pu ña hi mā re pha ra u kye ṣä ā ya u ysnau rä kye ttī ye saṃ ghā ṭi sū trä vä te śśau tca
ra mu tcū rä sa lā vä ggā hu pyū ṣṭu ya nä • tte rī ttye u ysnau rä mä stä pu ñī nai ha mbī sä hä mä te
tta cu ne rro vā kyai bä śśu u spu rro pyū ṣṭu yī ndä • ttī tä gya stä ba lysa tta hve se pyūʾ bi sī vä rā ṣṣā kye
ṣä kye ttū saṃ ghā ṭu sū tru dā tu bi śśu u spu rro pyū ṣṭu yī ndä ci rī pha rä pu ña hä mā re • trā mu mā ñaṃ du
kye va ju ṣä u ysnau rä ā ya kye bä śśu tṛ sa ha srya ma hā sa ha srya ba lysā na tcā rī mä vä te kuṃ jsa tu ke rä

verso.line: ce rä tti kuṃ jsa tī ṅje dā ne pha rā ke hä mā re u tti rä ca kra va rtta rruṃ di hä mā ra u ṣi ju hveʾ hä mya
tsā tä ce bi śśū nī tta gä a naṃ khi ṣṭä u ṣi ju na ḍe bi śśā nu ttyā nu ca krra va rttā nu rru ndi nu hau rä hau
rä kye rä ttye pu ña hä mā re u kye vā śye prau da phā rri hau rä he ḍä ttye vā mä sta rä pu ñī nai haṃ
bī sä hä mä te || cu bu ru vā tṛ sa ha srye ma hā sa ha srye ba lysā ña tcā rī ma pa ryā va nna
u ysnau ra u tti bä śśä pa ḍā na phā rrä na hä mā re • u ttyā nu ye bi śśā nu hau ru hau rä cu tti pu ña hi
mā re ttā rä vā pu ña mä sta ra hä mā re ce śye ttye sa tvä hau ru he ḍä ce śye phā rru bu stä || cu bu ru vā tṛ sa

transcription.prose:
lysānu pajsamu yanä kho draiśvo ggaṃgvo nätāvo säyata • kye biśśä klaiśa tvīṣṣe yäḍāndä u hastama rraṣṭa ba-
lysūśtu busta cerä ttye puña himāre phara u kye ṣä āya uysnaurä kye ttīye saṃghāṭi sūträ väte śśau tca-
ramu tcūrä-salāvä ggāhu pyūṣṭu yanä • tterī ttye uysnaurä mästä puñīnai hambīsä hämäte
tta cu ne rro vā kyai bäśśu uspurro pyūṣṭu yīndä • ttītä gyastä balysa tta hve se pyūʾ bisīvärāṣṣā kye
ṣä kye ttū saṃghāṭu sūtru dātu biśśu uspurro pyūṣṭu yīndä cirī pharä puña hämāre • trāmu māñaṃdu
kye va ju ṣä uysnaurä āya kye bäśśu tṛsahasrya mahāsahasrya balysāna tcārīmä väte kuṃjsatu kerä
cerä tti kuṃjsatīṅje dāne pharāke hämāre u ttirä cakravartta rruṃdi hämāra u ṣi ju hveʾ hämya
tsātä ce biśśūnī ttagä anaṃkhiṣṭä u ṣi ju naḍe biśśānu ttyānu cakrravarttānu rrundinu haurä hau-
rä kyerä ttye puña hämāre u kye vā śye prauda-phārri haurä heḍä ttye vā mästarä puñīnai haṃ-
bīsä hämäte || cu buru vā tṛsahasrye mahāsahasrye balysāña tcārīma paryāvanna
uysnaura u tti bäśśä paḍāna phārräna hämāre • u ttyānu ye biśśānu hauru haurä cu tti puña hi-
māre ttārä vā puña mästara hämāre ce śye ttye satvä hauru heḍä ce śye phārru bustä || cu buru vā tṛsa-

comments.comment: From “Bundle I.” Sgh [24] 87.3-89.2. Neb., p. 19 (S3 39). This signature is that of fol. 39 only, see H. 142 NS 48 (IOL Khot 144/1).

recto.line: ha srye ma hā sa ha srye ba lysā ña tcā rī ma pa ryā va nna u ysnau ra u tti vā bi śśä śä te na phā rri na hä mā
ro u ttā nu ye hau ru hau rä cu tti pu ña hi mā re • ttā rä vā pu ña mä sta ra hä mā re kye śye ttye sa tvä hau rä
he ḍä ce di du phā rru bu stä • u cu bu ro vā tṛ sa ha srye ma hā sa ha srye ba lysā ña tcā rī ma pa ryā
va nna sa tva u tti vā bi śśä di dä na phā rrä na hä mā ra • u ttā nu ye bi śśā nu hau ro hau rä cu tti pu ña hi
mā re ttā rye pu ñī nai haṃ bī sä bu ḍa ru hä mä • kye śye ttye sa tvä hau ru he ḍä ce tcū ra mä phā rrä bu stä u cu bu ro
vā tri sa ha srye ma hā sa ha srye ba lysā ña tcā rī ma pa ryā va nna u ysnau ra tti bi śśä a ra ha nda

verso.line: hä mā ro u ttā nu ye bi śśā nu hau rä hau ru cu tti pu ña hä mā re • ttye vā mä sta rä pu ñī nai haṃ bī
sä hi mä te ce śye pra cya saṃ bu ddhä hau ru he ḍä || cu bu ro vā tṛ sa ha srye ma hā sa ha srye ba lysā
ña tcā rī ma pa ryā va nna u ysnau u tti bi śśä pra cya saṃ bu ddha hä mā ro ttā nu ye bi śśā nu
hau rä ttye vā mä sta rä pu ñī nai haṃ bī sä hä mä te • ce śye ba lysū ña vū ysai hau ru he ḍä ||
cu bu ru vā tṛ sa ha srye ma hā sa ha srye ba lysā ña tcā rī ma pa ryā va nna u ysno ra u tti bi
śśä bo dhi sa tva hä mā re u ttā nu ye bi śśā nu hau ra hau rä cu tti pu ña hä mā re • ttye vā mä sta rä

transcription.prose:
hasrye mahāsahasrye balysāña tcārīma paryāvanna uysnaura u tti vā biśśä śätena phārrina hämā-
ro u ttānu ye hauru haurä cu tti puña himāre • ttārä vā puña mästara hämāre kye śye ttye satvä haurä
heḍä ce didu phārru bustä • u cu buro vā tṛsahasrye mahāsahasrye balysāña tcārīma paryā-
vanna satva u tti vā biśśä didäna phārräna hämāra • u ttānu ye biśśānu hauro haurä cu tti puña hi-
māre ttārye puñīnai haṃbīsä buḍaru hämä • kye śye ttye satvä hauru heḍä ce tcūramä phārrä bustä u cu buro
vā trisahasrye mahāsahasrye balysāña tcārīma paryāvanna uysnaura tti biśśä arahanda
hämāro u ttānu ye biśśānu haurä hauru cu tti puña hämāre • ttye vā mästarä puñīnai haṃbī-
sä himäte ce śye pracyasaṃbuddhä hauru heḍä || cu buro vā tṛsahasrye mahāsahasrye balysā-
ña tcārīma paryāvanna uysnau u tti biśśä pracyasaṃbuddha hämāro ttānu ye biśśānu
haurä ttye vā mästarä puñīnai haṃbīsä hämäte • ce śye balysūñavūysai hauru heḍä ||
cu buru vā tṛsahasrye mahāsahasrye balysāña tcārīma paryāvanna uysnora u tti bi-
śśä bodhisatva hämāre u ttānu ye biśśānu haura haurä cu tti puña hämāre • ttye vā mästarä

recto.line: pu ñī nai haṃ bī sä hä mä te kye śśau gya stu ba lysu va ra a ysmū va sū jä te || cu bu ro vā tri sa ha srye
ma hā sa ha srye ba lysā ña tcā rī ma pa ryā vaṃ na u ysnau ra u tti bi śśä gya sta ba lysa hi mā ro u
tte ye bi śśä gya sta ba lysa va ra a ysmū va sū jä te cu tti pu ña hi mā re ttā rye vā mä sta rä
pu ñī nai haṃ bī sä hä mä te kye ttū saṃ ghā ṭu dā tu pyū vāʾ te tta cu ne rro vā pā tco sa rva
śśū ra va ra hva nai ce ttū saṃ ghā ṭu dā tu pū stya pī rā te di jsā te vā śī yä a rthuī kä taʾ yä tta cu
ne rro ·ā sa rva śśū ra va ra hva nai • kye ttū saṃ ghā ṭu sū tri dā tä ttu vā ro va su te na a ysmū na

verso.line: na ma sī yä tta cu te sai ttä sa rva śśū ra hau tā re ja ḍa pra hu ja na u ysnau ra ttu saṃ ghā ṭu dā tu
pyū vāʾ ṇa • ṣṣai kuī nā ma pyū vāʾ re ne nä hā pra ysā tä hä mä te • pyū sa rva śśū ra a śtä ce ha nä
ja ḍä hveʾ pra hu ja nä ce va da rrau va ma hā sa mu ndro va hī ysā nä • sa rva śśū rä bo dhi sa tvä tta hve
se nä gya sta ba lysa gya stä ba lysī tta hve se a śtä sa rva śśū ra ce ha nä hve ce śśä na da stä na
ma hā sa muṃ drru ba jau ttu ya nä sa rva śśū rä bo dhi sa tvä tta hve sä nä gya sta ba lysa • ne mi ḍā
na gya sta ba lysa • gya stä ba lysī tta hva te se crrā mu sa rva śśū ra ni śtä u ysnau rä ce hau tta ma

transcription.prose:
puñīnai haṃbīsä hämäte kye śśau gyastu balysu vara aysmū vasūjäte || cu buro vā trisahasrye
mahāsahasrye balysāña tcārīma paryāvaṃna uysnaura u tti biśśä gyasta balysa himāro u
tte ye biśśä gyasta balysa vara aysmū vasūjäte cu tti puña himāre ttārye vā mästarä
puñīnai haṃbīsä hämäte kye ttū saṃghāṭu dātu pyūvāʾte tta cu ne rro vā pātco sarva-
śśūra vara hvanai ce ttū saṃghāṭu dātu pūstya pīrāte dijsāte vāśīyä arthuī kätaʾyä tta cu
ne rro (v)ā sarvaśśūra vara hvanai • kye ttū saṃghāṭu sūtri dātä ttuvāro vasutena aysmūna
namasīyä tta cu te saittä sarvaśśūra hautāre jaḍa prahujana uysnaura ttu saṃghāṭu dātu
pyūvāʾṇa • ṣṣai kuī nāma pyūvāʾre ne nä hā praysātä hämäte • pyū sarvaśśūra aśtä ce hanä
jaḍä hveʾ prahujanä ce va darrauva mahāsamundro vahīysānä • sarvaśśūrä bodhisatvä tta hve
se nä gyasta balysa gyastä balysī tta hve se aśtä sarvaśśūra ce hanä hve ce śśäna dastäna
mahāsamuṃdrru bajauttu yanä sarvaśśūrä bodhisatvä tta hve sä nä gyasta balysa • ne miḍā-
na gyasta balysa • gyastä balysī tta hvate se crrāmu sarvaśśūra niśtä uysnaurä ce hautta ma-

recto.line: hā sa muṃ dru hūʾ trā mī ttu nä jsa ḍu sa rva śśū ra ce ttä u ysnau ra kye va ma sā ma ta v· rū ḍya ne hau tā
re ttū dā tu pyū ṣṭe • ce ttä sa rva śū ra u ysno ra kye tti rä gya sta ba lysa dä tā ndä kho ha ṣṭe voʾ kū
lvo ggaṃ guoʾ nä tā vuo gruī cyau sya ta ṣṣai tti nä ho tā re ttū saṃ ghā ṭu sū trä pyū ṣṭe || u ce ṣä
u ysno rä ce ttä rä gya sta ba lysa dä te pa ḍā kho nve voʾ ggaṃ gu voʾ ni tā vuo grī cyo sya ta ne tti ṣṣai
ttū saṃ ghā ṭu dā tu pyū ṣṭä ya nī ndä || u cu tti u ysno ra ce kū lu sa te ysā re gya sta ba lysa nä
dä tā ndä ʾī ndä cī yä ttū saṃ ghā ṭu dā tu pyū vāʾ re a pra mā nvī ya nā re || u ce ttä sa rva śśū

verso.line: ra ce ttä rä gya sta ba lysa dyāṃ di kho kū lvo ggaṃ gu vuo nä tā vauʾ gruī cyo sya ta tti u ysnau ra cī yä saṃ
ghā ṭu dā tu pyū vā re a ysmū nä hā pra ysai yä ttū su trä va ra sī ra hä mā rä kho rra ṣṭu ttai a
ysmū na pa ysā nī ndä • u ce vā ttū saṃ ghā ṭu dā tu vä te rra ṣṭo pī rā tte tu ya nde u nai a
pra mā nä ya nde pyū sa rva śśū ra u ce ro ha lci ttū saṃ ghā ṭu dā tu vä te śśo tca ra mu cā tu
ṣpa to ggā hu pū stya pī rā te cī yä ṣä u ysnau ttū ysaṃ thu pa śśe te ku ye pu spa re no tä ysā
re kū la ba lysā ne tcā rī mä pa rrä te hä me va ra ba lysā na tcā rī mä a śtä trā ma kho su hā va tä ṣä u ysno

transcription.prose:
hāsamuṃdru hūʾ trāmī ttu näjsaḍu sarvaśśūra ce ttä uysnaura kye vamasāmata v(ā)rūḍya ne hautā-
re ttū dātu pyūṣṭe • ce ttä sarvaśūra uysnora kye ttirä gyasta balysa dätāndä kho haṣṭevoʾ kū-
lvo ggaṃguoʾ nätāvuo gruīcyau syata ṣṣai tti nä hotāre ttū saṃghāṭu sūträ pyūṣṭe || u ce ṣä
uysnorä ce ttärä gyasta balysa däte paḍā kho nvevoʾ ggaṃguvoʾ nitāvuo grīcyo syata ne tti ṣṣai
ttū saṃghāṭu dātu pyūṣṭä yanīndä || u cu tti uysnora ce kūlu sate-ysāre gyasta balysa nä
dätāndä ʾīndä cīyä ttū saṃghāṭu dātu pyūvāʾre apramānvī yanāre || u ce ttä sarvaśśū-
ra ce ttärä gyasta balysa dyāṃdi kho kūlvo ggaṃguvuo nätāvauʾ gruīcyo syata tti uysnaura cīyä saṃ-
ghāṭu dātu pyūvāre aysmū nä hā praysaiyä ttū suträ vara sīra hämārä kho rraṣṭu ttai a-
ysmūna paysānīndä • u ce vā ttū saṃghāṭu dātu väte rraṣṭo pīrāttetu yande u nai a-
pramānä yande pyū sarvaśśūra u ce ro halci ttū saṃghāṭu dātu väte śśo tcaramu cātu-
ṣpato ggāhu pūstya pīrāte cīyä ṣä uysnau ttū ysaṃthu paśśete ku ye pusparenotä ysā-
re kūla balysāne tcārīmä parräte häme vara balysāna tcārīmä aśtä trāma kho suhāvatä ṣä uysno-

recto.line: rä va ra hī śtä u ttā nu sa rva śśū ra u ysnau rā ṇu va ra ttye lo va dā tä tca hau rä ha ṣṭā tä ysā re ka lpa
va ṣṭa jsī na hä mä te || pyū sa rva śśū ra kye ha lci ba lysū ña vū ysā ī ndä ma ra saṃ ghā ṭu sū tri vä
te tcū rä sa lā vu śśau ggā hu pyū vā nde o ce vā sa rva śśū ra ha nda rä u ysnau rä ʾī yä ce paṃ
jsa a na nta na rya kä ḍä gā ne yä ḍe ʾī yä o vā kā ṣṭe ʾī yä ṣä vā ma ra ttä ye
saṃ ghā ṭu dā tä vä te tcū rä sa lā vu śśau tca ra mu ggā hu pyū vā te ttye u ysnau rä bi śśä dī ra kä
ḍyā ne jyā re • pyū sa rva śśū ra pā tco te ttä di kä ttī ye sū trä bu ljse hvā ñī mä • kau j· sa rva śśū ra

verso.line: ṣä hveʾ hä mä te ce ba lysā nä cī ya ha tca ñä te u ba lysū ña vū ysau sa tvo sa mā hā nä na u sthaṃ jä
u ba lysū śte jsa u ysnau rä bya nu ya nä u me rä jī vä tu nā sta u u sta mu ṣä u ysno rä ā kṣū ba
nā tä u kā ṣco yaṃ di u ttai hä mä te sä pa na ṣṭä mä a ysu ttä te na tta ra nda rna • u pa na ṣṭä
ṃä haṃ da rña ysī ntha ka lpu va ṣṭa a ysu pa na ṣṭä mä u ttī yä mä stä a ysmya ha ysgu ṣṭa
nä hä me u du kha jai vī ya ne hä mā re styū de ttī re nu ṣṭu re • ttī vī ya ne va śī vä te ttye kä ḍä gā
nä pvaʾ sta ñä u ttu rru sa rva śśū ra hvaṃ du bi śśä u ysno ra pa śśī ndä u pa re hā rai jsa • u ||

transcription.prose:
rä vara hīśtä u ttānu sarvaśśūra uysnaurāṇu vara ttye lovadātä tcahaurähaṣṭātä ysāre kalpa
vaṣṭa jsīna hämäte || pyū sarvaśśūra kye halci balysūñavūysā īndä mara saṃghāṭu sūtri vä-
te tcūrä-salāvu śśau ggāhu pyūvānde o ce vā sarvaśśūra handarä uysnaurä ʾīyä ce paṃ-
jsa anantanarya käḍägāne yäḍe ʾīyä o vā kāṣṭe ʾīyä ṣä vā mara ttäye
saṃghāṭu dātä väte tcūrä-salāvu śśau tcaramu ggāhu pyūvāte ttye uysnaurä biśśä dīra kä-
ḍyāne jyāre • pyū sarvaśśūra pātco te ttädikä ttīye sūträ buljse hvāñīmä • kau j(u) sarvaśśūra
ṣä hveʾ hämäte ce balysānä cīya hatcañäte u balysūñavūysau satvo samāhānäna usthaṃjä
u balysūśte jsa uysnaurä byanu yanä u merä jīvätu nāsta u ustamu ṣä uysnorä ākṣūba
nātä u kāṣco yaṃdi u ttai hämäte sä panaṣṭämä aysu ttätena ttarandarna • u panaṣṭä-
ṃä haṃdarña ysīntha kalpu vaṣṭa aysu panaṣṭämä u ttīyä mästä aysmya haysguṣṭa-
nä häme u dukhajai vīyane hämāre styūde ttīre nuṣṭure • ttī vīyane vaśīväte ttye käḍägā-
nä pvaʾstañä u ttu rru sarvaśśūra hvaṃdu biśśä uysnora paśśīndä u parehārai jsa • u ||

comments.comment: B. kau ja; upper paper layer missing.

/// braudaimä ku dätemä aysu bremandā gyasta nāga yakṣa rakṣaysa kye

(sätemä) /// gyasta balysa • tti paranärväta gyasta balysa • u tta tti sū-

(ysana) /// d(i)śä jsa kūlu sate ysāre āysana baṣṭarrda dyaimä u tti gyastānu 
            
 /// haudyau ratanyau jsa • biśśānu ttyānu āysanānu be-(ndä) ///

Em.: a]hutāṣṭä; see Studies I, p. 129 s.v. hutāṣṭa- “well-thought.”

recto.line: hā tvā di śi bu ḍä • ku vī ra ā tä ttū mi rā hī nai hā rä dye ggu mā cai yu ḍe ṣi hā
ṣi hi mye hvaṃ ḍä ā ṣṭä kṣiṃ jä • ttī rre drrā tai hi mye vī ja haṃ grī yä cu beʾ va ska vī jya bu
pa stä si jsa nā ñä ṣi ā ja vi ṣi ā maṃ drrāṃ pąʾ ñyau jsa au pra ha ra ṇāṃ pąʾ ñyau au bi śśa
au dai na pa da jsā ñä thyau nya na ṣiʾ mi rā hī nai hā rna u ysnau ra jsī re sa tva pa da ///
ca nä yu ḍä ī ndä ttī ttä vī ja rru ndä hī vī ttū pa rau pyū ṣṭā ndä haṃ dā ra ysi nau ttā n·ä
ndä hvā ñä • u haṃ dā ra pā rṣṣä a gga dä śū stā ndä • bi śśä vī ra h·

verso.line: ṇi haʾ jā mä • bi śśä śrā va stä kṣī ra hvaṃ ḍä ā rau tta • tti ri khu vi śśā kha ū̆
tä saṃ kuī pyū ṣṭi yu ḍā bi śśä pī rmā tta mä saṃ du ṣṭaa ysmva ·i mya • tta tta
mā nai hā ri ṣṭä • ni jä ā ja vi ṣi • tti na cu ni ū tca u nä dei
jä vā ttrā tä u nä pąʾ ñau jsa hvaṃ ḍye a rthä pi rau ḍi ya nī ndä u nä ysye
stryau kī ryau jsa haṃ jsau ndä da rrau na a ysä ttū sa lā vä tta tta hvā ñūṃ • ttī vi śśā kha ū
ha ma yä hā tsuā • ṣa mī bī śśä tta tta pa stā • nä ṣi ā ja vi ṣi ma mā nei ṣi saṃ hā ri ṣṭä ///

transcription.prose:
hā tvā diśi buḍä • ku vīra ātä ttū mirāhīnai hārä dye ggumācai yuḍe ṣi hā(ra) (ājavi)-
ṣi himye hvaṃḍä āṣṭä kṣiṃjä • ttī rre drrātai himye vīja haṃgrīyä cu beʾ vaska vījya bu(vīru)
pastä si jsanāñä ṣi ājaviṣi ā maṃdrrāṃ pąʾñyau jsa au praharaṇāṃ pąʾñyau au biśśa (bañāñä)
au daina padajsāñä thyau nyana ṣiʾ mirāhīnai hārna uysnaura jsīre satva pada ///
canä yuḍä īndä ttī ttä vīja rrundä hīvī ttū parau pyūṣṭāndä haṃdāra ysinauttān(d)ä (āṣṭā)
ndä hvāñä • u haṃdāra pārṣṣä aggadä śūstāndä • biśśä vīra h·
ṇihaʾjāmä • biśśä śrāvastä kṣīra hvaṃḍä ārautta • ttiri khu viśśākha ū̆(vāysya) (pyūṣṭā)-
tä saṃ kuī pyūṣṭi yuḍā biśśä-pīrmāttamä saṃduṣṭa-aysmva (h)imya • tta tta (hvātä) (ma)-
mānai hāri ṣṭä • ni jä ājaviṣi • ttina cu ni ūtca u nä dei (nä)
jä vā ttrātä u nä pąʾñau jsa hvaṃḍye arthä pirauḍi yanīndä u nä ysye
stryau kīryau jsa haṃjsaundä darrauna aysä ttū salāvä tta tta hvāñūṃ • ttī viśśākha ū(vāysya)
hamayä hā tsuā • ṣa mī bīśśä tta tta pastā • nä ṣi ājaviṣi mamānei ṣi saṃ hāri ṣṭä ///

translation.line: ... he rode in that direction. When he came to the gate, he saw this pearl necklace. He doubted: “That necklace
has become a snake. It begins to long for men.” Then the king became faint. He gathered the medics: “What medicine do [you] know for poison?”
He ordered: “That snake must be killed, either by the powers of spells or by the powers of weapons! Either [it must be bound?] in the house
or be burnt by fire. Quickly ... That pearl necklace *deceives people, it ... people ... [so that]
they can not do ...” Then those medics heard this order of the king’s. Some washed, [some began]
to recite, and some purified ... Everywhere ...
we shall restrain (it). All men in the land of Śrāvasti were in commotion, so much so that the laywoman Viśākhā [heard it?]
As soon as she had heard it, her mind became extremely pleased. Thus she [said]:
“It is my necklace, and it is definitely not a snake, because neither water nor fire [... nor]
indeed ..., and they do not with their powers make people’s things full of worms, and [they do not] take (them) away.
With the intrepitude accumulated through works of ... I shall pronounce this word thus.” Then the laywoman Viśākhā
herself went there. She ordered thus to the servant girl: “That is not a snake. That is just my necklace.” ...

comments.comment: MKhot. Neb., p. 101. Story involving the laywoman Viśākhā.

recto.line: /// ṣi cu kva kä ttyą̄ nä hī vyā nä mā rā pya rą̄ nä
/// jsā rä mū ri mi rā he ho ḍa ma mä mā ma kä
/// ttye vi pa śyä sa rva ñä ba lysä bi ṣṭyau jsa haṃ tsa
/// • śśā stā rä vi pa śyä ba lysä ttye ba lysä bi
/// ā vi pa śyä ba lysä a ysī ttye bi ṣṭū pā ba
/// jsa nā bryū na cu ka rä haṃ da rye ni ī dä

verso.line: /// ye sa tvä a ysī ttye bi ṣṭūṃ ba lysä tta tta
/// ka khu yi ba lysä nā ma ni pyū ṣḍe va ñai
/// vaṃ ña va rai jsāṃ pa jsa mä ya nā mä
/// la pī hi jsa ysī rrä nā dä u hā tsuā dä
/// hau ḍā dä u ttai hvā dä se pū ra ka ṣe mā
/// mi hyau jse ha rbi śśä rrā śa

translation.line: ... that youngster ... of his own parents ...
... to that Vipaśyin omniscient Buddha with the disciples
... the teacher, the Buddha Vipaśyin ... of that Buddha ...
... came the Buddha Vipaśyin. I have *made it for him, daddy!
... took from ..., O dear ones, for there are no others.
... being. I have *made it for that Buddha. Thus
... when one does not hear the Buddha’s name, now for him
... now I shall pay homage to him right there.
... they took (bought) the gold at the price .. and went there.
... they gave (paid) ... and said to him: “Little son, that ...
... by us everything [has been given] into your jurisdiction.

comments.comment: MKhot. Neb., p. 114. Ms. similar to Kha. i.185.1 (IOL Khot 28/15) and Kha. i.306b (IOL Khot 34/2).

transcription.prose:
väna jägye vātco jiyāre • väno ṣkogyānu dyāre 60 1 väna pätāyemi (jsa) dātu gaṃbhīru rraṣṭu hvatā-
ndä • väna tsūmate jsa tsutāndä vino viñānä bvāre 2 vina ātme jīvitä satvi vina poṣi pudgali
sajñe vina padīmākä paysānāki buvāki tsūki hvarāki • vino skandhānu ne ską-
ndha haṣṭūsu dāta dvāsu āyatana biśi ttä jsa ne īndä ne vā vina ttānä ttäna cu ta-
tvatu ttyo biśyo hamaṃgu biśi sarvadharma u balysa śo näjsaḍu samu kho marīca
biśi sajñamātre lovä biśi sajñamātrā balysa biśi sajñamātrā kṣetra samu kho ṣei sajñe jsa dätte 60 6
viñāni pracai rūva hamatä karä rūta ne īndi viñāni balysa niruddhä ttäna vino rūti diyāñä 7 cu ṣä samu saṃ-
ñe jsa dätte cu rro hamatä harbiśi balysa • dro-mase niśtä viśeṣä samu kho ātāśä hamaṃgu 60 8
saña ttū balysu padaṃdātä hamatu ttatvatu niśti • trāmu ysamaśandā draya samu hīviñe saṃñe jsa ʾīndi
kvī vikalpīmi balysä dätte • ku ne kar-ju ne dätte trāmu ttätä harbiśi dharma samu hīvī a(ysmuī) īñä 70 cvī citra-mātra

translation.line: ... Without destruction they are destroyed. Without the skandhas they appear. 61. Without speaking they have spoken the correct, profound Law.
Without going they have gone. Without vijñāna they know. (6)2. Without soul, life, being, without poṣa, person,
saṃjñā, without maker, realizer, knower, goer, eater. (63) Without the skandhas there are no skandhas,
18 dhātus, 12 āyatanas. All those are not with them, nor without them. (64) Because
in reality all dharmas are equal to all those. And the Buddha is of one kind. (65) Just like a mirage
all the world is just saṃjñā, all the buddhas are just saṃjñā, all the fields are just saṃjñā. Through saṃjñā it appears just like this. 66.
Because of vijñāna there are forms. Forms themselves are not at all. Vijñāna, O Buddha, is obstructed. Therefore it should be viewed as without form. (6)7. Whatever
appears only by saṃjñā and what (are) all the buddhas themselves—there is no difference even the size of a hair. It is just equal to space. 68.
Saṃjñā has made this Buddha. By itself nothing is in reality. Thus the three earths: they are only by one’s own saṃjñā. (69)
When I construct him (vikalpaya) the Buddha appears, when I don’t he does not appear at all. All these dharmas (are) only on account of one’s own *mind. 70. What ... its nothing but *citta ...

(śtu) (va)rä || cu ne ro vā cai pīḍu däjsāte hvāñīyä vāśīyä ne ne ttye śāriputra

sīvrāṣṣā bodhisatvä balysūñavūysai haṃ vī /// kalyāṇamättrā(ṃ) dyāmata

nä māñāñä ku ggāṭhāñyo vyāvulyo jsa pahäṣṭä /// hämäte • u cu akalyā-
ṇamittryau jsa haṃphau ttye käḍäna bäsa paśśāña u ci /// ikī ju aśtä ṣai biśśu patsā(ñä) ///

line.n: a1 a2 a3 a4 b1 b2 b3 b4

translation.line: [... said, “How, O gracious Lord] Buddha, should a bodhi-seeking bodhisattva seek a kalyāṇamitra?” The Buddha said to him: “If, son of the house (kulaputra), a bodhi-seeking bodhisattva always wishes to see kalyāṇamitras and he performs the pāramitā of energy (vīryapāramitā) for the sake of (obtaining) kalyāṇamitras, then he should walk 100 leagues (yojana) on burning fire to where he loves the Law. Equipped with those four dharmas a bodhi-seeking bodhisattva should seek a kalyāṇamitra.” Then the bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi spoke thus to the Buddha: “How, gracious Lord Buddha, should a bodhisattva remain in a forest retreat (āraṇyāyatana) where he is free from the troubles related to a householder (gṛhastha)? And as for the meeting with non-kalyāṇamitras, should he therefore leave (his) house and should he leave behind whatever little he has? ...”

comments.comment: Actual: No.vii 150 6 . Neb., p. 156. With H. vii.150.17 (next) to the right. Combined text:

mä a śtä ju ro hą nda rä pa jsa mä gya stä ba lysä ttu va ḍa ru ce ro ha sta rä ā ya va su tta rä pī rmā tta rä ttye rrä spū rä ba lysä pra bhā
u ska ā tā śä ṣṭā nai dī va ta tta hva tā tä dha rma pū śa bä sī vä rā ṣṣā bi śā nu ha sta ma hva ta ttī tä ṣä rrä spū rä tta hva te tta k·
ṣa dha rma pū śa dī va tai tta hva tā tä thu bä sī vä rā ṣṣā tt· ju gya stu ba lysu va ra tso u ttu pu lsa se kā ma dha rma pū śa •

jä gya stä ba lysä vä tä hā ṣṭu tsu te ku hā tsu te hä mä t· tty· gya stä ba lysä poʾ tte re jsa na ma sä te drai tcī ra nä tvaṃ da nu tsu te u śau hā lau
tä u ku śau hā lau vä stā tä hä mä tä sau ma cha tträ rrä spū rä ttu gya stu ba lysu tta bra ṣṭe dha rma pū śa hvī nde gya sta ba lysa kā ma ṣa dha rma p·
gya stä ba lysä • ttī vā ṣä bhai ṣa jya rā jä gya stä ba lysä so ma ccha tträ rrä spū rä tta hva te dha rma pū śa hvī nde • a lysā nā cu ttä ba lysā na h·

transcription.prose:
vara śau rräspūrä somachatträ nāma vätä ttye śśūkye pūrātä āṇä aysmya vittarkä panatä crāmu padī muhu gyastä balysä pajsamu yä(ḍ)ā(ndä)
mä aśtä ju ro hąndarä pajsamä gyastä balysä ttuvaḍaru ce ro hastarä āya vasuttarä pīrmāttarä ttye rräspūrä balysä prabhā(väna)
uska ātāśä ṣṭānai dīvata tta hvatātä dharmapūśa bäsīvärāṣṣā biśānu hastama hvata ttītä ṣä rräspūrä tta hvate tta k(āma)
ṣa dharmapūśa dīvatai tta hvatātä thu bäsīvärāṣṣā tt(u) (bhaiṣajyarā)ju gyastu balysu vara tso u ttu pulsa se kāma dharmapūśa • (ṣä)
gyastä balysä västarna hvāñätä bärāśätä ttī vā śakkrä ṣä (somachatträ) (rrä)spūrä ttye dīvate hīvī salāvu nāte • kāmu hālau ṣä bh(aiṣajyarā-)
jä gyastä balysä vätä hāṣṭu tsute ku hā tsute hämät(e) tty(e) gyastä balysä poʾ ttere jsa namasäte drai tcīra nä tvaṃdanu tsute u śau hālau (västā-)
tä u ku śau hālau västātä hämätä saumachatträ rräspūrä ttu gyastu balysu tta braṣṭe dharmapūśa hvīnde gyasta balysa kāma ṣa dharmap(ūśa)
gyastä balysä • ttī vā ṣä bhaiṣajyarājä gyastä balysä somacchatträ rräspūrä tta hvate dharmapūśa hvīnde • alysānā cu ttä balysāna h(uhvata)

recto.line: nde o hi ma vą nda • o mu ci li ndra • o ma hā mu ci li ndra • o ga nda mā ya nä • o ra ta nī nā ga re • o ha ryā sa ga re • o ca kkra vā la • ma hā ca kkra vā la ga re • ttä bi śä
ttä ña ra ta nī nya kṣa ttro dä sta • u cu ro ttṛ sa ha sro ma hā sa ha sryau lau va dhā tä vä tä su rū tca • ā ṣiṃ gye kha lā nā • gya he • nä tā • vä ndä ka nä tā • mä sta nä
tā • u ma hā sa mu dra ttä bi śä ttä ña ra ta nī nya kṣa ttro dä sta • u cu ro ttra sa ha sryo ma hā sa ha sryo lo va dhā tu vä tä • cā tä dī vyo • kū lu sa te pu rre • u rma
ysdā ne • stā rā u gya sta nā ga • a ysu ra • gga ru ḍa • ki nna ra • ma ho ra tā nu • āʾ ma te • u cu ā v· te • ką nthe • pa rmi ha ja na va te • kṣī ra ñi • rru n·ā nu āʾ ma te

verso.line: ttä tä bi śśi hä ra ttä tä ña ra ta nī nya kṣa ttro dä sta • u cu bu ro da śvoʾ di śvoʾ lo va dhā toʾ • gya stā nu ba lys· ñā ma ta • nyā pī yä • bi śa ṣa pra tä śru ka ·t· ña ra ta nī
nya kṣa tträ ṇa na ra ndo pyūʾ ṣṭā ndä : ttī vā ṣa bi śa rṣa ba lysä na • ttū tta ndrā mu prā hā lī di tu yä ḍā ndä • sī ra hä mä ta • u śä ru ṇu stu • su hau tta hä mä ta • sī
ru ṣṭa na tā t· nä hä mä ta • su hau tta sī ra vā tä nä ysā ta • || a tä nä du ṣka ru sa stu • haṃ ju da sta nā ndä • u gya stu ba lysu na ma sä tā ndä • a nä mä jsyau tceʾ
ma ñyau gya stu ba lysu pä jsä ṣṭā ndä • u tta vä stā ta • a tä nä du ṣka ru sa stu • cī ra tnā ka rä le cha vä a lysā nei ttū nä jsa ḍu gya stä ba lysi • na mä stu prā hā lī

transcription.prose:
nde o himavąnda • o mucilindra • o mahāmucilindra • o gandamāyanä • o ratanīnā gare • o haryāsa gare • o cakkravāla • mahācakkravāla gare • ttä biśä
ttäña ratanīnya kṣattro dästa • u cu ro ttṛsahasro mahāsahasryau lauvadhātä vätä surūtca • āṣiṃgye khalānā • gyahe • nätā • vändäka nätā • mästa nä-
tā • u mahāsamudra ttä biśä ttäña ratanīnya kṣattro dästa • u cu ro ttrasahasryo mahāsahasryo lovadhātu vätä • cātädīvyo • kūlu sate purre • urma-
ysdāne • stārā u gyasta nāga • aysura • ggaruḍa • kinnara • mahoratānu • āʾmate • u cu āv(u)te • kąnthe • parmiha janavate • kṣīrañi • rrun(d)ānu āʾmate
ttätä biśśi hära ttätäña ratanīnya kṣattro dästa • u cu buro daśvoʾ diśvoʾ lovadhātoʾ • gyastānu balys(ānu) (hvā)ñāmata • nyāpīyä • biśa ṣa pratäśruka (•) (t)t(ä)ña ratanī-
nya kṣatträṇa narando pyūʾṣṭāndä : ttī vā ṣa biśa (pa)rṣa balysäna • ttū ttandrāmu prāhālī ditu yäḍāndä • sīra hämäta • u śäru ṇu (sa)stu • suhautta hämäta • sī-
ruṣṭanatāt(ä) nä hämäta • suhautta sīravātä nä ysāta • || atä nä duṣkaru sastu • haṃju dasta nāndä • u gyastu balysu namasätāndä • anämäjsyau tceʾ-
mañyau gyastu balysu päjsäṣṭāndä • u tta västāta • atä nä duṣkaru sastu • cī ratnākarä lechavä alysānei ttū näjsaḍu gyastä balysi • na mästu prāhālī

comments.comment: Vim fol. 8 1.8.1-1.10.0. Neb., p. 42. Bailey: H. 142 NS 88 + 89. The folio may once have been broken in two parts in the middle, but the tear as now hardly noticeable; Leumann does not mention it. Skjærvø, 1986.

recto.line: hā ñu tca mna gya stvā tsī ndä • u cu rru vā tcu tti ci räo ju ye tca ra mu hā ṣai pu ñau ggī stu yī ndä ttyāṃ nvī vā
/// ma rī mū sysaṃ thvi ya śśi rāa tā tä hi mā te • u ce vā tco tti u ysnau ra ce vä te ju ba lysū ña vū ysai
/// ṇi ṣṭi • tta tta vi tī vā tcu mai tra ka ru ṇa mu di tta tce ra u ka rī hā ḍe u ysnau ra vīä te u pe vi kṣa ni tce
u ysnau rä vä te ttrā mu hī śśi ḍau śtī nau a ysmū ya nde khu pī ru śśau ysā tu śśi ra ta ra ṇu pū rä vä
vīä te o di ā stai mi jsā ya bu ru pa nu u ysnau rä vīä te mu lśdu u pe vä te • u cu ba lysā nu bau
bu ljse śśi re te ṣa hā ni śi rea te tä byā ta ya nde u a ysmū hā va sū jä te ṣai vā tcu mu di tta sī ra vā tä haṃ ggeʾ •
/// u pe vi kṣa khvai vā ṣaʾ a hi mä te ku ni vā tcu u ysnau ra vīä te u pe vi kṣa tce ra śtä • tti na ku sa tvau u pe vi kṣä te tta cu rru ba
/// vā hā ḍe u pe vi kṣe tce ri cu na tu su ṣu mu ḍu ṣvaʾ jeūʾ dā tu ba lysā ne bu tte u nai hā bvā ma ta hau ttio •

verso.line: /// se ttu to a ysu ne bue ve ttu tu ba lysa buā vā re • a va śä ṣa ma mä h· va hi mā te kvī vā a ysu bu stä hi
· /// ña vū ysai pa ḍā u pe vi kṣa a rna ndī śśā ma ta haṃ ggeʾ • tta pā tcu vā ba lysū ña vū ysai ṣa u pe vi kṣa kvī hā vä bu ljsā sta
śä te tta pā tcuī ṣā u pe vi kṣa haṃ ggeʾ • u ku vā tcu ttu bu tte pe tta ttī ka ju u ysnau rā ṇu śi ru yu ḍä ya nūä mä ne śū ka gā
/// je ne nya skye u ne du khi • tta pā tcu ṣāʾ a ba lysū ña vū ysai a raṃ naṃ dī śā ma ta u pe vi kṣa haṃ ggeʾ • tta pā tcu vā
/// u ysnau rā ṇu śi rea te te ya nā ma ki ḍe du ṣka ra • tta kā ma drrai pa dya cu ttā nu u ysnau rā ṇu haṃ jsia
tha ku śa la mū la ha ta ḍa rāṃ jsyä ya ni ī ndä ṣä ki ḍe ṣka ru ka ye ttyā nu śi ru yu ḍu ī ndä • tti na cu a tä
rā ṇu ṣeʾ pa ḍā • kye vā tcä a nya ttī rthya o vā pa ḍā a ña tti rthi ya vä ta oau nu vā tcu tti rthā nu dui ṣṭa • tta
/// śśi ru gu yu ḍu gī yī ndi tta ṣā vā tcu śäʾ ta ba lysū ña vū ysai ki ḍe du ṣka ra : || : || •

recto.line: ra ṇa vi ṣkaṃ bhä • su dha nä vi mu kti ca ndrä • ma hā sthā ma
/// su sthi tta ma tä • dṛ ḍha ma tä • śśā ntä ma ta ma hā ma • vi ma la kī ·tt·
/// sa tvä ā staṃ na bi śśā nu gya stā nu ba lysą̄ nu u bi śśā nu bo dhi sa
/// u bi śśā nu ṣṣā vā nu • u bi śśā nu ri ṣa yā nu bi śśā nu na ma s ///
ndo o rra ṣṭu pa stā ta ī ndä o yā va śśi rye hi rä pra ysaṃ na ī ndä • tty· ///
/// nu nä ba ña hi me • hu lgu a ysmū na ttrā mī tta raṃ da rna na ma sī u pvāʾ ṇä ///

verso.line: /// va rbu ru drai ṇu ra ta nā nu ā rū vo tsī mä u da sau ku śśa la ka rma p· ///
/// ya nä • tta pa ḍā na hau na u tta śä te na u tta di di na gya sta ba lysa u ///
/// ä na u vā rna a ysmū na vā ā ysda ya nī rä mu hu ṣṣa ṇī rä u ///
hau ra mi sta rruṃ di u śrī ma hā dī va tä • u be rā ka gya sta u bū ///
/// mā nu o ba lsā nu • o cī yā nu • ci vā kṣī rä prū va o sī
/// haṃ da sta o bā tā nu o baṃ hyā nu gga ri ṇu nyā tā n·

translation.line: ... the bodhisattva ... and the others: all the lord buddhas and all the bodhisattvas
... and all the students and all the rishis, all (of them) *I revere ...
... who have entered onto the correct path or are graced in everything including good thing(s). ...
... will be upon them. Humbly in mind and likewise in body he should revere (them) and [do homage] at their feet
... so far I go for the refuge of the three jewels, and ... the ten good deeds. ...
... I do ... thus with the first word and thus with the second and thus with the third ... the lord buddhas and ...
... with ... exalted mind look after me, me Ṣṣanīra, and ...
... the *Four Great Kings and Śrī the Great Goddess, and the gods who give rain and ...
... of the ... or stupas or shrines. Whatever are the forts or border posts ... of the land ...
... the haṃdastas or the [deities?] of winds or trees, mountains, rivers ...

comments.comment: MKhot. Ṣṣanīra’s prayer to the tutelary deities of Khotan(?); triśaraṇa; see Emmerick, Śgs, p. xvi §2.

translation.line: ... this dhāraṇī verse. If or how the lord buddhas (O Lord buddha) ...
they enter into ..., O Mañjuśrī, all ...
dhāraṇī verse. He spoke thus: Throughout the reckoning ...
[like] space immeasurable. This city of the gandharvas ...
the entrance to all dharmas, O Mañjuśrī, ...
not touches, not through the entrance to the mind ...

comments.comment: Archaizing MKhot. (Apparently not the same ms. as H. 142 NS 62.)

sta ba lysa ba lysä tta hva te se cu ā na nda ṣa ttā nu pra cī ya saṃ bu ddhā nu kṣa mau ttā tä u ///

yā va mā ña ndä ne spai ye tta ṣā vā ba lysū ña vū ysei kṣā ndi pā rā ma ta || pā tcu ā na nda ///

ta a na su ne ka śte yā va mā ña ndä mā ña ndu ne spai ye || pā tcu ā na nda ṣä vā hveʾ u ttä vā pra

transcription.prose:
ānanda • mästä ṣätä kīrä u duṣkaru ttū pracīyasaṃbuddha haṃtsa vaṭhāyyau satvyau yanändä u (n)e (gya)-
sta balysa balysä tta hvate se cu ānanda ṣa ttānu pracīyasaṃbuddhānu kṣamauttātä u ///
ye mīndä o yi jsa ysīru pätāyätä o ye vā vätä amatau nätāʾyätä ttye kṣa ///
yāva māñandä ne spaiye tta ṣāvā balysūñavūysei kṣāndi-pārāmata || pātcu ānanda ///
saṃbuddhānu vaṭhāyā kho paḍā hvatu kamalu vätä därysda śau kalpu vaṣṭa o tvare śau kalpu (tta) (cu)
tä saittä ānanda mästä ttye hvąʾndye ṣa ttäna pracaina kar(ī)ttātä tta hvate ānanda se tta gyasta ///
ttye balysūñavūysei karīttātä ce balśa śau spätau uysdīśätä balysūśte kūśāneina aysmū(na)
ta anasu ne kaśte yāva māñandä māñandu ne spaiye || pātcu ānanda ṣä vā hveʾ u ttä vā pra(cīyasaṃbuddha)

translation.line: ... O Ānanda. Great is this work and difficult this the pratyekasaṃbuddhas do together with servants (upasthayaka) beings who ... and ... the lord
buddhas. The Lord Buddha spoke thus: O Ānanda, this which is the patience and ... of the pratyeka¬saṃbuddhas ..
... or one speaks harshly to him or one places a *disaster on him. By him ...
like until ... he is not satisfied. Thus, O disciple, is the ksānti-pāramitā of the bodhi-seeker. Next, O Ānanda ...
the servants of the pratyekasaṃbuddhas—as said before—were he to hold (it) on the head for one eon or more than one eon ... [How does it]
seem to you, O Ānanda. Is the energy of that man for that sake great? Thus spoke Ānanda: “So (it is), of Lord [Buddha ...
the energy of that bodhi-seeker who proclaims one flower in the stupa with a mind seeking bodhi. ...
... like until he does not fall into a non-share he is not satisfied. Next, O Ānanda, that man or those *pratyekasaṃbuddhas ...

recto.line: dā tu vä tä hī su ya nā te • nai nä jsā tä nai vā ///
ṇu vä sta rna hvā ñī yi nei haṃ da ruo kṣī ra ñvo ·o ///
rva sa tvyau u ysno ryau pu ña haṃ brī hā te tte rī ///
ttye ce paṃ jsa a naṃ tta na rya kä ḍä gā ne yaṃ de • tta tta ttye ///

vu hvā ñä te ce ttu a pra mā nu ya nā te u ṣä ///
ysu haṃ ggu ṣṭo dai yi u mu hu va rai ṣṣa dda ggau
te • ṣī ka rmä kä ḍyā nä ttaṃ ggä tta rä hä mä te || pā tcu mą

dātu vätä hīsu yanāte • nai nä jsātä nai vā ///

vu hvāñäte ce ttu apramānu yanāte u ṣä ///

translation.line: ...[who] may be greedy for the Law, but neither does he go nor ...
may expound it to them clearly, neither for him in other lands ...
may share (his) merits with all living beings, so much for him ...
for him who performs sins causing him to fall into the Five Endless Hells. Thus his ...
Next, Mañjuśrī the young man spoke thus: What is that Jayakhyā- ...
... proclaims a word ... who makes that a non-standard, and he ...
sees a ... finger and toward me/us he *should [show?] faith and *respect ...
... This act (and) sin becomes more constricting for him. Next, Mañjuśrī ...

comments.comment: karma-text. Apparently not the same ms. as H. 142 NS 60.

translation.line: ... would *exercise doubt about the going forth, how much is his heavy sin? 76
... much ... It occurred to him in his mind: I shall take up the going forth! (77)
... should be ...-ed by a man, his going will be to an evil state (apāya). He shall bear much suffering there. (78)
... or the son might *believe. He goes thither to an evil state (apāya). (7)9
... who exercises doubt about it, he will become very miserable. 80
... or who falls into *disaster, beats (him) sorely, strongly. 81
... He next becomes a dog. One always throws him out. 82
... practices monkhood. When another asks him, only that one among them perishes. (8)3
... or one exercises doubt even because of ... 84
... is born ... he becomes deaf (and) very hunchbacked.

translation.line: The Lord Buddha spoke this dhāraṇī out of compassion for the beings. Whatever woman carries it on her(self), either her [children?] will learn(?) ... or they die in the womb.

translation.line: “Welfare! I do homage to all the Buddhas ...”

translation.line: ... [whoever] recites [that] *name, him fire does not .... A blow does not wound him. ...
.. can not do ... magic [can not do] him harm. ...
... does not see ... Neither among gods nor men ...
... And thither, moreover, Ānanda, he who is to be killed ...
... is to be ...-ed, he excapes from (his) anger. He who *is (or: Those who are) angry ...
... is to be restrained ... by being looked at ...
... he who holds [firmly?] the dāraṇī of endurance, recites (it) ...

translation.line: ... don’t you show disrespect for the monk Gautama and do not [produce] anger! ...
... he causes great woes for ... A second time and a third time they said to him: ...
... so much one hand(ful of) dust he threw and said to him: O monk, ...
... head-dress, covering, head covering. As that brahmin ... for himself ...
... became ... and tremble. His hair pores were ... The reverend ... [said] to him ...
... and don’t you, O Rāhula, disturb (your) mind and do not be angry with that brahmin! ...
... The reverend Rāhula spoke thus: I have neither enmity nor anger, O gracious one! I practice the Law at all times. ...
... equal cause. Thus you, O dear one, spoke anger to the men. You speak harshly, ... revilements ...
... words. Then the reverend Śāriputra bathed the reverend Rāhula’s head ...
... O reverend] Ānanda. When they had gone begging, they returned all the way to Jetavana. When ... begging ...
... they ...-ed that cause to the Buddha. The Buddha spoke thus to Rāhula: Don’t you, O Rāhula, ...
... do not disturb (your) mind and do not be angry with (them). The reverend Rāhula [spoke thus] to the Lord Buddha ...

comments.comment: The same ms. as IOL Khot 28/18, Kha. i.206b (below); see also IOL Khot 147/2. With IOL Khot 28/15 (a4-6, b1-3), attached to left with tape, and IOL Khot 28/16, upper left corner (a1-2, b6). Bailey does not mention that the ms. is in three pieces. Combined text:
The same ms. as IOL Khot 28/6?
The same ms. as IOL Khot 28/23.
The same ms. as IOL Khot 28/21.

translation.line: ... in all] *births may I only not be born far from the buddhas. ...
... are ..., all those merits [I share with (?) ...

translation.line: ... that I know the dharmas *and the right exposition of the good dharmas(?). 9. How (are) those dharmas? Like ...
I do not remember any others. 10. You have realized everything correctly, and like the other great ... in samādhis ...
adorned with lakṣaṇas. Your form (is) always just as ... and they see the pupils by the form. (1)2. In that ...
... many mūlakleśas. They see the pupils in a different form. (1)3. A yakṣa ...
... by the form, the many irate, foolish beings and full of desire, you shall deliver them. (1)4. For like a *mother ...
he shows ... or those fruits which he grasps in space. (1)5. Or .... just like a dear ... son by that ...
... *little sons. (1)6. Like that, by knowledge and compassion you shall deliver the three kinds of beings here in this [world].
(1)7. Just like a mother makes (her) *only-begotten son fear: If only you do not fall into a well or fire! You *will weep ...
to the *merciless strength-robbers [= bhūtas]. You will turn them about with an expedient so that they do not go to an evil state (apāya) ...
gods, harsh through folly with no peace (of mind) take *them into (your) mind (when) afraid. 20. You ...

recto.line: || cū bū ra krrä ṣṭā re ttī ʾau ṣā vą̄ nva yą̄ ną ttu śā ttā ṣaʾ mā rī dą u ma ra va jrra yau ną nva ttu śai na ṣṭe va rgau stą ṣṭe : tta ttai hvą̄ ñą̄ ma ṣṭą sa a śte kai ṇą ga nai ttrai • a śte vī rā ṣṭi ga nai ttrai

kā la nā ṣṭä ga nai ttrai a śte prra cai ną ga nai ttrai a śte kai ṇą ga nai ttrai ką̄ ma nai sa mā dą̄ na de va ttą nā sā ve tta kye hī ye hrra da ya u sā rą byā vą ya ną̄ me kai ṇa ga nai ttrai : a śtai vī rā ṣṭä ga nai

ttrai śrī va jrra sa ttä vī rā ṣṭä ga nai ttrai : kā le nā ṣṭa ga nai ttrai • sa maṃ tta bha dryai rrä hā śai dai va tta hī ye rri hā śai vai ysä vī rā ṣṭa a na mau dą̄ ma a śtai prra ce nä ga nai ttrai kā ya vā ga
pa ysā ną̄ mai pa jsa me vā me bai ysāṃ ysyą̄ ñą̄ me prra cai na ā vai rā mai

ce tta rri hā śe sai dhä sī jā ṣṭi pra cai na ga nai ttrai : vi ña tta ga nai ttrai kā mī nai pī sai ā śīʾ rī ū ysdī śai || u kā myai tta tträ jsai vā thī ye || u kā mye yą̄ nä hā lai || u a śtai pra cai nai vā ū

verso.line: ysdī śai || u ʾau ska na ʾau ma cī a rthä jsā vai : || cū ū ysdī śā kä pī sai ā śīʾ rī kā ye ṣiʾ ci ga kṣīʾ ra tta ttī śą nä ysā ye ba śrī ma jsu ną̄ ma ye : cu sai dä gī hā ka dai va tta ṣaiʾ brą̄ mä ysa ttī ną̄ʾ ma ya • hī dv
jsa ra vye pa ñū huṃ jsa dä sa mya sa ysą̄ ye la bha sa lā spā ñä u tta ttī śa nä mū dä u kha ma sa

kṣīʾ ra dą̄ sī ye || ū ra hā śe haṃ da rį̄ mai nä tca rī mai dā ha rbi śä ṇaiʾ hva stai || u va ra se dä byau dai drrāṃ cū vrrī śä maṃ va ṭhā ye mą̄ ñaṃ dä kī ra rą̄ pa dai de • u haṃ drrau ysya tsū ma u śaṃ dya ve cū lyą̄
tcā rä nā ga pā la u da sā dī śā pā la

ma u ma hā sa mą̄ drra ka vä mą̄ ñaṃ dä tsī ya • ttä kyāṃ bū rai beʾ jsyau jsa haṃ phve vai vā sai dha prrā ptai pī se ā śiʾ rī u ysdī śe ką̄ mye ttaṃ tträ jsai vā thī ye a va tta rä ttaṃ tträ vā thī ye : a śte
cu pī se biṃ dä a tta ra vā ysa mā hā kā śä gą̄ hya ca krra jsā vā u

pra cai nai vā u ysdī śai hai ysdā jsyāṃ u ä sta māṃ jsyā yau gä nāṃ śrī va jrra sa ttä jsa ha maṃ gä ha phī śā ma vä kṣäʾ māṃ sī jā ṣṭyi ū dä śā yi u maṃ drrä u mą̄ drra si mā dā na de va ttä a hau mau rrjä prra ce na • tta tta khvai hā mū ra kyi
ṇai yī yī vi ga vī nā yą̄ nä jsā tcą̄ rä rau dä vai nva sa hä ja ba kä nau kū la a ka dä ttä pa rą̄ ya vī stą̄ ve myāṃ de ñī ye na sū jsī ye jsī na biṃ di bye da rā śiʾ bvai yau sta tta ra da rä

transcription.prose:
|| cū būra krrä ṣṭāre ttī ʾau ṣāvą̄ nva yą̄ną ttuśāttā ṣaʾmārīdą u mara vajrrayauną nva ttuśai na ṣṭe vargaustą ṣṭe : tta ttai hvą̄ñą̄ma ṣṭą sa aśte kaiṇą ganaittrai • aśte vīrāṣṭi ganaittrai
kālanāṣṭä ganaittrai aśte prracainą ganaittrai aśte kaiṇą ganaittrai ką̄manai samādą̄na devattą nāsāve ttakye hīye hrradaya u sārą byāvą yaną̄me kaiṇa ganaittrai : aśtai vīrāṣṭä ganai-
ttrai śrī-vajrrasattä vīrāṣṭä ganaittrai : kālenāṣṭa ganaittrai • samaṃttabhadryai rrähāśai daivatta hīye rrihāśai vaiysä vīrāṣṭa anamaudą̄ma aśtai prracenä ganaittrai kāya-vāga-
paysāną̄mai pajsamevāme baiysāṃ ysyą̄ñą̄me prracaina āvairāmai
cetta rrihāśe saidhä sījāṣṭi pracaina ganaittrai : viña tta ganaittrai kāmīnai pīsai āśīʾrī ūysdīśai || u kāmyai ttatträ jsai vā thīye || u kāmye yą̄nä hālai || u aśtai pracainai vā ū-
ysdīśai || u ʾauskana ʾauma cī arthä jsāvai : || cū ūysdīśākä pīsai āśīʾrī kāye ṣiʾ ciga kṣīʾra tta ttīśąnä ysāye baśrīmajsu ną̄ma ye : cu saidä gīhāka daivatta ṣaiʾ brą̄mäysattī ną̄ʾma ya • hīdv
jsa ravye pa ñūhuṃjsadä samyasa ysą̄ye labhasalāspāñä u ttattīśanä mūdä u khamasa
kṣīʾra dą̄ sīye || ū rahāśe haṃdarį̄mai nätcarīmai dā harbiśä ṇaiʾhvastai || u vara sedä byaudai drrāṃ cū vrrīśämaṃ vaṭhāye mą̄ñaṃdä kīrarą̄ padaide • u haṃdrrauysya tsūma u śaṃdya vecūlyą̄-
tcārä nāgapāla u dasā dīśā pāla
ma u mahāsamą̄drra kavä mą̄ñaṃdä tsīya • ttäkyāṃ būrai beʾjsyau jsa haṃphve vaivā saidhaprrāptai pīse āśiʾrī uysdīśe ką̄mye ttaṃtträ jsai vā thīye avattarä ttaṃtträ vā thīye : aśte
cu pīse biṃdä attaravāysa māhākāśä gą̄hya cakrra jsā vā u
pracainai vā uysdīśai haiysdājsyāṃ u ästamāṃjsyā yaugänāṃ śrī-vajrrasattä jsa hamaṃgä haphīśāma väkṣäʾmāṃ sījāṣṭyi ūdäśāyi u maṃdrrä u mą̄drra simādāna devattä ahaumaurrjä prracena • tta tta khvai hā mūrakyi
ṇaiyī-y-ī vi gavīnā yą̄nä jsā tcą̄rä raudä vai nva sahä jabakä nau kūla akadättä parą̄ya vīstą̄ve myāṃ de ñīye na sūjsīye jsīna biṃdi byeda rāśiʾ bvaiyausta ttaradarä

translation.line: However many kriyās there are, those(?) the śrāvakas, according to yāna, count (as) emptiness. And here, according to the Vajrayāna, it is not empty; it contains vargas. And just thus there is the teaching that: On account of what is the ganetra? Toward what is the ganetra?

In what direction is ganetra? For the sake of what is the ganetra? On account of what is the ganetra? — Whatever samādāna deity he takes (obtains?), on account the recollection of the heart and essence of that one (is) the ganetra. Toward what is the ganetra? —

Toward Śrī Vajrasattva is the ganetra. In what direction is ganetra? — *Rejoicing toward ...-ing for the sake of recognition and worshiping the lotus of the mystery of the deity in the mystery of Samantabhadra (and for) producing buddhas. For the sake of what is the ganetra? —

For the sake of the succeeding of the siddhi of the mystery of kāya-vāk-citta is the ganetra. Now, which (is) thus the reverend teacher (who) expounded the ganetra? And from what tantra did he draw it? And toward which yāna? And for the sake of what did he expound it to us?

And when(?) will he go to the meaning of the *dwelling on high? As for the body of the reverend teacher who expounds it, he was born in the southern region, western samyasa(?) in China. He dwelt in Labhasalāspāñä and Ttattīśanä, and he was born in Ttattīśanä in Khamasa. His name was Baśrīmajsu. As for the deity who helped (his) siddhi, (her) name was Brmäysattī. In India

he learnt the Law. And he overcame the internal and external mysteries, the entire Law. And there he obtained siddhi so great that he *raised (upasthāpaya?) the four nāga-pālas and ten guardians of the directions and constructed workers similar to them(?). And (he achieved) walking in the air and moving in(?) the earth

, and he would go in the great ocean like a fish. Equipped with all those good qualities, having obtained the siddi of (his) vipāka, the reverend teacher expounded (the ganetra). — Because upon the teacher (was) the antaravāsa-mahākāśa-guhya-cakra. (?)

And from what tantra did he draw it? — He drew it (from?) the *abhyanantara-tantra. And for the sake of what did he expound it? — To present and future yogins, like Śrī Vajrasattva, with a view to the succeeding of the väkṣäʾmas of ...-ing and for the sake of not forgetting the mantra and the deity of the mudrā-samād(h)āna(?), for instance(?), if he were to place *mudrakās on her(?) the yāna ... the four kings ... Saha Jabaka nine koṭis he placed in the command of Akadatta, he might sit in the fire (and) it would not burn (him). He obtained control over (his) life. The bodies full of rays

comments.comment: Fols. 1-4. Bailey, 1965. On the ganetra (from BSkt. *gaṇetrī?) “rosary.” Fol. 4r in Ser., pl. CLII. Fol. 2r on PLATE 7d.

recto.line: byā vä tsī dä u ma drre hā byā va jsā ve || khvai hā maṃ drrä byā vi jsā vai || u mą̄ drrai hā byā vi jsā | khvai hā mą̄ dra byā vi jsā | u sa mą̄ dhą̄ nä de vi ttai hā byā vä jsā vai || si mā dhą̄ na dai va ttä byā vi yi ną̄ me jsai jsāṃ • ką̄ ye vā ga ce ttä

hī vī se dä bye he u sa tsā ra jsa gu śti : u a vā yą̄ ga sa tva ttrvā ye drra bā ḍvi kā mye yą̄ na hā le nā ṣṭā re /// va jrra yą̄ nä hā le ṣṭā re ʾau ska na ʾau mą cī a rtha jsā vai dä sau pa dya ʾau mä mū ra kyāṃ gu tte rä nī jsā ñą̄ me hī vī
ra hā śe pī rmā tta sā hya ttā hī rą̄ ñä pī cha ṣṭū yi dį tcą̄ pa dya kī rvą̄ sī jā ṣṭä bye he •

a rtha jsā ve /// ṣaiʾ kä yau gi nä • cu mū ra kye bī ḍä u mū ra kyā hī vī a rtha ni bvā vi u sa mai vai pā ni śtä ttyai ʾau ma ja sta baʾ ysa daṃ da ha mą̄ rai khu jsī na pa śai hī śa nvā ʾaiʾ jsvā ba ñā mai byai hai u śąʾ mä kāṃ bya
pa jsa pa dya u sa mį a bi ṣye kä • a ną̄ va jrra yā nyāṃ ga jsa ya de I u ra hā śai gū stya na sa dā hī vī jā pā a rthū pa jsa me vā ma na bvā ve ma ṇḍa le pā ttrą̄ mā ṣṭä na ʾī ye

ña pī ttä u vi rä ʾau na ra vā gu scyi ni byai he cu ttyā mū ra kyāṃ ṣiʾ me rā me hī ya saṃ ñä ṣṭe ṣiʾ pa ḍau śiʾ kyi pī cha ṣṭū si mą̄ dhą̄ na de va ttä jā yą̄ ma ṣṭe : u dyā ma dā vī ne tta ra da ra jsa ha phī śą̄ ma u ha rbi są tvāṃ vī ra ha maṃ
va jrra yi kṣį u a gų̄ na ttā la krrą̄ dä u va jrra śrī he rū kä krrau dä rā jä ysī rä jä hū ñä khā śīʾ dä ysai ra ja rä svī dī va tsa tha jī dä hau da gu gū ttai ra jī ye

verso.line: ga mi sta mūai śdäʾ ū pai vā ña • u sya dai da stä hī vī ā ṣṭi sa maṃ tta bha drrä u ha gau ṣṭa sa maṃ tta bha drra u jñą̄ na u dha rma dā ttä : tta tta si cu ha rbi śā ja stāṃ baʾ ysa na rau mau ma ṣṭā ve u ysyā ma • bi śä au vā jñā nä u dha rma dhā

ttä haṃ dryi vya ʾau na ni rą̄ mī dä u ysyā rai : drra ha ṣka lyā ysi ma śa dya bī sā ha rbi śāṃ sa tvā hī ye pā ką̄ me kle śiʾ vā ysi na jñā nä u da rma dhą̄ ttä ha drryi vya ʾau na va sve ha mā rai : u ha gā ḍai • ttyai pra cai na syaṃ

dai ā ṣṭī u haṃ gau ṣṭi ha drryi vya gi nai ttrai dī jsą̄ ña u hva raṃ de dą stä hī ye ā ṣṭī u dvī ha gau ṣṭi kā yi vā ga cai ttä hī ya prra ra a ye kṣą̄ ñä u ā ṣṭī vai rau cä • u pa ḍau ysa haṃ gau ṣṭi

a rmyā yi u śaʾ ha gau ṣṭi va jrra sa ttä u dī da ha gau ṣṭa ra hna sa bha vä u ka ṇai ska a mą̄ ga sai da u tta ʾau vā paṃ jsa ja sta baʾ ysi jñā na u dha rma dhą̄ ttä ha drryi vya ʾau na na rau mī dä a vā yā ga sa tta ha gā

transcription.prose:
byāvä tsīdä u madrre hā byāva jsāve || khvai hā maṃdrrä byāvi jsāvai || u mą̄drrai hā byāvi jsā | khvai hā mą̄dra byāvi jsā | u samą̄dhą̄nä devittai hā byāvä jsāvai || simādhą̄na daivattä byāvi yiną̄me jsai jsāṃ • ką̄ye-vāga-cettä
hīvī sedä byehe u satsāra jsa guśti : u avāyą̄ga satva ttrvāye drra-bāḍvi kāmye yą̄na hālenā ṣṭāre /// vajrrayą̄nä hāle ṣṭāre ʾauskana ʾaumą cī artha jsāvai däsau-padya ʾaumä mūrakyāṃ gutterä nījsāñą̄me hīvī
rahāśe pīrmātta sāhyattā hīrą̄ñä pīchaṣṭū yidį tcą̄-padya kīrvą̄ sījāṣṭä byehe •
artha jsāve /// ṣaiʾkä yauginä • cu mūrakye bīḍä u mūrakyā hīvī artha ni bvāvi u samai vai pā niśtä ttyai ʾauma jasta baʾysa daṃda hamą̄rai khu jsīna paśai hīśanvā ʾaiʾjsvā bañāmai byaihai u śąʾmä kāṃ bya-
pajsa-padya u samį abiṣyekä • aną̄ vajrrayānyāṃ gajsa yade I u rahāśai gūstya nasa dā hīvī jāpā arthū pajsamevāma na bvāve maṇḍale pā ttrą̄māṣṭä na ʾīye
ña pīttä u virä ʾauna ra vā guscyi ni byaihe cu ttyā mūrakyāṃ ṣiʾmerāme hīya saṃñä ṣṭe ṣiʾ paḍauśiʾkyi pīchaṣṭū simą̄dhą̄na devattä jāyą̄ma ṣṭe : u dyāma dāvīne ttaradara jsa haphīśą̄ma u harbi(śāṃ) sątvāṃ vīra hamaṃ-
vajrra yikṣį u agų̄na ttāla krrą̄dä u vajrra śrī herūkä krraudä-rājä ysīräjä hūñä khāśīʾdä ysaira jarä svī dī vatsa thajīdä hauda gu gūttaira jīye
ga mista mūaiśdäʾ ūpaivāña • u syadai dastä hīvī āṣṭi samaṃttabhadrrä u hagauṣṭa samaṃttabhadrra u jñą̄na u dharmadāttä : tta tta si cu harbiśā jastāṃ baʾysa naraumauma ṣṭāve u ysyāma • biśä au vā jñānä u dharmadhā-
ttä haṃdryivya ʾauna nirą̄mīdä u ysyārai : drra-haṣkalyā ysimaśadya bīsā harbiśāṃ satvā hīye pā ką̄me kleśiʾ vāysina jñānä u darma-dhą̄ttä hadrryivya ʾauna vasve hamārai : u hagāḍai • ttyai pracaina syaṃ-
dai āṣṭī u haṃgauṣṭi hadrryivya ginaittrai dījsą̄ña u hvaraṃde dąstä hīye āṣṭī u dvī hagauṣṭi kāyi-vāga-caittä hīya prrara ayekṣą̄ñä u āṣṭī vairaucä • u paḍauysa haṃgauṣṭi
armyāyi u śaʾ hagauṣṭi vajrra-sattä u dīda hagauṣṭa rahna-sabhavä u kaṇaiska amą̄gasaida u tta ʾau vā paṃjsa jasta baʾysi jñāna u dharmadhą̄ttä hadrryivya ʾauna naraumīdä avāyāga satta hagā-

translation.line: are remembered. And the *mantra is remembered by him. When the *mantra is remembered by him, then the mudrā is remembered by him. When the mudrā is remembered by him, then the samād(h)āna deity is remembered by him. Then, by remembering the samād(h)āna deity

he obtains the siddhi of the mystery of kāya-vāk-citta. He brings into full view the state of foremost happiness. He obtains success in the four-fold acts, and he is delivered from saṃsāra. And he delivers the beings *in apāyas of(?) the three times, on the side of whatever yāna they stand, they stand on the side of the Vajrayāna. And when(?) will he go to the meaning of the *dwelling on high? — He will go to the meaning of the showing of the gotra of the mudrās of the *dwelling on high. That yogin who carries the five-fold mudrās, and the *samaya-abhiṣeka without vajrayānikas, performs a sin, and he will not know the meaning of the mudrās, and henceforth there will be no samaya for him. And he will not know the meaning and worship of the jāpas of the ... mystery (and) release ...(?), and thenceforth there would be no entering the maṇḍala for him. In that dwelling there will be so many lord buddhas. When he relinquishes life he will obtain binding in iron fetters and into whichever(?) obstruction of Yama’s

he falls, then he will not obtain release back here. Vajrayakṣa, Aguṇatālakrodha, and Vajraśrīherūka Krodharāja will drink the blood of (his) heart, they will pull out (his) heart, liver, lungs under the *breast. The seven-fold gotra will be lost (for him). As for the notion of counting those mudrās, the first one is the meditation on the samādhāna deity in full view, and the seeing, the *union with the dharma-kāya, and

the production of equal great compassion for all beings. And the thumb of the left hand (is) Samantabhadra, and the fingers (are) Samantabhadra and knowledge (jñāna) and the dharmadhātu. Just like that is that which will be the exit and birth of all the lord buddhas: all

will go out and be born between knowledge and the dharmadhātu. The vāsanas, kleśas, and (false) views of all beings residing in the triple-tiered world will all be purified between knowledge and the dharmadhātu and *drawn out(?). Therefore,

the ganetra should be held between the left thumb and a finger. And the thumb of the right hand and two fingers should be *established (adhiṣṭhā) as the underlying nature (prakṛti) of kāya-vāk-citta. And the thumb is Vairocana, and the first finger (is)

Amitāyu, and the second finger (is) Vajrasattva, and the third finger is Ratnasambhava, and the little finger is Amoghasiddha. And thus then five lord buddhas go out between knowledge and the dharmadhātu. They *draw out the beings ....

recto.line: rī dą baʾ ysu śti vī ra ʾau pā rī phī dä • cu mū ra ka bi da ṣṭe ṣiʾ mai sta mve śdäʾ ṣṭai u baʾ ysū śtā ṣṭa pa de cu jsā mū kyi ṣṭā rai tti jsā drra ha ṣka lya ysa ma śa dya bī sā sa tvā hī ya pra ra ṣṭe : u nau yau ñaṃ hī ya

pa ca ḍä ka jsa sa rbą̄ ma : cu mū ra kyā hī ye ną̄ ha ṣṭe ṣiʾ ysa thāṃ • hī vī ną̄ hä ṣṭe u gra thä ṣiʾ jsā dā vī nai tta raṃ dä rä ṣṭe • u śau pa ca ḍä jsā vä jrrā cā rī pī se ā śaʾ rī ṣṭai • cu mū ra kyāṃ

hī ya khu ṇā ṣṭe ṣiʾ ha ṣṭu sa pa dya ttu śā ttā ṣṭe ha ṣṭu sa pa dya jsā ttu śā ttā jñā nī nai tcai ṣṭe • cu ʾau mvai śdäʾ jsa sa tva dhā ttä ysi ma śa dai są̄ śai cu dą̄ vī nai tta ra dä ra u va jrrā cā rī tti a

vai ṣke sta ṣṭā re mū ra kyā ha gā rą̄ me be ḍa ñā ña bhī se gra tha ni pa rsā ña gaʾ sā ña khu ttī pa rsī ye dā vī nai tta ra da rä u va jrrā cā rī vai au byā śāʾ ma ha mai : u sa mai ga tcyą̄ ma u pa rau ga tci ñā mä mi stä

verso.line: ga tca sta sa mai ṣṭai • pa ḍau śiʾ kyi mū ra kyā hī vī gu ttai rä tta tta nī jsā ṣṭa si ṣā vā ra nī nai ga nai ttrai • u ā stī nai u va rga stā ba hyā hī yāṃ gī chau kāṃ jsa na ha bū sa tta tta cva va ma drra mau drra sa mai
prra ttī ka bą̄ dā a ra ha dā bą̄ da sa tvāṃ pa jsa pa dya pā ga nai ttrai na ha bu sa nä

nai śti • u ttī jsā va jrra yā na ṣā vā yā na jsa tcau pa dya pa ryai lī kä ṣṭe dyā me jsa u ca ryai jsa u sī jā ṣṭyā jsa u sa mai jsa dyā mai jsa khu pa ryai sa tta bha drrye dyā mai jsa pa ryai ci rya pra ña
prra ttī ka bų dä yau nä jsą
ū pā ya jsa pa ryai sī jyā ṣṭyi kā ya vā ga ci tta hī vī ma ṇḍa la jsa pa ryai tcu mū ra kyā hī vī da sau pa dya gu tta ra nī jsā ṣṭa ṣṭai • ṣāʾ pā gu ttai ra jsa ha phī śą̄ ñä

cu tta thā ga tta kū la ṣṭe ṣiʾ myau ṣṭe : va ra ga nai ttrai pā tta ra jī vī nai ttyai hvā ñau ma jsa jā pa ni ha bu sa ni ṣāʾ ma te ha gą̄ rą̄ ñä ja bvī dvī pa rri vye pa ʾi ḍā rai hī dva kṣī rä sa ma ttai
va jrra kū la pa dma kū la ka rma kū la va rä ga nai ttrai nva nva kū lā ha phī śą̄ ñä

transcription.prose:
rīdą baʾysuśti vīra ʾau pārīphīdä • cu mūraka bida ṣṭe ṣiʾ maista mveśdäʾ ṣṭai u baʾysūśtāṣṭa pade cu jsā mū(ra)kyi ṣṭārai tti jsā drrahaṣkalya ysamaśadya bīsā satvā hīya prara ṣṭe : u nau yauñaṃ hīya
pacaḍäka jsa sarbą̄ma : cu mūrakyā hīye ną̄ha ṣṭe ṣiʾ ysathāṃ • hīvī ną̄hä ṣṭe u grathä ṣiʾ jsā dāvīnai ttaraṃdärä ṣṭe • u śau pacaḍä jsā väjrrācārī pīse āśaʾrī ṣṭai • cu mūrakyāṃ
hīya khuṇā ṣṭe ṣiʾ haṣṭusa-padya ttuśāttā ṣṭe haṣṭusa-padya jsā ttuśāttā jñānīnai tcai ṣṭe • cu ʾau mvaiśdäʾ jsa satvadhāttä ysimaśadai są̄śai cu dą̄vīnai ttaradära u vajrrācārī tti a-
vaiṣkesta ṣṭāre mūrakyā hagārą̄me beḍa ñāña bhīse gratha ni parsāña gaʾsāña khu ttī parsīye dāvīnai ttaradarä u vajrrācārī-v-ai au byāśāʾma hamai : u samai gatcyą̄ma u parau gatciñāmä mistä
gatcasta samai ṣṭai • paḍauśiʾkyi mūrakyā hīvī guttairä tta tta nījsāṣṭa si ṣāvā ranīnai ganaittrai • u āstīnai u vargastā bahyā hīyāṃ gīchaukāṃ jsa na habūsa tta tta cva va madrra maudrra samai
prrattīkabą̄dā arahadā bą̄dasatvāṃ pajsa-padya pā ganaittrai na habusanä
naiśti • u ttī jsā vajrrayāna ṣāvāyāna jsa tcau-padya paryai līkä ṣṭe dyāme jsa u caryai jsa u sījāṣṭyā jsa u samai jsa dyāmai jsa khu paryai sa(ma)ttabhadrrye dyāmai jsa paryai cirya praña
prrattīkabųdäyaunä jsą
ūpāya jsa paryai sījyāṣṭyi kāya-vāga-citta hīvī maṇḍala jsa paryai tcu mūrakyā hīvī dasau-padya guttara nījsāṣṭa ṣṭai • ṣāʾ pā guttaira jsa haphīśą̄ñä
cu ttathāgattakūla ṣṭe ṣiʾ myau ṣṭe : vara ganaittrai pāttarajīvīnai ttyai hvāñauma jsa jāpa ni habusa niṣāʾmate hagą̄rą̄ñä jabvīdvīpa rrivye pa ʾiḍārai hīdva kṣīrä samattai
vajrrakūla padmakūla karmakūla varä ganaittrai nva nva kūlā haphīśą̄ñä

translation.line: They establish them in bodhi. As for what is on(?) the mudrā, that is great compassion and the path to bodhi. As for the mudrās there are, that is the underlying nature (prakṛti) of the residing in the triple-tiered world.

And the rising up from the ... of the nine yonis. As for the tip of the mudrā, that is the tip of births. And the knot, that is the Body of the Law. And one ... is the reverend teacher of the vajrācārya. As for the

... of the mudrās, that is the 18-fold emptiness, it is the eye of knowledge. As for the teaching of the world of the sattva-dhātu through compassion, as for the Bodhi of the Law and the vajrācārya, those are undistinguished.

At the time of *drawing out the mudrās, one should sit down(?), the knots of ... should be released, one should turn (them?). If one were to release them (then), there would be for him crossing of the Body of the Law and the vajrācārya and *breaking of the samaya, and great(?) causing to break of the command.

Broken is the samaya(?). The first gotra of the mudrās is shown as follows: henceforth the five-fold ganetra is not suited for the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, arhats, bodhisattvas. The jewel ganetra and the one of bone and the one from the *kernels of the vargasta trees are not suitable. Thus (it is in the case of) those who do not have mantra, mudrā, (or) samaya.

Next, the Vajrayāna has *surpassed the Śrāvaka-yāna and the Pratyekabuddha-yāna in four ways: in view, career, success, and samaya. How has it *surpassed it in view? — It has *surpassed it in the view of Samantabhadra. The career has *surpassed it in prajñā (and)
upāya. The success has *surpassed it in the maṇḍala of kāya-vāk-citta, because it has shown the ten-fold gotra of the mudrās. This(?) must henceforth be joined with the gotra.

As for the tathāgata-kula (and) the vajra-kula, karma-kula: there the ganetra should be joined according to each kula. That is the middle. There the ganetra is from putrajīva (nuts). jāpa is not suitable together with its pronouncement. ... must be *drawn out. In the southern region of Jambudvīpa in yonder land of India

transcription.prose:
ną̄mä kṣīra ṣṭe u viriñaupūra śau bhahye ysā u ttyai bhahyi śīña hīyāraña ssa haṣṭa pātta(ra)jīvā naraumīdä u śākyamūna jasta baʾysa hīvī mą̄rą̄-pyärau ṣiʾka ṣṭe • u
ṣiʾ bihyą u ūdūbąra spyai u kyesara sarą̄ śākhyamūna jasta baiysa haña baiḍa hamya : u ttyai pracaini ṣiʾ pāttarajīvīnai ganaittrai harbīśā jastā baiysā hīye pīrmāttä
ganaittrai ṣṭe u vajrrakūlą ʾīrä rahnakūla raṃnä u padamakūla vaiysä karmakūla lodrrākṣāʾ u pajsa-padya jsāṃ rrihāśai ginaittrai ṣṭe || |||| || || ttyāṃ hīvī
jāpā artha hvīde cuḍi ssa hva u ssa 20 1 stä u ssa haṣṭä ṣaʾ kāya-vāga-caitta hīya prrara bvą̄ñä
(¤)

translation.line: there is a land called Samattai, and in Viriñaupura one tree was born and in one fruit from that tree 108 putrajīva nuts come out. And that is that of the parents of the Lord Buddha Śākyamuni. And
that tree and the Udumbara flower and the kesarin lion were at the same time as the Lord Buddha Śākyamuni. And therefore the ganetra made of putrjīva is the foremost ganetra of all the lord buddhas.

And the vajra-kula (is) jade, the ratna-kula jewel, the padmakula lotus, and the karma-kula rudrākṣa. And that is the five-fold mystery ganetra. The meaning of those jāpas is expounded. Why was it said “a hundred” and “a hundred and 21” and “a hundred and eight”? — That is to be known as the underlying nature of kāya-vāk-citta.

translation.line: This much the Lord Buddha spoke. They were (all) content: the reverend Subhūti *and the remaining monks, nuns, laymen, laywomen, and the world-encompassing assembly of gods,
goddesses, asuras, gandharvas, etc. The Lord Buddha,
however, concluded the Vajracchedikā-prajñāpāramitā in three hundred verses.
Welfare! The diṣṭāntas of the Vajrachedikā
are spoken to you, (those) of former times, in one land, one lakh(?).

comments.comment: Em.: only -t-; restore [kye puñīṃgya b]āta niśtä. “who have no merit root,” Tib. dge-bahi r£a-ba ma bskyed-pahi sems-can-dag-gis “who have not planted merit roots.”

Em.: [ṣadah]īndä; the akṣara ma is quite typical, differing from ṣa; Tib. dad-pas mos-pa yin-gyi (= śraddhādhimukta), cf. Sgh §92.3 Tib. dman-pa-la mos-pahi sems-can gaṅ-gis, Khot. ce/kye vamasāmata *vārūḍya (Canevascini, Sgh., p. 41), Skt. ye hīnādhimuktikāḥ satvāḥ. Tib. mos-pa = Skt. adhimukta also, e.g., in Suv.

translation.line: ... are to be informed. All the saṃskāras should be ...
.... that: well healthy, well you gave ...
.... that: He calls (...) good ... of/to beings ...
... who there are unexperienced or sick ...
... beings of ... in this life ... things ...
... there is no soul there, only the name ...
... he *shows how ... can not be seen nor grasped, nor ...
... one recognizes the paramārtha. And he himself ...
... and like in a dream, for one awakened from the dream ...

translation.line: ... Then] the four lord buddhas and also those four [bodhisattvas]
were staying in the dwelling of divine sons [the moon] and the sun. Then [the moon and
and the sun, the great divine] sons, wherever direction those lord buddhas were, also those
[four lord buddhas] went [in that direction]. When they had gone there, when they [had] seen
[those lord buddhas (seeing)] that: They were sitting on the great ratnavyūha lion seat
[and (about) those four] bodhisattvas that: they are sitting in pavillions of jāmbūnada gold. Then
they worshipped the lord buddhas in every way
[and] sat down in thought (thinking): Night and day, the movement of (this) our world circle ...

comments.comment: Cf. Neb., p. 157.39-158. Lines r5-v4 overlap with SI P 3r1-v3. Line v6 has no parallel in SI P 3-4. Somewhat deteriorated since Bailey read it: v4-6 no longer legible.
Suv C 6.2.62-70; with Kha. i.100 or 180 (IOL Khot 21/1).

haṣṭa jūna maṃdrri hvañä • u tta ṣīve hvañai (•) śīya-vrrahauṇä

translation.line: This upacāra should be tied onto this mantra.
A circle of cow dung should be made for the bodhisattva Āryāvalokiteśvara.
Four juices mixed with milk should be placed there at fifteen harmus(?),
and flower wreaths with four perfumes, with eight perfumes, and with four perfumes, (and) perfumed flowers.
For three nights and days ... should not be taken,
but three times a day one should wash, and standing thus this mantra should be recited for the gods.
And next, for another seven days eight times daily the mantra should be recited, and thus (too) at night. [One should wear] white garments ...

dhāraṇī [does not?] come, they do not escape from miseries. For those beings ...
nor with those buddhas and the bodhisattvas. ...

translation.line: ... by this kuśalamūla whoever ... of the three [jewels] ...
I shall go ... I shall meet with the standing lord buddhas, whatever ...
I shall fulfill the pāramitās, I shall share (my) merits with all beings ...
I shall make ... here birth shall be relinquished ...
shall be extinguished for me. I shall purify the eyes of the Law for me. ... [When]
this life is finished my arising (utpāda) [will be] in the buddha fields ...

comments.comment: Ratnadvīpa text 15-31 (1-16), see H. 147 MBD 24a (IOL Khot 165/1a).

recto.line: · )sta jsī rrja ṣiʾ ī a ḍa jsāṃ svī • bi śeṃ ā
• a nā spe pa ṣṭi śū ka haṃ da ña ysī tha 10 cī ni saṃ tse ra ni ya
• ṣi ·ṣṭāṃ saṃ spai yi hiʾ ysdä vī ra a ha ṣṭä • cu rru stai jva kṣī rä brī brau da ma pū
hī ya ysū ṣka tta vā brā ta rä pā tcä 10 1 ci ttye ni kṣa mī de du kha
pyau ca • ya nī ryau dā na pu ñau ā sā pā tcä • khvau ni hi mi paʾ jsä u staṃ vī
ā • ttyau va ska hī śtä ṣiʾ ma ra ysaṃ są̄ nä 10 2 va ña ri saṃ u staṃ vī ha rbi
· kṣa me vūṃ da sau di śiʾ ha rbi śä baʾ ysä • ttri yā ṇī ttra dhve dā tī nai
bi saṃ gī ja raṃ ną dvī pä na maṃ ga 10 3 cu bu ri yu ḍai ī me ttū ci ttä
• tta raṃ da rä ttī jsāṃ a ysmū na bi śāʾ na • ysu rri ja ḍī brī ye nva vi ṣa yāṃ pā
pī mi de śa na va ña pā ysä vī śą̄ na 10 5 cvaṃ tciʾ sta ī de saṃ a ni jsa
· ka rma pa ha da sau cvaṃ bvą̄ ñai ī me • hau ḍa de śa na ka rmą̄ nä bi śą̄
· ·ūṃ rū vi khu ni ni pī mä a vā yä 10 5 raṃ na dvī pä mą̄ ñaṃ dä buʾ jsau dä u vā rä ka lyą̄ ṇa mi tträ u stā ka
gä • ttye vī ra śą̄ nā ya ni kṣa mau ca ha ṣṭä • hau ḍa rä de śa na ka rmą̄ nä bi śą̄ nä 10 6
gā ra kā ra • maṃ vī ra brau ra ā śiʾ rya thu ka rī ha • hai ra tna bha dra kṣa me mu hu jsa ysi ra stä vye jä ttī dī yai ysi ra śą̄ nai thaṃ jä
·yā ·vṛ kṣa va sva ra ma ña brū na • ā spā ta mi sta bi śāṃ du khāṃ ji nā ka • ā śiʾ rya cā ta ka hai
ttī ra jsā brā ta rä bha dre śva ra si dä 7 mi ttra bha drä bha dre śva ra śu dä jsā pā tca ya ā staṃ bi śä maṃ jsa kṣa mya rä •
nā maṃ vī kṣa «†tra» ṇa mā tträ • mai nä śa rä ysąʾ ña «†bi» «†śī» muʾ śdi prra cai brau tī ra jsāṃ brā ta rä bha dre śva ra śu dä 8 cī ttā
bāʾ yau sta u vā rä • ā śiʾ rya eṃ dra ya śa kṣa ma ma jsa ttā ṣṭa • prra bhā ka ra bha drä
ai • u da ya bha drä na haṃ tsa • su prra bha drä skā ra kä sthī rä ā staṃ nau «†śą̄» «†na» «†ysi» bi śä maṃ jsa kṣa mya rä
ā śiʾ rya brā ta ri ysa ni cu bu ri hi mā ta • kṣa mā ta mu hu jsa au dä mi ttrai baʾ ysä •
nā cu ra vī ysai au ysä • ni śi rkä ye thaṃ ja rī ysi ra śā bi śä 20 hai da ha
snä dų̄ na a gaṃ jsa • maṃ vī ra brau ra thu bra ysa rrnā ni ka khu ysā ą̄ mā ca kṣa me
ysi ryā yä brī ya au dä mi ttrai baʾ ysä 1
• pū ra kaṃ kāʾ ya su hä be ḍau • khu maṃ ni hi mā ri paʾ jsa ku ysva ni ysī ya • mu ttā pa ri bhū ta u paʾ jsä śaṃ dya hva sta ñą̄ ysi rä vā ḍa pū ra du
• thu da ttā kṣa ma ma jsa nā ne rä jsa haṃ tsa • pū ra kyau dva ryau saṃ cu bu ri hi mā ta
«†ma» «†na» «†tsų̄» «†ni» «†ma» «†ni» «†dai» «†na» «†brau» 2 nāeau ni dyai u staṃ vī dyą̄ ma brų̄ na 2 vi ysa ysā ra ve ra va
·) d· ma brų̄ na pā rā ka pū ra ka bi śä hi rrna a ña ṣṭa • ha ryā sa ka kṣa ma ma jsa ttā
ne rä pū ryau jsa cvau jä a ma nā ī 3 hai va sva nū va ra na ṣkha sta u vā ra • kāṃ ja ñe ysī
ra ma ña cha ka • ttāṃ jī ka pū ra du khāṃ pyau caṃ gā ra • kṣa ma ttā ṣṭa cve saṃ ī a ma

· kha rū kā kṣa ma ttā va ña pya rä na ysi ra stä • nā ni dyai pā ba ttū ṣṭā msūṃ jsūṃ stau
mā ta rga brau pū ryau cvau ya nva śta • pya rī ja pyaṃ tsā ṣṭä du khāṃ ji nā ka • tvau vaṃ ña stau
ṇ· ną̄ mai są̄ nä rā hä da ga ra kṣa ysä tti rä tsau dä a vī pa 6 śi rka ma maṃ

śä u skha jsa tsā ta • di śiʾ vī ra ā rā hā ta sā mu ha baʾ ysa 7 ysi ra mi

transcription.prose:
(mi)sta jsīrrja ṣiʾ ī aḍa jsāṃ svī • biśe-ṃ ā
• anāspe pa ṣṭi śūka haṃdaña ysītha 10 cī ni saṃtsera ni ya
• ṣi(ʾ) ṣṭāṃ saṃ spaiyi hiʾysdä vīra ahaṣṭä • cu rrustai jva-kṣīrä brī braudama pū-
(rä) (•) hīya ysūṣka tta vā brātarä pātcä 10 1 ci ttye ni kṣamīde dukha
pyauca • yanīryau dāna puñau āsā pātcä • khvau ni himi paʾjsä ustaṃ vī
-ā • ttyau vaska hīśtä ṣiʾ mara ysaṃ(thä) są̄nä 10 2 vaña ri saṃ ustaṃ vī harbi-
(śa) kṣamevūṃ dasau diśiʾ harbiśä baʾysä • ttriyāṇī ttradhve dātīnai
bisaṃgīja raṃnądvīpäna (ha)maṃga 10 3 cu buri yuḍai īme ttū cittä
• ttaraṃdarä ttī jsāṃ aysmūna biśāʾna • ysurri jaḍī brīye nva viṣayāṃ pā-
(tcä) (•) pīmi deśana vaña pāysä vī śą̄na 10 5 cvaṃ tciʾsta īde saṃ anijsa-
(ṣṭa)
karma-paha dasau cvaṃ bvą̄ñai īme • hauḍa(rä) deśana karmą̄nä biśą̄-
(nä) ·ūṃ rūvi khu ni ni pīmä avāyä 10 5 raṃnadvīpä mą̄ñaṃdä buʾjsaudä uvārä kalyą̄ṇamitträ ustāka-
(ji) (biʾsaṃ)gä • ttye vīra śą̄nā yani kṣamauca haṣṭä • hauḍa rä deśana karmą̄nä biśą̄nä 10 6
gāra kāra • maṃ vīra braura āśiʾrya thu karīha • hai ratnabhadra kṣame muhu jsa ysirastä vyejä ttī dī yai ysira śą̄nai thaṃjä
(tt)yā(ṃ) vṛkṣa vasva ramaña brūna • āspāta mista biśāṃ dukhāṃ jināka • āśiʾrya cātaka hai
(brau)ttīra jsā brātarä bhadreśvarasidä 7 mittrabhadrä bhadreśvaraśudä jsā pātca ya āstaṃ biśä maṃ jsa kṣamyarä •
nā maṃ vī kṣaṇamātträ • mai nä śarä ysąʾña muʾśdi prracai brautīra jsāṃ brātarä bhadreśvaraśudä 8 cī ttā
bāʾyausta uvārä • āśiʾrya eṃdrayaśa kṣama ma jsa ttāṣṭa • prrabhākarabhadrä
-ai • udayabhadräna haṃtsa • suprrabhadrä skārakä sthīrä āstaṃnau biśä maṃ jsa kṣamyarä (9)
āśiʾrya brātari ysani cu buri himāta • kṣamāta muhu jsa audä mittrai baʾysä •
nā cu ra vīysai auysä • ni śirkä ye thaṃjarī ysira śā biśä 20 hai daha
snädų̄na agaṃjsa • maṃ vīra braura thu bra ysarrnā nika khu ysā ą̄māca kṣame
ysiryāyä brīya audä mittrai baʾysä 1
• pūraka-ṃ kāʾya suhä beḍau • khu maṃ ni himāri paʾjsa kuysva ni ysīya • mu ttā paribhūta u paʾjsä śaṃdya hvasta ñą̄ysirä vāḍa pūra du-
(ta) • thu dattā kṣama ma jsa nā nerä jsa haṃtsa • pūrakyau dvaryau saṃ cu buri himāta
2 nāeauni dyai ustaṃ vī dyą̄ma brų̄na 2 viysa ysāra-vera va-
(ña)
d(yą̄)ma brų̄na pārāka pūraka biśä hirrna añaṣṭa • haryāsaka kṣama ma jsa ttā-
(ṣṭa) (•) nerä pūryau jsa cvau jä amanā ī 3 hai vasva nūvara naṣkhasta uvāra • kāṃjañe ysī
(rra) (jsa) ramaña chaka • ttāṃ jīka pūra dukhāṃ pyaucaṃgāra • kṣama ttāṣṭa cv-e saṃ ī ama
(nā) 4 • raṃna-bāʾyausta vasva daga-prrasāda • dūtakā ñą̄ysirä tsūmaṃ-
(ca) kharūkā kṣama ttā vaña pyaräna ysirastä • nā ni dyai pāba ttū ṣṭām sūṃjsūṃ stau
(rä)(5) mātarga brau pūryau cvau ya nvaśta • pyarīja pyaṃtsāṣṭä dukhāṃ jināka • tvau vaṃña stau
ṇ· ną̄mai są̄nä rāhä daga-rakṣaysä ttirä tsaudä avīpa 6 śirka ma maṃ
maraña burai śka • tta tta khu parśaʾ mąña paysā hīvī pye • ttye pą̄ñä naṣkāra
(bi)śä uskhajsa tsāta • diśiʾ vīra ārāhāta sāmuha baʾysa 7 ysira mi-
(sta)
stya tsų̄maṃcā brī • kharakā kṣama ma ttā ustaṃ vīra • naṃ sa u nī jsā pādū
• suhaṃbara āstaṃ saṃ biśä kṣamyarä 8 ttą ttą yai nvaśta khu caṃdātąñä mū-
(ra) ·i dijsą̄me va tta khu ñąnai mistä • salā-mātträ cve ttā hvai īme haʾcä •
saṃ

translation.line: ... *great deceit. That one is today, the other one is tomorrow. All of them ...
... – without refuge ... is alone in another (re)birth. 10. When not in saṃsāra ...
– That one provides just instant satisfaction, ... – When you have lost in the land of the living a dear, very dear son, –
then his brothers (are) your pleasant ones. 11. The woes that do not please him
[and] the *counteragents, – make according to the Law the memorized teaching of merits then! If you have no strong ... in the end, –
the enemy birth comes for them here. 12. And now only at the end ... all
... – I propitiate all the buddhas in the ten directions, – the ... of the three vehicles, of the three times, of the Law
... – of the bhikṣu-saṅgha, *equal to the ratnadvīpa. 13. However much I have done, this mind
... – of the body, as well as with mind (and) tongue, – and (through) anger, folly, (or) lust according to the domains (of the senses), next,
– I fall into (?) the Confession now, lying prostrate. 15. [sic] Whatever ... I have ... only ...
– the ten karma-pathas that I have ruined for me, – the ... confession of all deeds

– so that I may not fall into an evil existence. 15. Like Ratnadvīpa full of praises, exalted kalyāṇamitra, the bhikṣu-saṅgha of Ustāka, – to those lying in it I make eight ..., – and given confession for all acts. 16.
... – for me you, O Reverend Braura, the energetic one. O Ratnabhadra, accept me pitiful ... pull out the .. lying in the heart.
*Their trees, pure, delightful, splendid. – O great refuge, destroyer of all woes, – Reverend Cātaka. O
brothers in Brauttīra, Bhadreśvarasiddha. 17. Next, Mittrabhadra, Bhadreśvaraśuddha, and the others. Accept me all! –
... for me even as much as a moment – *nor in their good heart for the sake of compassion, my brothers in Brauttīra, Bhadraśvaraśuddha. 18. When ...
full of rays, exalted, – O Reverend Aindrayaśa, accept me (and let me come) to you! Prrabhākarabhadra
... – together with Udayabhadra, Suprrabhadra, Elder Skāraka, and the others, accept me all! [19.]
Reverend brothers, kinsmen, as many as you are, – forgive me (and let me come) to the buddha Maitreya! –
... whatever anger ... – was not good, pull it out of the heart, one (and?) all. 20. O men
... devoid of *evil, free of sins, – to me you, O dear Braura, O golden ... Minister Khu Ysā, accept ...
Sons, look at me at the time of bliss and – if I have not much ... nor ... – ... and beaten much *against the ground. ... sons (and) daughters, –
you Dattā deign to accept (?) me together with my wife. – O sons (and) daughters, as many as you are –
... I have seen in the end a dear vision. 22. In a lotus with a thousand leaves ...
... dear nourishers, sons, not to be despised in every respect, – O Haryāsaka, let me come to you,
– with wife and sons whatever is unpleasant for *us/you. 23. O pure, new, ..., exalted one, of golden gold (?)
, delightful, (and) *having beautiful skin. – ... sons, *counteragents of woes, – let them come to you, even if it is unpleasant to you(?).
24. Full of the rays of jewels, pure Dagaprrasādā, – daughters ... coming

... let them come to you now with their father ... – you saw them accepted, daddy, this I ... [25.] *Mātarga, O dear sons, whatever was difficult for you, – in the future destroyers of the woes of *your father. – this now ... of yours
... its name enemy, illness, “rākṣasa of *fever” so many digested *unprepared. 26. It is nice for me here
until death, – just like ... my own birth father. – His ...
... wealthy, – you shall propitiate the buddhas in full view in (all) directions. 27. In my heart ... going dear, – Kharakai, let me come to you at the end. – ...
... – Suhaṃbara and the others only accept me. 28. *You were difficult for me like the cintāmaṇi jewel

comments.comment: Late(?) MKhot. Ratnadvīpa text 1-14, followed by H. 147 MBD 23a (IOL Khot 164/1a) and H. 147 MBD 25a (IOL Khot 166/1a). Punctuation (here: – ) seems to delimit metrical units.
