recto.line: a kū śa lā kī rāṃ jsa a sa di jsa sa tsā ra saṃ
h· ha mā ña • bi śāʾ na a si di na hva ñai • a s· d· na
·y· ba riṃ ji hi ra vī śe ra hi mā re • ha rbi śau ū pa jī vyau jsa sa tta sū hya hi mā re gya ḍa prrī u na·
kvā ba ri haṃ dā ḍi yī dä • pha rā ka pa ca ḍa hva ḍāṃ ā chā hi mā re • khū ra saṃ hvaṃ ḍä ni pa dya hi
śä a ve ysā rä haṃ tsa hų̄ ñe jsa • hi nai a ve ysā rä • gva rā hä • bā ta saṃ dvā • ką̄ʾ ma lä • ka ma la rā hä • tti bu ri ā
tca mna hvaṃ ḍä mi rā re • ci ttye sū tträ na sa mā dāṃ di jsā ti • ṣiʾ ttyau ā chyau jsa pa rśtä • hvaṃ ḍa hva hva ā da rä yi nä :
jū pī rą̄ mi jsa śā bi sa hvaṃ ḍä ā chai jsa na riṃ da • na ni mi rā re cvai dva jų̄ na pī ri ysą ni bi svā ra ve pī rä ///
cvai drai jų̄ na pī ri ṣa da hu ṣa bā yī di śau ka rą̄ nūṃ jsa hvaṃ ḍä drrų̄ nā hi mā re khū ttū sū tträ hvi pyū ṣṭi ///
te a pa hā ysī ye tī ṣṭa kū lai ya nā ti | ṣiʾ hvi mū lą bā śtä mī ḍi • ṣiʾ sū tträ pī rą̄ ñä va kṣā vī bi sāṃ jsāṃ ///
hvi he mā ti • ci ttū sū tträ vi jsyā ti ū ṣa da gau ra va hā ya nā t· ṣaʾ be śau ā chyau jsa pa rśtä ci ka nau sta sa tra kṣi ttra ///
ri • ū taṃ hā ṣa da hi mi ci ttū sū tträ byi hī ū hī sī vi ya nā ti haṃ da ryāṃ hā lai tī ni bi rā śīʾ ti ///
mī ḍi • ṣiʾ sū tträ pāʾ sä sa lya siṃ jsī ji mā śti 20 8 mye ha ḍai ā ta śka gya sta ṣai mi stä ttu nā rī ñä ba jā ṣä ///
ttye vā ba jā ṣä haṃ drra vya śau mi stä saṃ gä pa stä ṣiʾ saṃ gä gva ṣṭä dva pi ṣka la tsvi • tti ña va da rya c
ttu pū stye śau drre sa lä ṣī kä e sthī ya • pā tcä tti ña bi ḍä śau ysā ḍä na ḍe paṃ dā kä • mi styau śa ysdyau
cvī hvī ka ma lä yi • krriṃ gī ñai ttyi śa ysdä pā ya • byū rä chā ttyi śa ysdä stu ḍe bā śde tta raṃ da rä ṃji ///
kä ysā ḍä na ḍau gu ṣṭe ū tai hvi sä tha ṣą nä ną̄ ma di śeʾ vī byū rä mi ste mi jṣī ū byū rä gū ha pa ///
hi mā ri • hi ra vī dū ṣkä rä khvaṃ ja tti • na mau a rmyā yäḡ ya stä baʾ ysä ną̄ mi hvą̄ ñą̄ mi jsa ā sā ya na di
mā ta • ttyau be śyau pī lyau jsa pa rsya rä a kā la ma ra ṇyau • khū hvaṃ ḍāṃ ha mi na sai yi haṃ dya ji mā śti ū ra nā ·i
śī ryau daṃ di stū ri mi rā ri khū ra dra yvā bi svā śau stū rä ni hi mi mā śte drrai ra bi sta mye ha ḍai daṃ di mi jṣī mi rā ri
hvaṃ ḍāṃ śā nā rä dū ṣka ra hi mi • ā śiʾ rya ū vā ysā hva hva gā ṭhą̄ nvā bi svā tsū ta rä • ttu taṃ hā sū tträ ū ///
pū ñą pa rī ya yu ḍi • khū ṣiʾ hi rä ha ṭha ṣṭā ti ā yau la ñū hā jsaṃ dyi di śiʾ na vā brraṃ thä hī śtä • ū
pa di śäʾ na hiṃ nai ya kṣä hī «†r»śtä tte ña bi ḍa ci na ha rī ysā taṃ da ttyi hi rä prra cai na ci ttu ni rmą̄ ṇä pa ḍā ///
myi ttyi hi rä prra cai na kū ra drri ṣṭä pa śa rä śi ryi ṣa di jsa a rmyā yaḡ ya stä baʾ ysä ną̄ ma hų̄ ña rä
la yi nī ryau kṣa mau va mi ttrā śa ya mū ña rä ū na pai ya nva śtau prra cyau jsa haṃ phva hi mī ryau cū ṣiʾ hvi
tträ vī ṣa da gau ra va ya nī • ū pa rī yi tī pī ḍa haṃ da ryāṃ hā lai tī ū ysdī śī • tta vai na ṣṭau sai ā staṃ na
rśtä • bu ysyi jsī ñi a rthyau bhau gyau hu ṣa jsā ti śi ryi ca ryi hā lai • a si di ca ryi pa thaṃ hā lai a kā la ma ṇa
chą̄ mi kiṃ ṇa ṣiʾ sū tträ mi styau bau dhi sa tvau muʾ śde jsa ā śaʾ bi sai ni rmą̄ ṇa na ū ysdī śä ne hi myi paṃ ñe ///
ṣṭi ṣa kṣā vi nā są̄ ñi ttī tī nū yą̄ ñä drra yāṃ raṃ nāṃ tī ā rū va tsū ñai ū ysā ñi jsa ha sti rāṃ pū
dā mū ttyi rāṃ pa jsaṃ tci rai • mā rā pya rä pa jsa mi vą̄ ña • pī sā ka lyą̄ na mi ttra • nva bvā jsi pa ///
rä jų̄ na a rmyā yäḡ ya stä baʾ ysä ną̄ ma hva ñā • a mri tta prra bha dā rą ñä ū sa pta bu ddha ///
ū mi ysdyū nāṃ a nā spi tāṃ sa ttāṃ ā spā ta tci rā pa jsa mi vą̄ ña • a pa rā nta au ṣṇī ṣa ///
a mri tta prra bhe ve pū la ga rbhi prra va ra bau dhi sa mi si dhya si dhya ma hā si dhya ma hā ga rbhi ttu ru ttu ru svā hā ///
vi pū la ttā ri hūṃ || na mau bha ga va ttā ra | au mä | a mi tta hi ti au ṣṇī ṣā ya sa rva ttrā pa rā ji ttā ya
mä śa ma yi śa ma ya śāṃ tti dā tta dha rma bhā ṣa tte ma hā vi dya sa rvā rtha sā dha ni svā hā || ā ryą̄ ///
sa tva pa jsaṃ tci ri • ā ryā va lau ka tti śva ra bau dhi sa tvä • bi svā vī ra pā sū rāṃ pī rą̄ ñä pī li vya chī ryau
|| si dha mi ttī vā va śa va rte mā rä bha va ñaḡ ya stä biʾ ysä tta hvi si a ysä pā tcä sa tvuą̄ nä maṃ drra hau rū ·e ///
pa ya ha ysga mi bi da tte hī sī dä ū ka ā te hi mā«†i»ṃ di khvaṃ jsa gva ṣṭä byi hī dä || na mau ///
ya • tta thu ga ttu ya na mau mā ra ka sya • na mau jā la ka sya tta dya thu • ka sä ka sä • jva ri jva ri jva ra ///
kā ra da tta nī ye ttu ru ttu ru svā hā || mu ru mu ru svā hā au ha ve mau ha ni au hā ra ne sa tva rau ·rr· · ///
cū ṣiʾ hi mā ti strrī ya cū tvuā ra kṣa bi da ba rī na ṣiʾ tvā rā dä ā ra ḍä au vā mi stāṃ hvą̄ ṣṭāṃ jsī yi ///
lą̄ ña ā ji mī dä sa mī ṣāʾ ra kṣa ū skyā ṣṭä haṃ «†tca» grrī hą̄ ña • a ysä va ra hī sūṃ ra pa ḍāṃ ///
ttū hvaṃ ḍä ī śī dä ttyi hvaṃ di ā taṃ haṃ bi rūṃ a nā rī pa dī mi ba lau dī ū stā nä a rū nai hu ///
si dha vaṃ dī pa dī mi • paṃ ñe brrī kai ā mā cyau ṣa ma ttyau braṃ ma nyau jsa pva ṇi hi mā ti • au vā dau lyau baṃ ///
gvā ra gvi ryau ba hau ysyau jsa khū ṣṭā paṃ di jsā ti sa mī ṣā ra kṣa ū skā ṣṭa haṃ grrī hā ña ha rbi śāṃ ///
va su śtä śe rkī jsa pyā yī dä pū ri pū ñaṃ da be śvāṃ gvā rä vī pū rau ysi hi mi cū bū ri ā śaʾ ṣṭą̄ na au da a y·ä ///
va ka la bū tta na «†a» ī di ti bi śä maṃ pa rau ya ṣṭā ri sa tva ni śte cvī dī rä tcā rą ṇä ā ya ṣai khvi ·ū ///
da ī dä nā ṣṭą̄ nai vā hā bi śa pu ṣa hau rī dä ū ci ka sai na ṣṭau sai bu ysą ā chā tī ni ni hi mā ri ///
mā ti khū hvai prra tti ñe ā ya neḡ ya sta baʾ ysä ku ṣṭa ttyāṃ sa tvāṃ du kha hi mā dä a ysa va ra ne hī vī ///
ṣka la ttā rä tcaṃ phā ti u ba ysū śte vyā re ṇi ni byi hī mī si dha mi na mau mā ttaṃ gā rā jā ya ///
ga tta dā ra kā nāṃ tta dya thā pa ttra vi da na pha ṭva śī ka ra ṇī yaṃ pha ṭsa rva rau ga prra śa ma nī yaṃ svā hā

transcription.prose:
akūśalā kīrāṃ jsa asadi jsa satsāra saṃ
h· hamāña • biśāʾna asidina hvañai • a s· d· na
·y· bariṃji hira vī śera himāre • harbiśau ūpajīvyau jsa satta sūhya himāre gyaḍa prrī u na(rya)
(bisa)kvā bari haṃdāḍi yīdä • pharāka pacaḍa hvaḍāṃ āchā himāre • khū ra saṃ hvaṃḍä ni padya hi(māre) (ha)-
śä aveysārä haṃtsa hų̄ñe jsa • hinai aveysārä • gva rāhä • bāta saṃdvā • ką̄ʾmalä • kamala-rāhä • tti buri ā(chā)
tcamna hvaṃḍä mirāre • ci ttye sūtträna samādāṃ dijsāti • ṣiʾ ttyau āchyau jsa parśtä • hvaṃḍa hva hva ādarä yinä : (cvai) (śau)
jū pīrą̄mi jsa śā bisa hvaṃḍä āchai jsa nariṃda • na ni mirāre cvai dva jų̄na pīri ysąni bisvāra ve pīrä ///
cvai drai jų̄na pīri ṣada huṣa bāyīdi śau karą̄nūṃ jsa hvaṃḍä drrų̄nā himāre khū ttū sūtträ hvi pyūṣṭi ///
te apahāysīye-t-ī ṣṭakūlai yanāti | ṣiʾ hvi mūlą bāśtä mīḍi • ṣiʾ sūtträ pīrą̄ñä vakṣāvī bisāṃ jsāṃ ///
hvi hemāti • ci ttū sūtträ vijsyāti ū ṣada gaurava hā yanāt(i) ṣaʾ beśau āchyau jsa parśtä ci kanausta satra kṣittra ///
ri • ū ta-ṃ hā ṣada himi ci ttū sūtträ byihī ū hīsī vi yanāti haṃdaryāṃ hālai-t-ī ni birāśīʾ ti ///
mīḍi • ṣiʾ sūtträ pāʾsä salya siṃjsīji māśti 20 8 mye haḍai āta śka gyastaṣai mistä ttu nārīñä bajāṣä ///
ttye vā bajāṣä haṃdrravya śau mistä saṃgä pastä ṣiʾ saṃgä gvaṣṭä dva piṣkala tsvi • ttiña va darya c-
ttu pūstye śau drre-salä ṣīkä esthīya • pātcä ttiña biḍä śau ysāḍä naḍe paṃdākä • mistyau śaysdyau
cvī hvī kamalä yi • krriṃgīñai ttyi śaysdä pā ya • byūrä chā ttyi śaysdä stuḍe bāśde ttaraṃdarä -ṃji ///
kä ysāḍä naḍau guṣṭe ū tai hvi sä thaṣąnä ną̄ma diśeʾ vī byūrä miste mijṣī ū byūrä gūha pa ///
himāri • hira vī dūṣkärä khvaṃ jatti • namau armyāyä ḡyastä baʾysä ną̄mi hvą̄ñą̄mi jsa āsā yanadi (hi)-
māta • ttyau beśyau pīlyau jsa parsyarä akāla-maraṇyau • khū hvaṃḍāṃ hamina saiyi haṃdyaji māśti ū ranā ·i (ka)
śīryau daṃdi stūri mirāri khū ra drayvā bisvā śau stūrä ni himi māśte drrairabistamye haḍai daṃdi mijṣī mirāri (khū)
hvaṃḍāṃ śā nārä dūṣkara himi • āśiʾrya ūvāysā hva hva gāṭhą̄nvā bisvā tsūtarä • ttu-t-aṃ hā sūtträ ū ///
pūñą parīya yuḍi • khū ṣiʾ hirä haṭha ṣṭāti ā yaula ñūhājsaṃdyi diśiʾna vā brraṃthä hīśtä • ū (ravy-)
pa diśäʾna hiṃnai yakṣä hīśtä tteña biḍa ci na harīysā taṃda ttyi hirä prracaina ci ttu nirmą̄ṇä paḍā ///
myi ttyi hirä prracaina kūra-drriṣṭä paśarä śiryi ṣadi jsa armyāya ḡyastä baʾysä ną̄ma hų̄ñarä (kuśa)-
la yinīryau kṣamauva mittrāśaya mūñarä ū na paiya nvaśtau prracyau jsa haṃphva himīryau cū ṣiʾ hvi (sū)-
tträ vī ṣada gaurava yanī • ū parīyi-t-ī pīḍa haṃdaryāṃ hālai-t-ī ūysdīśī • ttavai naṣṭausai āstaṃna (pa)-
rśtä • buysyi jsīñi arthyau bhaugyau huṣa jsāti śiryi caryi hālai • asidi caryi pathaṃ(kyi) hālai akāla-ma(ra)ṇa (vya)-
chą̄mi kiṃṇa ṣiʾ sūtträ mistyau baudhisatvau muʾśde jsa āśaʾ bisai nirmą̄ṇana ūysdīśä ne himyi paṃñe ///
ṣṭi ṣakṣāvi nāsą̄ñi ttī-t-ī nūyą̄ñä drrayāṃ raṃnāṃ-t-ī ārūva tsūñai ūysāñi jsa hastirāṃ pū(ñauṃ)
dām ū ttyi rāṃ pajsaṃ tcirai • mārā-pyarä pajsamivą̄ña • pīsā kalyą̄na-mittra • nva bvājsi pa ///
rä jų̄na armyāyä ḡyastä baʾysä ną̄ma hvañā • amritta-prrabha-dārąñä ū saptabuddha ///
ū miysdyūnāṃ anāspitāṃ sattāṃ āspāta tcirā pajsamivą̄ña • aparānta auṣṇīṣa ///
amrittaprrabhe vepūlagarbhi prravara baudhi sami sidhya sidhya mahāsidhya mahāgarbhi tturu tturu svāhā ///
vipūla ttāri hūṃ || namau bhagava ttāra | aumä | amittahiti auṣṇīṣāya sarvattrāparājittāya (au)-
mä śamayi śamaya śāṃtti dātta dharma bhāṣatte mahāvidya sarvārtha sādhani svāhā || āryą̄ ///
satva pajsaṃ tciri • āryāvalaukattiśvara baudhisatvä • bisvā vīra pāsūrāṃ pīrą̄ñä pīli vyachīryau
|| sidhami ttī vā vaśavarte mārä bhavaña ḡyastä biʾysä tta hvi si aysä pātcä satvuą̄nä maṃdrra haurū ·e ///
paya haysgami bida tte hīsīdä ū ka āte himāṃdi khvaṃ jsa gvaṣṭä byihīdä || namau ///
ya • ttathugattuya namau mārakasya • namau jālakasya ttad yathu • kasä kasä • jvari jvari jvara ///
kāra dattanīye tturu tturu svāhā || muru muru svāhā auha vemauhani auhārane satva rau(d)rr(āya) ///
cū ṣiʾ himāti strrīya cū tvuā rakṣa bida barī na ṣiʾ tvā rādä āraḍä auvā mistāṃ hvą̄ṣṭāṃ jsīyi ///
lą̄ña ājimīdä samī ṣāʾ rakṣa ūskyāṣṭä haṃgrrīhą̄ña • aysä vara hīsūṃ ra paḍāṃ ///
ttū hvaṃḍä īśīdä ttyi hvaṃdi ātaṃ haṃbirūṃ anārī padīmi balaudī ūstānä arūnai hu ///
sidhavaṃdī padīmi • paṃñe brrī kai āmācyau ṣamattyau braṃmanyau jsa pvaṇi himāti • auvā daulyau baṃ ///
gvāra-gviryau bahauysyau jsa khū ṣṭā paṃdi jsāti samī ṣā rakṣa ūskāṣṭa haṃgrrīhāña harbiśāṃ ///
vasuśtä śerkī jsa pyāyīdä pūri pūñaṃda beśvāṃ gvārä vī pūrauysi himi cū būri āśaʾ ṣṭą̄na auda ay(s)ä ///
va kalabūttana īdi ti biśä maṃ parauya ṣṭāri satva niśte cvī dīrä tcārąṇä āya ṣai khvi ·ū ///
da īdä nā ṣṭą̄nai vā hā biśa puṣa haurīdä ūci kasai naṣṭausai buysą āchā-t-ī ni ni himāri ///
māti khū hvai prrattiñe āya ne ḡyasta baʾysä kuṣṭa ttyāṃ satvāṃ dukha himādä aysa vara ne hīvī ///
ṣkala ttārä tcaṃphāti u baysūśte vyāreṇi ni byihīmī sidhami namau māttaṃgā-rājāya ///
gattadārakānāṃ ttad yathā pattra vidana phaṭ vaśīkaraṇīyaṃ phaṭ sarva-rauga-prraśamanīyaṃ svāhā (||)

translation.line: ... should be ... speech with evil tongue, ...
... that the harvests should be good for once(?), beings blessed with all means of living, the fools [be born] among ghosts and in hell ...
... that Bara be able to sustain them among ..., there will be many kinds of illnesses for men. If only there are no ... for a man ...
discharge from(?) *swelling together with blood, red discharge, illness in the ear, wind, a combination, jaundice, illness in the head, all these illnesses
whereby men die. Whoever keeps the samād(h)āna of this sutra, he is delivered from those illnesses. I look after the men, each and every one. [By]
writing it once the men of one house have gone out from illness, and they will not die. He who writes it twice, for kinsmen, relatives, father ...
He who writes it three times, they bring faith to growth, the men will be healthy from one ... of it. When a man has listened to this sutra ...
... and ... it, that man ... the roots (of goodness and) dies. This sutra should be written, the ... in its ... [that]
man becomes. He who inspects this sutra and shows faith in it and treats it with respect, he is delivered from all illnesses. He who ... kṣetra ...
and shows faith in them. He who obtains this sutra and is greedy about it and does not expound it to others ...
dies. This sutra ... in the Year of the Pig, the 28th day of the month of Siṃjsījsa. The great prince ... this sound of ...
But in the middle of that sound, one great stone fell down. That stone split up (and) went into two sections. There in that entire ...
pulled out of the book this one three-year-old child. Next, at that time, an old man travelling on a road ... by great snakes. ...
who had a human head. That snake (also) had chicken feet. That snake’s body had ... of 10,000 chās.
... called the old men and said to him: In the region called Thaṣana 10,000 great women and 10,000 great oxen ...
will become ... In old days it was difficult to request them. By pronouncing the name of the Lord Buddha Amitāyu you will become ...
You will escape from all those sufferings of untimely deaths which ... for men in summer in the month of Haṃdyaja. And ...
... so many pack animals will die that in three houses there will not be a single animal. On the 23rd day of the month so many women will die [that]
it will be hard for men to find a single wife. Monks and laymen, go singly to the houses of the householders, [bring] them this sutra and
order them to write [its] merits! If that matter is true or false, a storm will come from the western direction and from [the southern]
direction a red yakṣa will come. At that time, he who does not produce trembling on that account, who ... that nirmāṇa ...
For that reason let go of your false views! With good faith speak the name of the Lord Buddha Amitāyu!
Perform good acts, stay ... and never thereafter shall you become equipped with the causes for hardships. When that man ...
shows faith and respect to [this] sutra and orders it to be written and teaches it to others, he will escape from fever and hot spells, etc.,
He will increase with respect to the things and matters (needed) for long life for a good career, for the *avoidance of an evil career, for the sake of escape from untimely deaths.
(When) this sutra is expounded with the compassion of the great bodhisattvas with the nirmāṇa found in space, to every ...
is ... he should adopt the śikṣāpadas, then he should ..., go to the refuge of the three jewels, to those better than himself ...
and ...he should do homage, he should honor his parents, his teachers and kalyāṇamitras. According to ...
*so many times he should speak the name of the Lord Buddha Amitāyu. The Amṛtaprabha-dhāraṇī and the Seven Buddhas ...
a refuge should be made for ... and pitiful, refugeless beings and honored. dhāraṇī.
He should do homage to the bodhisattva Āryā-[...], the bodhisattva Āryāvalokiteśvara. It should be written by the ... in houses. Sufferings will be dispelled.
Welfare! And then in the dwelling of ... the Lord Buddha spoke thus: Next, I shall give beings a mantra ...
... troubles shall not come upon (them). And if they do come, that they obtain separation from them.
Whoever that woman may be who carries this protection upon herself, she will not become guilty of killing the king or the great teachers. [If]
they bring [her] elsewhere, she just has to lift that protection high, (and) I shall come there.
they turn this man back. I shall fulfill that man’s wishes. I shall make him free of guilt. I shall make his ... powerful, ...
successful. Dear to everyone, if ever he should fear ministers, monks, brahmins, ... in the villages ... with sticks, ...
from litigators, merhcants, even if he is walking on the road he just has to lift up this protection, he will be purified of all ...

They will talk nicely to him, meritorious sons. He will be victorious in litigation with ... All the ... kalabhūtanas there are all the way up to space, they are all under my command. There are no beings whom he might be able to (do) harm to, even if ... him ...
could seize him. Nor will they give away completely the water in his house ... he will have no hot spells or long illnesses ...
... will [not] be ... when the man is a pratijña, nor a lord buddha. Where there are woes for these beings, I shall not ... there ...
... and I shall not obtain the explanation of bodhi.

comments.comment: Late(?) MKhot. Amṛtaprabha-dhāraṇī 1-21, followed by H. 147 MBD 23b (IOL Khot 164/1b) and H. 147 MBD 25b (IOL Khot 166/1b).
Cf. KT no. 57 102 harbeśe asadye jsä pathakä.
Ratnadvīpa text 32-39 (1-7), see H. 147 MBD 24a (IOL Khot 165/1a). At end: “Bundle II.”

translation.line: does ... As long as until bodhi those merits are not destroyed. 9. For the reason that ... [whatever]
they ..., there is no dākṣiṇeya equal to the Buddha at all. 10. Whatever there may be ... [that]
they hold firmly, there is nothing that one might hold better than the Buddha at all. 11. Even he who ...
... -faced, mighty ... those merits the Buddha holds in safe-keeping for them. 12. Nor ...
.. those merits in all births. As long as until bodhi they make friendship with him. 13. He who ...
... should make great merits. Don’t even ask me about him who makes an image. *14. He who ...
of the Lord Buddha through all births, he becomes very blesssed. 15. ...
... and *famous for acts, in every way splendid, very lovely in complexion. 16.

translation.line: ... I seek ...-ness, and what I must do ...
... [my] mind has been placed very firmly toward bodhi. ...
... by his mind thinks of beings as friends and ...
... arises. With a smiling face formerly with dākṣiṇeyas ...
... that is the fourth ... he holds undifferenciated affection and
... and if not, what has not been and does not satisfy him listen ...
... he sees very heavy ..., and because the other buddha- ...
... all acts ... thing with the buddha mind ...
... You shall obtain birth in all good gatis! And all beings were for him ...
... energy (vīrya) was ... and whatever was dhyānā and samādhi, if not on that account ...
... had been mixed with cleverness and ... by [that] cleverness ...
... affection was and thus everything in his spirit unswervingly ...
... and all kinds of things ... and if ...
... hears the praise ... and if with evil-doers friends ...

translation.line: ... embracing the earth [before ...], I make a report.
... he spoke not nicely with me. 21 [days] me ...
... the complaint and anger of the -s I did not find *nice. Until now
... there I do not recognize many nice things. And pitiful ...
... men came for me. What I had today you knew it, and only my
throat hurt, (and) for an (entire) day I did not dare (go) before them, so that I might have brought (them) the mūrās. (But?) I was alive!
Don’t lay them upon yourself(?)! As I have always ... the men ... your outside success(?) so far
I was to be left (alone ?). For eight months hardship had to be endured which I have all held out(?). But as you did not go yourself
your five śiṃgas [...] *altogether had to be given into the hand of one man. ... but I was to be left
without protection. But I had plenty of spirit (?) ... I know something special(?): that you have looked at (= after) me so nicely.
Thus you have received (?) my 800 mūrās. 800 of them Puñaśūra’s *wife promised and 1000 Śūrabudā ...
... Give 1000 to my sister, wife of Īrapuña.
... sister ... not in doubt about that ...

... undistracted by ... [equipped] with the 32 [marks] of the superman.
... they shine they shine much better than golden ...
... very perfumed ... he makes the mind satisfied, his ...
... sprinkled with good powders, [covered] with various jewels

recto.line: śa mi tha ṣiʾ cų na ṣoʾ ma : va pa śa na ṣiʾ cų dyą̄ ma dą̄
śa ma tha va pa śa na vī ra vä • ṣā vāṃ hī ya u prra
ttī ka bo dhiā hī ya • u bo dhi sa tvāṃ hī ya : u •

ha drrī ya ṣṭā re • he tti ṣaʾ cų pa rą̄ māṃ • nī vą̄
ṣaʾ cų • pvā ma vī ja bva ma • u ci dā ma vī ja bvą̄ ma

transcription.prose:
śamitha ṣiʾ cų naṣoʾma : vapaśana ṣiʾ cų dyą̄ma dą̄
śamatha vapaśana vīra vä • ṣāvāṃ hīya u prra-
ttīka-bodhiā hīya • u bodhisatvāṃ hīya : u •
gyastā baʾysā hīya • anakhaiṣṭa • samāhona
hadrrīya ṣṭāre • hetti ṣaʾ cų parą̄māṃ • nīvą̄
ṣaʾ cų • pvāmavīja bvama • u cidāmavīja bvą̄ma

translation.line: śamatha, i.e, extinction; vipaśyana, i.e, seeing.
The śamatha of the Law (?) was in vipaśyana, that of the śrāvakas and
that of the pratyekabuddhas and that of the bodhisatvas and
that of the Lord Buddha. The innumerable samādhis
stand fastened firmly. hetu, i.e., ...; nīv,
i.e., knowledge through hearing and knowledge through thinking.

comments.comment: Actual: Ch.xlvi. 0012. B. LKhot. abhidharma-text. Recto on Ser., pl. CLII.

translation.line: ... and fragrant water. And there three white juices and three white ...
... should be placed [there?] and in one bowl that bala should be placed, which has been mentioned here before
... [and in that] *bowl each single bala is needed in 19 ways, the food (is needed) there in four
... things needed should be placed. Flowers and incense, those should be placed there, and those [...] thus [with?] a dhāraṇī.
... should be -ed. And this dhāraṇī should afterward be raised up onto that stupa. And that [should] thereafter
be placed [...]. And that dhāraṇī should thus be recited 28 times, in the directions (and) subdirections ...
... of the dhāraṇīs eight great bodhisatvas and eight yakṣas and Vajra[pāṇi, king of yakṣas ? ...

translation.line: ... the four great kings and Śakra, king of the gods, and the Lord Brahman, Nārāyaṇa
... all together own .?. raised those dhāraṇīs onto the stupa. 99 *koṭis
... lord buddhas like ... they raised there upon that place, and the adhiṣṭāna of the buddhas
... they raised the relics ... and placed them .?. and a stupa just like Cintāmaṇi jewels ...
... he will become ... they knew: thus he shall make that caitya or he erects a dharmarāja. For that 99 billions ...
... they *take ..., they shall be made in another mahācaitya. Thereby the merits and [roots] of goodness of the former Nadivanda ...
... he becomes long-lived and he obtains a pure, untainted body. All the
... he becomes .... And he becomes free from all the āvaraṇas. [At] the mere sight of that stupa
... And at the hearing of the sound of the bell in that caitya all beings residing in an evil existence (apāya) [will be
delivered and] they obtain ... He to whose ear the sound comes becomes irreversible (avaivartika) from bodhi and ...

translation.line: for the men, their amount was 500 and ...
... In Phema, by the Tibetan ... him ...
The pharṣa Sāṃdara promised 2000 mūrās. Those [he had] not [paid?].
[and] those he hands out to Ṣanīraka himself.
The mūrās belonging to *Virgāṃ, to Naṃdaka 1000.

rau śandā-ysaṃthu ne nāsāre • u haṣṭātä ysāre kalpa vaṣṭa (t)t(ä) uysn(o)ra /// pyūvāre balysānu hvanau biśvī

te gyastānu gyastu balysu tta brraṣṭe (•) tta cerä vā gyasta baly(s)a t(t)ye uysnorä käḍätānīnai haṃbīsä hämäte kye ttu-
tu saṃghāṭu sūtru (a)prramā(nu) (ya)nde gyastān(u) gyastä pharāka (sa)r(va)śūra ttä uysnora käḍätā-

vä tā ye ma te jsa āʾ re || u rra vye hā lai di śe jsa śśau baṃ hyä cä rä hä mä tä hau da ysā re ggaṃ pha mä ste
tä u pu spa re bä stä ysā re kū lai va ra ʾī ñä vä tä u ysno ra haṃ grī· pä tā yī ndä ne h·ā

translation.line: ... in the triple-thousand great-thousand world sphere
... [if] the triple-thousand great-thousand world sphere were full of present
[lord buddhas?] as thickly as when rice or ...(?) comes out and there were that one man
[who] ... to lord buddhas being 20 thousand hundreds (?) [were to perform] service and homage with every kind of brūna
... with monasteries (and) servants and wherever [he] *makes those lord buddhas
... on the relics [of ...] he makes bodies (and) lord buddhas, and those
... with parasols, awnings, banners, bouquets, wreaths, flowers, incense ...

recto.line: /// · ā mi stāṃ hvā ṣḍä ya ni :
|| ā śiʾ rī su reṃ dra kṣī a hvā ṣṭyau pū ri pā
ḍai ve la kä ą̄ na au dä ṣiʾ bu ri u va ysaṃ ba tī jsāṃ ṣṣą̄ ma ñä gī stai u paʾ jsū a vā ysai hi mye dva drai jų̄ na ma tu ha stä
yi ḍi drā ma drā maṃ a haṃ bu są na sa lā hve cu pū rä na ni haṃ bu sī dä saṃ e ṣṭyai si kṣī ra va śūʾ bā ḍä ṣṭi hvā ṣṭāṃ
ttą̄ gva vāṃ na ni vi stā tai va ña ttā mi sa li bi rgaṃ da ra tsvai si kī rä va ya nīṃ khu pyaṃ tsā ṣṭa tsve hi mi cu va jsā rä byau dai
ī me tvī tvī tī vā ṣṭa ha jsau dai u ṣaʾ pū rä ma ra kṣī ką̄ na jä su śiʾ rī hī ya mi jṣe hī yau sti khu vā bi rgaṃ da ra ą̄
na ā tū va ra bi śa ą̄ nai byau dai cvaṃ pā hva ḍāṃ da sta rrä ni śā ñä ye ī pā tcī ni śā tai ttye mi jṣe va vā ttā gu ttyau jsa
jaṃ pha pra cā pa na ta u paṃ tsai bi sta se rya thau na pa ji stā dä u pra bhe ā śiʾ rī yī vi nī ya bha drä gvā rä nā te pī ḍa kä
pa deṃ dä si cu vā pra cā pa na māṃ de a ysī hā gva ścī i mi ra saṃ ttaṃ dī drai kū sa ga naṃ hau rya rä u drai kū sa mau u thau
bi stä chā u ṣiʾ ni hā ā śiʾ rī vi nī ya bha drä ttā gu ttāṃ hi rä niṃ hau ḍä u ṣaʾ ṃpū rä su da na ā śi rī pū rä na kha ra gi rye
śā tcau ba ysga thau na ttā gu tai drai thau na ha tca stāṃ dä va ña hā ṣaʾ ṃpū rä vi nau mau kṣa ṣṭa cyaṃ mau hau ḍä stū rä jsā rä kṣi kū sa

/// ·ā mistāṃ hvā(ṣṭāṃ) (vara) (ha)ṣḍä yani :
|| āśiʾrī sureṃdra kṣī a
hvāṣṭyau pūri pā-
ḍai velakä ą̄na audä ṣiʾ buri uvaysaṃbatī jsāṃ ṣṣą̄mañä gīstai u paʾjsū avāysai himye dva drai jų̄na ma tuhastä
yiḍi drāma drāma-ṃ ahaṃbusąna salā hve cu pūräna ni haṃbusīdä saṃ eṣṭyai si kṣīra vaśūʾ bāḍä ṣṭi hvāṣṭāṃ
ttą̄gvavāṃ na ni vistātai vaña ttā misali birgaṃdara tsvai si kīrä va yanīṃ khu pyaṃtsāṣṭa tsve himi cu va jsārä byaudai
īme tvī tvī-t-ī vāṣṭa hajsaudai u ṣaʾ pūrä mara kṣī ką̄najä su(reṃdrä) (ā)śiʾrī hīya mijṣe hīyausti khu vā birgaṃdara ą̄-
na ātū vara biśa ą̄nai byaudai cvaṃ pā hvaḍāṃda starrä niśāñä ye ī pātcī niśātai ttye mijṣe va vā ttāguttyau jsa
jaṃpha pracā panata u paṃtsai bista serya thauna pajistādä u prabhe āśiʾrī-y-ī vinīyabhadrä gvārä nāte pīḍakä
padeṃdä si cu vā pracā panamāṃde aysī hā gvaścī imi ra saṃ ttaṃdī drai kūsa ganaṃ hauryarä u drai kūsa mau u thau
bistä chā u ṣiʾ ni hā āśiʾrī vinīyabhadrä ttāguttāṃ hirä ni-ṃ hauḍä u ṣaʾ-ṃ pūrä sudana āśirī pūräna khara girye
śā tcau baysga thauna ttāgutai drai thauna hatcastāṃdä vaña hā ṣaʾ-ṃ pūrä vinau mau kṣaṣṭa cyaṃ mau hauḍä stūrä jsārä kṣi kūsa
tops

translation.line: ... the spāta ... I make a report ...
The reverend Sureṃdra the kṣī I — O masters(?), raised a son
from when he was a child till (now). He, for his part, helped him to be initiated in monkhood(?). And there was much ... for me. Two or three times he has ...-ed them here(?).
He spoke such and such unfitting words to me as do not suit a boy: You have only endured(?), in the land it is an evil time.
I did not place (him?) for (our) masters the Tibetans(?). Now Misala has gone to you in Birgaṃdara (thinking): I shall do work. If I were to go henceforth, whatever grain I may have obtained,
all that I would have gathered (and sent) hither. And that son here, the kṣī of Kna, the wife of the reverend Sureṃdra ... But when I came to Birgaṃdara,
I found (him?) there in the house. Next, the ... which they ate, would have been to be thrown away. Next I threw it away. But over that wife of his there
arose causes for quarrel from the Tibetans, and they requested from him *five cloths of twenty ... And ... the reverend Vinīyabhavä took the case.
He made a written statement (as follows): Whatever pretexts may arise, I shall decide it for them. And you just give me as much as three kūsas (of) wheat and three kūsas (of) wine and (of) cloth
twenty chās. And the reverend Vinīyabhava gave/paid them, the Tibetans, nothing. And the son, with the son the reverend Sudana bought one female donkey(?),
four thick cloths. The Tibetans canceled three cloths. Now the son has delivered ... six kūsas of grain for the pack animal(s).

comments.comment: Hoernle, MR., pp. 400-2, pl. xvii. On the back Tib. Takeuchi, 1998a, p. 115 no. 358; 1997, p. 177.

recto.line: : rru śta vī ra ba ste : pa je nu kū ri gu ṇyau jsa ṣṭi ma
nā ta : sū ha vą̄ na ā yī mā ma ne : ni vā hī ye śu kye a hvyā ñe
saṃ tsā rū baṃ da ni śā la gu chą̄ me ū di śā yi : śrā vi ki prra tī ka bu
dha yā pa rrī ya bha vā gra ā sta na ka au di a vī śa bū re ysyā me ysi
rū ña ma raṃ rā śaʾ tsū ti : dra hi ṣka lī ysi ma śaṃ de : hye su hiʾ śi re
ki ṇa : dra yau tti ra di ryau jsa haṃ phva : bi śi pī rmā ttą ma baʾ ysā ni baʾ
ysū śti kū śāʾ ṃ : hvā ña ri ma ni ttā : hvā ña ri : cu bū rāṃ ji ttā ha re
baʾ ysū śti va ski u pa ką rṇä śtā ki hi māṃ de : tti khu ysī ri āʾ jsaṃ raṃ na mu ra
mī rā heʾ : ha rbī śū raṃ na mau ra a spū rri hi māṃ de : ma na ttā haṃ di rye rrā śiʾ
hi mā ma ne : ma braṃ gą rā : ma dī ri gū tti rya : ma ka sta ra : ma na ttā a gyau prra ttya
gyau jsi vā rū ḍya hi mā ma ne : bai śi ysaṃ thi va ṣṭāṃ ttā hī ya da steṃ ra naṃ caṃ dā
vą ña mvī ri mā ñaṃ daṃ hi māṃ de : a vą̄ mā vāṃ ttą ta : hi mā te : a vi mā vi pa tsą̄
ma : a vi mā taṃ dā kṣaʾ ṇya : ma ni ttā hī si rrā śiʾ hi mą̄ ma ne : ma ni ttā baʾ
ysū ñä a ysmū pa nā śą̄ ma ni ma māʾ śdiʾ : ma prra ṇą hą̄ na : bai śä ysaṃ thi va ṣṭi
ttā sū dhą na eʾ ysā nai mā ñaṃ dä rra ṣṭą sa da bhū tti pī sā ka lyą̄ ni nai ttri bye hą̄
mi ne : ttrą̄ mū ā rā hye yi ną̄ ma ne khu na mau ma hā sthą̄ ni prrā pta bau dhi sa
tva : ci rą̄ mi ā ryā vą lau kyi tte śva rä bau dha sa tva māʾ śdäʾ : ā kā śą ga rbhi hau
vą : ksiʾ tti ga rbhi cą rya : si ma tti bha dri vi mū haʾ : ma ji śrī prra ṇą hą̄ na : u
ma ttā mą̄ nī hi māṃ de : dä di rū jsaṃ ttā rra ysgi vī vi nī yą̄ ttrvā sti yi ną̄
ma ne khu na mau bhai ṣa ją rā ji bau dha sa tva ttrā ste : ttrā mą ttā są tvā bā
ji ka rmi ā va rṇa kau ce : ba śdeʾ ṣą dā vā dī śeʾ yi ną̄ ma ne : khu na mau
a kṣu bi ja sti baʾ ysi dī śeʾ : ttrą̄ mą ttā sa tvā bā ji du kha ka rye bu
ḍi yi nā mi ne khu na mau ma hā kā rṇa kä śā kya māṃ ja stą̄ na ja sta baʾ ysi
bu ḍä bau dha sa tvä cä ryā yi jsą̄ na : dä dä ri ttā rra ysgą vī baʾ ysū śtā
ṣṭa a vi ṣī bye hā ma ne : khu na mau ā ryā mai ttrai bau dhi sa tva bī de : ttrą̄
mū ttā bau dha kṣaiʾ ttri hi mā ne khu sva hā vą lau vi dā : tti ri ṣṭā pū ña
ku śi la mū la na mau a rmyā yi ja sti baʾ ysa va ri ysī nī yi bā yāṃ ma ri ṇa
kā lā byā ti hi mā de : si ma tti ve rau ci nāṃ bai di māʾ sdīʾ ji bāʾ yi bī
rā śīʾ : vī nā na ṣaʾ māṃ de dā vī jāṃ tca mą ña va sū sī de : ttye a dhe ṣṭą̄
na : hū na mą̄ ña di bai śi cāʾ yi mī rī ci mą̄ ñaṃ di są rva dha rmi ttu śā pa ysā ną̄ ma
ne : u pā yi kau śi la ną̄ ma pā rą̄ me haṃ bī rāṃ de da sau
bhų mi da sau paʾ ñä : vi gi hi bau dha dha rma haṃ bī rāṃ de : haṃ ba ḍa ā vaṃ
ni bai śi sa rva są tva u ysnau ra ysi ma śa dya baʾ ysi hi māṃ de : ttą hvą̄ ña ri tti pā
dvī lai ca drā ka ra bha drra sī he
me he tta tti ną̄ ma ni dą̄ ni ve baʾ ysi hi mā ma ne || :
|| ā śaʾ ryī ā ysdi yi nī ryau : tti tti ną̄ ma ni dą̄ ni ve ṣṭā re ka lyą̄ na mai ttri ā śaʾ rī pa
ḍau ysą̄ ña jsi : si ma gri kā śi vi trī bi saṃ gą pa ha ū si hyā di
pū jā ka rmyau jsi hva hvą ṣṭāṃ ā śaʾ ryāṃ tti raṃ da rą drū nā pa rī dą brrī ṣṭi :
a ysmya jsā ṣṭā : su hiʾ sī ra vā saṃ du rṣṭī prra vā rṇa ji bā ḍi pa
chī śāʾ re : ki mi jsi bī saṃ gī ji geʾ jsi ā śaʾ rya : ma ri ū vā rye
ma hā cai tti paṃ na byau dāṃ di dye : dą̄ ni ve au di tti pa stāṃ di a sthī ye
si : mā nī vā jsāṃ pā dra yvā raṃ nvā ū vā rä vi stā rya pa dya pū ña kū
śi la mū la śi ḍe de yi dha rma kṣaʾ mī di yū ḍe : ū tva ḍi re jsa bī
saṃ gī ji geʾ pa rysi vi ri : ttye hai ra prra cā yi ną pa ḍāṃ da bī saṃ gą ni ā
śaʾ rya ni ma drrā di : u vā rą na baʾ ysū ñi a ysmya ni : ne maṃ drū ni pa
stāṃ di a ha vā ysye : khī nā ni mi ñāṃ di : kī ḍa bū rāṃ jsą ṣṭāṃ pa
jsaṃ brrī yā pa chī śāʾ re • vi ñā ṣṭāṃ hi ma dā ha ma dā ttā ṣṭi pa rī di ni maṃ
dre : stya ji kā la pa rī di ā rau śeʾ : pā rśaʾ pą jsaṃ dā śe : bī saṃ gni
vā jsāṃ pā ā śaʾ rya ttā ṣṭi pū ṣi pa rsya ri : cai tyi vaṃ dą nā ṣṭi tti ri
vā jsāṃ pā tti na mau ja stāṃ baʾ ysāṃ bau dha są tvāṃ : de va ttāṃ pa rvā lā :
pą jsą mi pū jā ka rma a rmū vya ri pa rṇā mya ri : ttā ṣṭi pū ṣi pa rsya ri
saṃ ga sthā ñā ṣṭi : tti ri vā jsā ni pā tta hva hva sthą̄ na ve ā ysnā
vī rä pā ri hī ryau : dā ni vā gī haʾ ni pā rśaʾ pą jsaṃ pa jā ysī ryau :
sa rvū pa ką rṇi pę ṇḍvā na : dą̄ ni ve vā jsą̄ ni pā au di tti pa stāṃ di
a sthī ye : ci ma tvā śaṃ dai pū ña kū śi la mū la hi mya ī de :
ci ra haiʾ tti dra yvā ra nvā pū ña kū śi la mū la yu ḍā dū ą̄ ma ·e
ci ma ttyāṃ dva pa dya «†pū» pų ṇyä jñā ni saṃ bhā rāṃ saṃ grī ttāṃ pū ñāṃ kū śi la mū lā hī ya tvā rā hi mya
ī : au di bva śte baʾ ysū śti bū re jsā ṣṭā pū ña kū śi la mū la
ttā hi re si mą gri kā śi vi trī bī saṃ gna haṃ brrī hā re :
ā śaʾ rī ā staṃ na yā vi au di są rva ni vāʾ ña bū re :
pū ña kū śi la mū la :

transcription.prose:
: rruśta vīra baste : pajenu kūri-guṇyau jsa (ha)ṣṭi ma-
nāta : sūhavą̄na āyīmāmane : nivā hīye śukye ahvyāñe
saṃtsārū baṃdaniśāla guchą̄me ūdiśāyi : śrāviki-prratīka-bu-
dha-yā parrīya bhavāgra āstanaka audi avīśa būre ysyāme ysi-
rūña maraṃ rāśaʾ tsūti : drahiṣkalī ysimaśaṃde : hye suhiʾ śire
kiṇa : drayau ttiradiryau jsa haṃphva : biśi pīrmāttąma baʾysāni baʾ-
ysūśti kūśāʾṃ : hvāñari ma ni ttā : hvāñari : cu būrāṃ ji ttāhare
baʾysūśti vaski upakąrṇä śtāki himāṃde : tti khu ysīri āʾjsaṃ raṃna mura
mīrāheʾ : harbīśū raṃna maura aspūrri himāṃde : ma na ttā haṃdirye rrāśiʾ
himāmane : ma braṃgąrā : ma dīri-gūttirya : ma kastara : ma na ttā agyau prrattya-
gyau jsi vārūḍya himāmane : baiśi ysaṃthi va ṣṭāṃ ttā hīya dasteṃ rana-ṃ caṃdā-
vąña mvīri māñaṃda-ṃ himāṃde : avą̄māvāṃ ttąta : himāte : avimāvi patsą̄-
ma : avimāta-ṃ dākṣaʾṇya : ma ni ttā hīsi rrāśiʾ himą̄mane : ma ni ttā baʾ-
ysūñä aysmū panāśą̄mani ma māʾśdiʾ : ma prraṇąhą̄na : baiśä ysaṃthi vaṣṭi
ttā sūdhąna eʾysānai māñaṃdä rraṣṭą sadabhūtti pīsā kalyą̄ninaittri byehą̄-
mine : ttrą̄mū ārāhye yiną̄mane khu namau mahāsthą̄niprrāpta baudhisa-
tva : cirą̄mi āryāvąlaukyitteśvarä baudhasatva māʾśdäʾ : ākāśągarbhi hau-
vą : ksiʾttigarbhi cąrya : simattibhadri vimūhaʾ : majiśrī prraṇąhą̄na : u
ma ttā mą̄nī himāṃde : dädirū jsa-ṃ ttā rraysgi vī vinīyą̄ ttrvāsti yiną̄-
mane khu namau bhaiṣająrāji baudhasatva ttrāste : ttrāmą ttā sątvā bā-
ji karmi āvarṇa kauce : baśdeʾ ṣądāvā dīśeʾ yiną̄mane : khu namau
akṣubi jasti baʾysi dīśeʾ : ttrą̄mą ttā satvā bāji dukha karye bu-
ḍi yināmine khu namau mahākārṇakä śākyamāṃ jastą̄na jasta baʾysi
buḍä baudhasatvä cäryāyi jsą̄na : dädäri ttā rraysgą vī baʾysūśtā-
ṣṭa aviṣī byehāmane : khu namau āryāmaittrai baudhisatva bīde : ttrą̄-
mū ttā baudhakṣaiʾttri himāne khu svahāvą lauvidā : ttiri ṣṭā pūña
kuśilamūla namau armyāyi jasti baʾysa vari ysīnī yi bāyāṃ mariṇa-
kālā byāti himāde : simattiveraucināṃ baidi māʾsdīʾji bāʾyi bī-
rāśīʾ : vīnā naṣaʾmāṃde dāvījā-ṃ tcamąña vasūsīde : ttye adheṣṭą̄-
na : hūna mą̄ñadi baiśi cāʾyi mīrīci mą̄ñaṃdi sąrvadharmi ttuśā paysāną̄ma-
ne : upāyi-kauśila ną̄ma pārą̄me haṃbīrāṃde dasau
bhųmi dasau paʾñä : vigihi baudhadharma haṃbīrāṃde : haṃbaḍa āvaṃ
ni baiśi sarvasątva uysnaura ysimaśadya baʾysi himāṃde : ttą hvą̄ñari tti pā
dvīlai cadrākara-bhadrrasīhe
mehe tta-tti-ną̄mani dą̄nive baʾysi himāmane || :
|| āśaʾryī āysdi yinīryau : tti-tti-ną̄mani dą̄nive ṣṭāre kalyą̄namaittri āśaʾrī pa-
ḍauysą̄ña jsi : simagri kāśivitrī bisaṃgą paha ūsihyādi
pūjākarmyau jsi hva hvą ṣṭāṃ āśaʾryāṃ ttiraṃdarą drūnā parīdą brrīṣṭi :
aysmya jsā ṣṭā : suhiʾ sīravā saṃdurṣṭī prravārṇaji bāḍi pa-
chīśāʾre : kimi jsi bīsaṃgīji geʾ jsi āśaʾrya : mari ūvārye
mahācaitti paṃna byaudāṃdi dye : dą̄nive audi tti pastāṃdi asthīye
si : mānī vā jsāṃ pā drayvā raṃnvā ūvārä vistārya padya pūña kū-
śilamūla śiḍe deyidharma kṣaʾmīdi yūḍe : ūtvaḍire jsa bī-
saṃgīji geʾ parysi viri : ttye haira prracāyiną paḍāṃda bīsaṃgąni ā-
śaʾrya nimadrrādi : uvārąna baʾysūñi aysmyani : nemaṃdrūni pa-
stāṃdi ahavāysye : khīnā ni miñāṃdi : kīḍa būrāṃ jsą ṣṭāṃ pa-
jsaṃ brrīyā pachīśāʾre • viñā ṣṭāṃ himadā hamadā ttāṣṭi parīdi nimaṃ-
dre : styaji kāla parīdi ārauśeʾ : pārśaʾ pąjsaṃ dāśe : bīsaṃgni
vā jsāṃ pā āśaʾrya ttāṣṭi pūṣi parsyari : caityi-vaṃdąnāṣṭi ttiri
vā jsāṃ pā tti namau jastāṃ baʾysāṃ baudhasątvāṃ : devattāṃ parvālā :
pąjsąmi pūjākarma armūvyari parṇāmyari : ttāṣṭi pūṣi parsyari
saṃgasthāñāṣṭi : ttiri vā jsāni pā tta hva hva sthą̄na ve āysnā
vīrä pārihīryau : dānivā gīhaʾni pārśaʾ pąjsaṃ pajāysīryau :
sarvūpakąrṇi pęṇḍvāna : dą̄nive vā jsą̄ni pā audi tti pastāṃdi
asthīye : ci ma tvā śaṃdai pūña kūśilamūla himya īde :
cira haiʾtti drayvā ranvā pūña kūśilamūla yuḍādū ą̄ma(n)e
ci ma ttyāṃ dva padya pųṇyäjñānisaṃbhārāṃ saṃgrīttāṃ pūñāṃ kūśilamūlā hīya tvārā himya
ī : audi bvaśte baʾysūśti būre jsā ṣṭā pūña kūśilamūla
ttāhire simągri kāśivitrī bīsaṃgna haṃbrrīhāre :
āśaʾrī āstaṃna yāvi audi sąrva nivāʾña būre : (jsā) (ṣṭā)
pūña kūśilamūla :

translation.line: ... bound to the kingdom. We wish for the eight pleasant commodities [devoid of?] the five ... guṇas with a view to ... of ...
escaping from the prison of saṃsāra. The śrāvaka-pratyeka-buddha-yāna
deliverance he went under the rule of birth from the bhavāgra down to the avīcī hell (and)
pitiful death. For the sake of the benefit and happiness of the three-tiered earth
We seek the very foremost bodhi of the buddhas. Speak! Do not speak! As many
upakaraṇas they need for the pure bodhi, such as gold, silver, coins,
pearls, all the jewels and coins will be complete for them. May we not come under the rule of others! Not braṃgaras, not in an inferior family, not lowly, nor may we
be lacking in aṅgas and pratyaṅgas. Throughout all births, by their hand (= help), may they be jewels
like the cintāmaṇi jewel. May there be immeasurable wealth for them, immeasurable abandonment,
immeasurable dākṣiṇeya. May we not come under the rule of greed for those. May we not
destroy their buddha (bodhi) mind, nor (their) compassion, nor (their) vows. Throughout all births
may we, like Prince Sudhana, obtain truthful ..., teachers, (and) kalyānamitras.
May we be able to please them the way hail! the bodhisattva Mahāsthānaprāpta, thus the bodhisattva Āryāvalokiteśvara’s compassion, Ākāśagarbha’s power,
Kṣitigarbha’s career, Samantabhadra’s deliverance, Mañjuśrī’s vows. And
may we not envy them. May we be able to deliver as many of them quickly across the vaineyas
as hail! the bodhisattva Bhaiṣajarāja delivered. May we be able to confess as ransom for those beings such
the lord buddha Akṣobhya confessed. May we be able to carry as ransom for those beings such woes and hardships
as hail! Mahākārṇaka Śākyamuni the Buddha, lord of lords,
carried in his career. May we quickly
obtain so much abhiṣeka for us toward bodhi as hail! the bodhisattva Āryamaitreya obtained.
May *there be for us such a one of their buddhakṣetras like the Sukhāvati lokadhātu. So many merits
(and) roots of goodness may we bring before hail! the bodhisattva Amitāyu into his safe-keeping, (and)
may they be remembered at the time of our death. May Samantavairocana extend (his) rays of compassion upon us.
May the vaineyas be extinguished for us. May the eyes of the Law be purified for us. By his firm support (adhiṣṭhāna)
may we recognize that like a dream all dharmas are empty, all (are) like magic (and) illusion. May they fulfill the pāramitā called upāya-kauśalya (skill in the means of salvation), the ten
earths, the ten powers. May they fulfill the ... buddha-dharmas. Their wishes fulfilled,
may all living beings become buddhas in the world. Speak thus: Then
may we, the donors such-and-such ([34a] the dvaipiṭika Cadrākara-bhadrasīha), become buddhas.
Reverend ones, protect him! There are the donors such-and-such, the kalyānamitra, reverend, from the beginning.
May the entire Kāśavitria bhikṣu-saṅgha deign to ripen (their roots of goodness?)
by (their) pūjā-karmas. They deign to ask (whether) the bodies of the reverend ones each and every one are healthy.
May it be in (their?) mind. They count happiness, satisfaction, and contentedness at the time (in the land) of ...
The reverend ones from ... from the bhikṣu-saṅgha assembly. Here
they obtained the seing of the front(?) of the exalted mahācaitya. They deigned utter to the donor:
Let them please make for us then in the Three Jewels merits and roots of goodness in extensive manner,
in the service of the bhikṣu-saṅgha assembly. For that reason they invited previously the reverend ones of the bhikṣu-saṅgha. With exalted buddha mind the deigned
extend the invitation. They did not consider ... Very many of them
count .... Now they deign ever and again to send you invitations.
They deign to ... the *harsh times. The service and worship are completed. But then
(you) the reverend ones of the bhikṣu-saṅgha must get away (and go back) to your caitya-vandana. But
you must then congratulate and ripen so much worship and pūjā-karma
for the hail! lord buddhas, bodhisattvas, deities, and guardian (deities). You must get away (and go back) to your
saṅgha-sthāna. And then, each in his own place and on his own seat,
you must practice restraint. You must enjoy service and worship with the help of the donors:
sarvopakaraṇas (all utilities of life) by begging. The donors then deign to utter thus:
Whatever there may have been here (on?) this earth,
as many merits and roots of goodness as we may have performed earlier in the Three Jewels,
whatever conveyance there may have been here of those two-fold puṇya-jñāna-sambhāras, the merits and roots of goodness that have been ...-ed.
Until bodhi has been realized the pure merits and roots of goodness
they will share with the entire Kāśivitra bhikṣusaṅgha.
The reverend ... and the others, until sarvanirvāṇa

comments.comment: Scroll. With Kha. i.221 (IOL Khot S. 28). Doctrinal text. b-side Chinese Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra and one line Tib. Takeuchi, 1998a, p. 112 no. 350; 1997, I, p. 173. Kha. i.158 contains lines 1-22 and Kha. i.221 lines 23-61; combined text:
Piece of paper; largest measurements 29x14 cm. Rests of two Chin. seals at one edge. At opposite edge traces of one line of akṣaras:
Piece of paper; largest measurements ca. 7x7 cm. Three lines of writing:

translation.line: “To the gracious lord I make a report: ...
this you see. Now (it is) my fifth year ... (my)
I was not guilty of ... That ...
To (my) mother and (my) brother, the [reverend] prior ...
to (my) son I do honor with my forehead ... (?)
nor did I finish the one to you according to ...
... for me seven; a half cloth ...
went [to ...], there is much hardship for me/them here ...
all those who are leaving me behind ...
... eight ... for him good ... Of the month of [...]
the 11th day the order went out] to you.
to (my) mother now to you(?) and the prior ...

translation.line: “... in the body there is life ...”
“... and he said to him in a gāthā: ...”
“... quickly he dismounted from the chariot [and ...] to ...”
“... and in detail [explained] to him [the cause?] of the illness ...”

comments.comment: Uigur Brahmi from Astana. The two fragments Ast. vii.2.026 and vii.2.027 (InAs., II, p. 662) were orig-inally allotted to the British Museum and numbered Or.8212/1633 and 1634, but were transferred to the India Office Library in 1970. The present location of Ast. vii.2.026 is not known.

recto.line: śri ra ṣṭa sya pa ṭa dhi ṣṭi ca pa ri śa

transcription.prose: śriraṣṭasya paṭa dhiṣṭi capariśa

comments.comment: “No. 5371 22.x.1912.” Sanskrit inscription on silk strip from the Tunhuang Limes (47x4 cm; inscr. 7.5 cm). Ser. II, pp. 701-4, 782-83, pl. XXXIX. Konow, 1939, p. 3. M. Boyer in Serindia, p. 702, read it as [ai]ṣṭasya paṭa giṣṭi ṣapariśa, and Stein interpreted paṭa giṣṭi ṣapariśa as “piece of cloth 46 spans,” referring to the roll of silk mentioned in a Chinese inscription. Konow read the inscription as:
The same as Kharoṣṭhī diṣṭi, a measure acc. to Konow.
